detailedDescription:
A wonderful, two bedroom, two bathroom, executive apartment located in this modern development of Feltham.

You can book a viewing for this property instantly, 24/7, via the Purplebricks website.

Bright, spacious and presented in immaculate condition throughout, this wonderful property is offered to the market in show home like condition throughout.

The accommodation comprises a spacious, open plan reception/dining/kitchen, modern kitchen has a range of fitted units. Both bedrooms are doubles with the master bedroom benefiting from a modern en-suite shower room.
Off the hallway is the master bathroom, with three-piece suite and shower over the bath.

The flat comes with the benefit of allocated parking space and ample free on road parking.
Service Charge - £135/ month
Ground Rent - £128/year

Hayden Court is a very popular development, conveniently located close to all amenities and transport links giving access into Staines, Ashford, Hounslow. Feltham high street is short distance away.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 6 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An exciting opportunity to acquire one of the ever popular "Carrington" style 1930's semi-detached family homes, which has been lived in by the same family since the 1950s. Excellent size rooms, great potential to improve, a popular residential location and a lovely large rear garden are all features of this lovely property.

For Sale:

If you are looking for space and potential then this house has it! The room sizes as one can see from our floor plan below are generous and the potential to improve and extend is clear from other properties in the road which have taken advantage of these home's potential. The accommodation to the ground floor consists of two excellent size reception rooms, a conservatory, kitchen and downstairs toilet, with the living room to the front benefiting from the large bay window. To the first floor there are two big double and one sizeable single bedrooms served by a family bathroom and separate wc. The central heating is gas fired to radiators, the windows are mainly replacement double glazing although our clients have taken care to retain the lovely stained glass original windows to the side.
Outside: There is a good front garden with mature tree, the shared access side driveway leads to a good size garage, set slightly to the rear of the house. The lovely garden is well laid out with a decent lawned area leading to a large former vegetable plot set to the rear. In all extending to approx 70ft.

Location:

Park Road is a popular residential road located close to the Hounslow/Whitton borders with Hounslow main line station, local amenities and Murray park are all nearby.
The close proximity of Whitton, Hounslow, Twickenham and Isleworth town center's make this a conveniently located property.

detailedDescription:
Studio Apartment with Seperate Sleeping Area | 384 sq.ft | 0.3 miles to Hounslow Central Station | Daytime Concierge | Allocated Parking

This apartment offers a perfect opportunity for First Time Buyers to make their move into a large and elegant studio apartment! Buy to Let Investors also have a chance to receive great returns on their investment, with high demand for rental properties and approx. 5% Rental Yield. With quality in mind the apartment comes with real oak timber flooring and brushed metallic detail giving the space an elegant finish. The open-plan layout makes the most of your space and the floor to ceiling windows ensures the apartment stays light and airy.

As well as coming with a secure video phone entry system, the living space offers the chance to install Sky and Freeview devices to suit your preference and access to the communal atrium, as well as cycle storage facilities.

On Hounslow’s doorstep, Trinity Square isn’t far from the local shopping centre and street food markets. It takes just under 5 minutes to reach Hounslow Central station, and from there Hyde Park Corner is half an hour away, and Heathrow a mere 10 minutes.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
An exceptional six bedroom semi-detached family home that features a stunning kitchen/family room overlooking a private 48' lawned garden and newly built garage located within one of Chiswick's most desirable residential areas.

The accommodation comprises: Outer entrance hallway with double doors to spacious entrance hallway, 17'4 reception room with feature fireplace, guest cloakroom, 20'10 kitchen/family room with bi-folding doors overlooking garden with further potential for side return (subject to usual consents).

Stairs to First Floor
20'8 bedroom with private 20' terrace, 17'4 bedroom with feature bay window connecting to 11'11 dressing room
ursery/study and well appointed family bathroom with feature roll-top bath and separate shower cubicle.

Stairs to Second Floor
19'7 bedroom with attractive rooftop views, 12'6 bedroom, 10'10 bedroom, large storage/airing cupboard and well appointed family shower room.

Gardens & Garage
The house enjoys a large decked patio area accessed directly from the kitchen/family room thus providing excellent inside/outside entertaining. Beyond the decking is a lawned garden with planted borders leading to a recently built 22'5 spacious single garage with electric roller door with direct access from Ramillies Road. The property also enjoys side access from the landscaped front garden.

Rusthall Avenue is located within an area of Chiswick known as Bedford Park Borders which is ideally situated for access to the amenities of central Chiswick including over sixty bars & restaurants, extensive shopping on Chiswick High Road and Turnham Green Terrace and excellent transport connections into and out of town.

About chiswick.....

Chiswick is a hugely popular and prosperous large suburb of West London located on the northern side of the River Thames, 6 miles (9.7 km) west of Charing Cross.

Whilst retaining a wonderful village charm, Chiswick is a vibrant area brimming with the activity and opportunity typical of London.

Chiswick boasts a stunning range of property including elegant Georgian architecture, renowned Norman Shaw designed Bedford Park houses to quaint cottages in the Glebe Estate.

Chiswick High Road offers a fantastic range of bars, restaurants, supermarkets, an ever-expanding range of delis and boutiques.

About Harpers of Chiswick….

Bespoke property solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

What is the difference between Harpers of Chiswick and generic estate agents?
Customers expectations have moved on whilst most estate agents haven’t changed in fifty years. Harpers of Chiswick is a property consultancy and not just an estate agents. We deliver a multi-faceted ‘everything is possible’ approach to Chiswick residential property. We offer all the services that you would expect, but many more..”

We manage all the maintenance for your own home, not just the properties we let. We call it ‘Home Assist’.
We can feed your cat, put the bins out and open the curtains when you go on holiday. Your ‘Holiday Guardian’.
We can even hold a set of your house keys, just in case you lock yourself out! Fully licensed ‘Key Holding’.
Property Staging and Interior Design by our in-house team to maximise your investment.
Private Introductions for clients and customers in the public eye who seek ultimate discretion.

Even our fee structures are designed to favour our clients. “Your sense of value is more important to me than my dreams of a new Ducati.” Sales fees are tiered and linked to results, not old fashioned percentages that favour the agents pocket. Our lettings fees are charged monthly, not annually in advance, and you only pay us if your tenant pays the rent. Innovative terms for modern markets.”

We have no desire to be the largest. We consciously keep our portfolios compact so that we can successfully apply the time, high levels of detail and attention you require and deserve. Excellence for the few rather than a sausage factory for many.

Bespoke solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

address: Edison Court, Warple Way, London W3
detailedDescription:
This fantastic two bedroom apartment, is situated on the top floor of a modern block. It boasts an impressive large terrace with amazing views of the city.

Upon entering the property initially you pass two large storage cupboards, perfect for all your shoes, coats etc. Heading into the living space, to your left you will find two equal large double bedrooms and opposite the modern fitted bathroom.

The entertaining living space is open plan but still slightly segregated, the perfect balance to have your kitchen diner slightly set back from the reception. With floor to ceiling windows on both sides of the room the flat is extremely light, bright and airy. From the reception, you lead straight out onto the terrace, which is large enough to fit your table and chairs for any summer lunch or evening meal when the sun goes down. With views of the city to top of a truly special apartment, visits are highly recommend!

Edison court comes with its EWS1 certification.

The factory quarter is located on the ever evolving Warple way. With the tide wave redevelopment said to be complete by next year the area will be transformed. There are some very exceptional local shops such as The Snack Box for a spot of lunch. Walking distance to amenities on Askew road in Askew village.

Transport links, include Stamford Brook district line station and Acton Central overground for easy in and out of London commutes. The A40/M40 & A4/M4 motorway is also moments away for heading to the county.

We are pleased to confirm that we offer you and all our clients the opportunity to consult with Mortgage Advice Bureau (mab). They are one of the largest mortgage brokers in the country and provide specialist mortgage advice. They can search thousands of mortgage deals to find the right one for you and due to their size have exclusive rates from many lenders that cannot be found on the high street or anywhere else. Mab have won over 70 national awards for the quality of their advice and service during the last five years. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with mab. Should you decide to use mab, The Frost Partnership will receive a referral fee of £300 inclusive of VAT from mab. You will not have to pay anything with regard to this to The Frost Partnership.

Home Legal Services (hls)
We are pleased to confirm that we offer you and all our clients the opportunity to consult with Home Legal Services (hls) for conveyancing services. Hls provide us with a panel of quality conveyancing solicitors who operate on a fixed fee and a no sale, no fee arrangement, with 24/7 online case reports keeping you up to date at all times. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with hls. Should you decide to use hls, The Frost Partnership will receive a referral fee of £250 inclusive of VAT from hls. You will not have to pay anything with regard to this to The Frost Partnership.

detailedDescription:
A three-bedroom semi detached family home situated on Park road.

A large reception room opens from the hallway and features wood flooring and a large bay window, creating a relaxing living space. It boasts traditional features throughout. A second reception room sits to the back of the property with patio doors leading onto the garden.

The first floor comprises three bedrooms, a bright and airy master bedroom. The bedrooms have original features, with the second of the largest benefitting from built-in wardrobes.

Externally there is a exceptionally large rear garden.

Conveniently located within a short' walk to Hounslow Overground Station, it all adds up to a real ''village feel''. By car, one is just a couple of minutes' drive from the A316/M3 and in turn the motorway network is a short drive.

The property is within close proximity to a number of sought after schools (see school checker for full list).

address: St. Marys Crescent, Osterley, Isleworth TW7
detailedDescription: Stewart Hunter are delighted to bring to the market one of the areas finest properties. Situated in St Mary's Crescent in Osterley overlooking 'Jersey Gardens', this detached double fronted and gated family residence boasts six bedrooms, three reception rooms, four bathrooms, double garage and large mature rear garden and comprises over 4000Sqft of accommodation. The property also offers side access and large driveway offering off street parking for several cars leading to a double garage. Upon entering the property a spacious entrance hallway with open foyer awaits, connecting all three receptions rooms and a large utility / gym / cloakroom with internal door access to garage. Underfloor heating is available through the entire ground floor. There is also a well appointed modern fitted kitchen overlooking the rear garden with a range cooker, butler sink and marble worktops. A most beautiful and detailed grand wooden staircase and panelling gives access to the upper floor landing which connects to four double bedrooms, two en-suites & additional family bathroom. The stairway then continues to the second floor and landing giving access to two further bedrooms, eves storage and en-suite bathroom. To the rear there is a generous raised patio area which then steps down to the mature garden with pathway to rear summer house. Viewings are strictly by appointment through the vendors sole agent Stewart Hunter.

New to the market is this generous sized four bedroom mid terrace property. This is a fantastic family home perfect for a growing family. detailedDescription:
A stunning four bedroom, bay fronted Victorian home. This is a beautiful example of a period family home set in a quiet Victorian street on the Old Isleworth/St Margarets borders.

The property is arranged over three floors, with well-proportioned rooms throughout. The ground floor accommodation consists of a lovely through reception room with period features, fireplace, bay window and original coving, a modern and spacious, kitchen/living/dining room with vaulted ceilings, double aspect windows and bi-fold doors leading onto a landscaped secluded west facing rear garden. There is an additional living space to the back of the garden, perfect for a home office.

The first floor offers two good sized double bedrooms and a beautiful four piece family bathroom suite. On the top floor there are a further two double bedrooms, one benefiting from a beautiful shower room and ample storage.

Situated on Eve Road, this property is a 15 minute walk to St Margarets train station and 20 minutes from Twickenham train station and the fast line. There are also lots of fantastic schools nearby.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented 781 Sq Ft / 72 Sq M two double bedroom apartment that features a 25'2 reception room, lift, concierge and underground parking located within a desirable riverside development.

The accommodation comprises: Entrance hallway with storage cupboard, 26'1 reception room with floor to ceiling windows, fully fitted kitchen area within reception area, master bedroom with built-in wardrobes, second double bedroom with built-in wardrobe, large bathroom with separate shower cubicle, underground parking and access to communal garden square.

Ferry Quays is a riverside development located within an area of West London known as Brentford that is well regarding for excellent transport connections into and out of town and Heathrow airport, local shopping and restaurants in Brentford & Chiswick and is conveniently located for easy commuting to the many world headquarters office building along the M4/A4 corridor.

About chiswick.....

Chiswick is a hugely popular and prosperous large suburb of West London located on the northern side of the River Thames, 6 miles (9.7 km) west of Charing Cross.

Whilst retaining a wonderful village charm, Chiswick is a vibrant area brimming with the activity and opportunity typical of London.

Chiswick boasts a stunning range of property including elegant Georgian architecture, renowned Norman Shaw designed Bedford Park houses to quaint cottages in the Glebe Estate.

Chiswick High Road offers a fantastic range of bars, restaurants, supermarkets, an ever-expanding range of delis and boutiques.

About Harpers of Chiswick….

Bespoke property solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

What is the difference between Harpers of Chiswick and generic estate agents?
Customers expectations have moved on whilst most estate agents haven’t changed in fifty years. Harpers of Chiswick is a property consultancy and not just an estate agents. We deliver a multi-faceted ‘everything is possible’ approach to Chiswick residential property. We offer all the services that you would expect, but many more..”

We manage all the maintenance for your own home, not just the properties we let. We call it ‘Home Assist’.
We can feed your cat, put the bins out and open the curtains when you go on holiday. Your ‘Holiday Guardian’.
We can even hold a set of your house keys, just in case you lock yourself out! Fully licensed ‘Key Holding’.
Property Staging and Interior Design by our in-house team to maximise your investment.
Private Introductions for clients and customers in the public eye who seek ultimate discretion.

Even our fee structures are designed to favour our clients. “Your sense of value is more important to me than my dreams of a new Ducati.” Sales fees are tiered and linked to results, not old fashioned percentages that favour the agents pocket. Our lettings fees are charged monthly, not annually in advance, and you only pay us if your tenant pays the rent. Innovative terms for modern markets.”

We have no desire to be the largest. We consciously keep our portfolios compact so that we can successfully apply the time, high levels of detail and attention you require and deserve. Excellence for the few rather than a sausage factory for many.

Bespoke solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

detailedDescription:
Bettermove are pleased to present this charming two bedroom ground floor flat for sale in Hounslow, available with no forward chain.

The property is currently tenanted and can be sold with or without tenants in situ - rental yields can be obtained through Bettermove.

This is a leasehold property with 107 years remaining on the lease; the service charge is £550 per quarter and the ground rent is £50 per year.

The interior of this well-presented property consists of a spacious living room, separate fitted kitchen, two bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is off road parking available in a residents' car park and there are also some communal gardens.

Situated in the sought after town of Hounslow, the property is close to a wide range of local amenities, including shops, supermarkets, restaurants and pubs. Excellent transport links can be found from Hounslow West and Central tube stations on the Piccadilly line, Hounslow mainline station, the A4 and many local bus routes.

This exciting investment opportunity is not to be missed! All enquiries can be made through Bettermove.

You can now secure the sale with a reservation fee of £1,000 which gives you exclusive rights to purchase within a given timeframe.

Paying this fee ensures that the seller takes their property off the market and reserves it exclusively for you, therefore eliminating gazumping and aborted costs.

detailedDescription:
Wonderful well-proportioned ground floor flat with a pretty rear garden.

Location

Whellock Road is situated on the northern edge of Bedford Park. It is 0.5 miles to Turnham Green Underground station (District line) and terrace. There are numerous bus route close by including the E3 to central Chiswick and Ealing. This location offers easy access to central London via the A4, and via the M4 for Heathrow Airport and the west of England. Primary schools nearby include Southfield Primary School.

Description

A superb ground floor flat on a quiet residential street, offering excellent proportions and high ceilings throughout.

Upon entry, there is spacious principal bedroom which is situated at the front of the house, with high ceilings and a bay window to allow for an abundance of natural light. It is of a generous size with two large built-in wardrobes and stylish wooden floors.

The kitchen / reception room is well appointed with integrated modern appliances and opens onto the delightful pretty south facing garden which is a peaceful haven and provides ideal space for outdoor entertaining.

A spacious lateral penthouse flat with a large roof terrace overlooking the river Thames. This immaculate three double bedroom apartment is set within the highly sought-after Lion Court development and is finished to an excellent standard. There is ample storage throughout and three family bathrooms (one of which is en suite to the master bedroom). It includes an open plan kitchen with modern appliances, shared by a spacious reception room with wooden floors, and a large roof terrace boasting views onto the river Thames. The property further benefits from off street parking for two and lift access.

Lion Court is located on the River Thames. Public transport can be found at St Margarets and Isleworth Stations, where South West Trains operate from here providing direct access into Central London.

detailedDescription:
L&Q at High Street Hounslow

Welcome to High Street Quarter

High Street Quarter is an exciting development of one, two, and three-bedroom homes built around a new public square with shops, restaurants, and a state-of-the-art multiplex cinema creating a new lifestyle district on your doorstep.

The development will link the existing high street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new community in the heart of Hounslow. Hounslow East and Hounslow stations are both a few minutes' walk away, with quick links to central London.

Shared Ownership with L&Q at High Street Quarter

These homes are well-positioned for those looking for a step on the property ladder, with 1,2, and 3 bedroom homes available through Shared Ownership, you can buy your first home with as little as a 25% share.

Built around a new public square, High Street Quarter offers everything you need at your doorstep – making life just that little bit easier. Offering a stepping stone to homeownership in Hounslow the first collection of 1,2 and 3 bedroom Shared Ownership apartments at High Street Hounslow are launching soon.

Part of the emerging West London regeneration corridor

5-min walk to Hounslow Central & 10 minutes to Hounslow East tube stations

detailedDescription:
A wider than average four-bedroom family home on Merton Avenue situated just off the Chiswick High Road.

The house has been sympathetically refurbished by the current owner and offers an excellent balance of reception space to bedroom accommodation. On entry, the hallway leads into a large front to back living & dining room that features an impressive bay window and period fireplace. The kitchen is located to the rear of the property with direct access to the rear garden

On the first floor is a large principal bedroom, with ample built in wardrobes. There are two further bedrooms both with ample storage and a family bathroom on this floor.

The second floor comprises of a large double bedroom with large windows providing vast amounts of natural light. The room has been carefully configured to provide extensive storage space and an en-suite bathroom.

Merton Avenue is located just off the Chiswick High Road and is moments from Stamford Brook and Turnham Green Underground Stations. The High Road offers a vast array of bars, restaurants and shops.

There is likewise a bus service that runs every 4 minutes from the end of the road straight to Hammersmith Broadway where you can take the District and Circle Line, Hammersmith and City or Piccadilly Line services into Central London.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A Chain Free, modern two bedroom ground floor apartment in the popular and sort after area of Parr Court, Castle Way, Hanworth Park.

Description
This modern ground floor apartment is situated in an off street quiet cul de sac location, with well-maintained grounds surrounding the property. Inside the property is complimented by two generous sized double bedrooms, a family bathroom, a large kitchen area, a spacious living room with an ample sized balcony looking onto the beautiful communal gardens. This property will be ideal for a small family, first time buyer and investors looking for a property in a safe quiet location and excellent transport links.

Parr Court benefits from having the H25 bus stop just outside the entrance, but is also within walking distance to Feltham mainline train station with frequent trains to Waterloo ( mins), Feltham Centre shops including supermarkets (Asda, Tesco, Aldi and Lidl), gp surgery, Library, Schools include - Reach Academy (rated 'outstanding' by Ofsted) and Cardinal Infant & Nursery. The property is within close proximity to Heathrow Airport, Hatton Cross underground (Piccadilly Line, zone 6) and the A316 leading to the M3 with access to the M25.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A five bedroom modern townhouse with stunning river views

Location

Enviably positioned between picturesque Kew Green and a beautiful stretch of the River Thames, the house is within just a few hundred metres of Kew Village and the world renowned Royal Botanical Gardens. The Village has a charming atmosphere with a good selection of independent shops and cafes, a monthly market and the Michelin starred 'Glasshouse' restaurant.

Kew Gardens train station is located in the village and is on the District Line tube as well as the overland train to Stratford, via north London. A direct train service to London Waterloo runs from Kew Bridge Station, a few hundred metres away on the other side of Kew Bridge. The M4 motorway can also be accessed just over the bridge.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

Sitting pride of place within this exclusive gated development (of just a handful of properties that were built around 1980) the house is generously proportioned over three floors, providing well planned and practically configured accommodation of over 2300 square feet, that is ideal for both everyday family life and more formal entertaining. The exceptional river views can be enjoyed internally from all of the principal rooms, as well as externally from the two large balconies that come off the main (top floor) bedroom and the first floor living room. There is an excellent flow of natural natural light, afforded by the beautiful open aspects and the large windows.

Other features of particular note include a communal tennis court and gymnasium for the exclusive use of the residents, a resident caretaker and off street parking. As well as the private garden there are beautifully tended communal gardens, that are well established and mainly laid to lawn.

Square Footage: 2301 sq ft

address: Old Manor Drive, Whitton, Twickenham TW7
detailedDescription:
A bright and airy, three bedroom, end of terrace family home having the benefit of a larger than average extended ground floor which leads to a south facing rear garden, ideally situated in this quiet, friendly, residential cul- de- sac on the Whitton/ Isleworth/Hounslow border within the Richmond Borough. There is scope for further extension (stpp)

For Sale:

This extended family home provides a spacious ground floor which features a front aspect living room, separate sitting room which opens onto a dining room, double length kitchen, downstairs cloakroom and lean-to/conservatory. Upstairs, are three good size bedrooms, bathroom and separate WC. Outside, the front garden provides off road parking for two cars with a side, shared driveway leading to a detached garage and a sunny aspect south facing rear garden. Additional features include double glazing and gas central heating. An early viewing is highly recommended to appreciate the size and potential of this fine home.

Location:

Old Manor Drive is a popular, quiet cul-de-sac on the Whitton/Isleworth/Hounslow borders within the Richmond borough. Whitton High Street with its popular shops, cafes and railway station, with its fast link to London Waterloo is within walking distance. Hounslow and Twickenham town centres with their more comprehensive facilities are also close to hand.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
An attractive semi-detached house in Grove Park with five bedrooms, three bathrooms and a fantastic reception / entertaining space downstairs. There is a west-facing garden as well as a sun terrace to the rear of the property.

The ground floor offers substantial space with a charming double reception room with high ceilings and a fireplace. To the rear, the kitchen has been extended with a superb dining area, perfect for entertaining guests as it leads out into the west-facing garden. There is also a separate utility area and WC just off the kitchen.

Upstairs five bedrooms are accompanied by three bathrooms. The master bedroom has plenty of light with a large bay window and an en suite has been added. The furthest room to the rear of the house has direct access onto a roof terrace, which in turn has stairs down into the garden. This would make a great office space for those who work from home.

Located in a family friendly area with local independent shops on Fauconberg Road, and an easy walk up into Chiswick High Road. Gunnersbury Station (Underground) and Chiswick Station (Overground) are both nearby.

address: Watchfield Court, Sutton Court Road, London W4
detailedDescription:
Summary
A beautiful one-bedroom flat in the heart of Chiswick.

Description
A beautiful one-bedroom flat in the heart of Chiswick. A light and airy, quiet second-floor flat in a smart 1930s mansion block with lift. The flat has been well maintained and recently decorated so can be occupied straight away, hassle free.

The property comprises a double bedroom, spacious living room, separate kitchen, bathroom and ample built-in storage. All the rooms of the property look out onto the beautifully maintained communal gardens and fountain.

Within just a couple of minutes' walk you have Chiswick High Road with a good choice of restaurants, bars, and shops, as well as delightful Turnham Green. The property is just a 7-minute walk from Chiswick Park station (District Line), a 10-minute walk from Gunnersbury station (District Line, Overground), and within easy reach of the M4.

The property benefits from excellent schools in the area, including Belmont and Grove Park Primary Schools, both Ofsted outstanding.

Share of freehold (peppercorn ground rent). 172 years remaining on the leasehold title.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This property is being sold via online auction: Please visit the 321 Estates website and click 'Property Auctions'

In order to bid you must do the following via the dashboard:

-Register
-Join the watch list
-Pass an id check
-Enter your details

Prime Freehold Investment Land Plot Feltham Near London Heathrow
Land for Sale within London M25, Plot 138, Snakey Lane, Feltham, TW13 7NB

-Planning gain opportunity
-Ideal self-build potential (STPP)
-Hands free investment prospect
-Great location
-Just 10 minutes from London Heathrow Airport

specific plot details:
You are buying the freehold with:
Absolute title for plot no: 138
approximate size 0.03 Acres - 122sqm (1307sqft)

more details:

-Individual plots of land for investment, currently without planning. - An opportunity to get a building plot + potentially benefit from the planning uplift.
-Secure Gated Access and Suitable Planned Roadways.
-Ideal opportunity for those looking to build their own home or a great investment prospect. - The plot could be used for a variety of uses, subject to obtaining all necessary consents. - Please make your own enquiries with Land Registry, Hounslow Borough Council and Solicitors.
-This plot is part of a larger estate made up of a site totalling approx. 12 acres (4.85 hectares). - The site has been professionally divided into its numbered plots and registered with the Land Registry UK. - Over 200+ plots have already been sold, registered, and mapped in the Land Registry documentation.

Location:
Situated a short drive from the UK's Largest Airport (LHR). Even better yet, it's not in the Heathrow flight path. Please see map images for location details.

-Adjacent to Staines Rugby Football Club and opposite Adrian Hall Garden Centres - Feltham
-Minutes away from the A316 Transport links

Due to the Government's lifting of planning restrictions, land is ripe for development.

Note:

-Please check the corresponding map in the pictures attached to identify this particular plot.
-The Land Registry Title Number in the pictures might not be the title number for this particular plot. The pictures are used for illustration and identification purposes.
-Upon sale, your plot will have a unique title number issued by the Land Registry. Transaction will be done either at Land Registry via Solicitors.
-The purchaser will pay seller's Solicitor fees.

Planning details:
This plot is being sold as an investment, and to date (at least to our knowledge), none of the 200+ owners of plots have applied for planning permission to build. Once all remaining plots have been sold, owners may willingly and collectively apply for planning permission. No owner is compelled to wait for the others, in order to decide what to do with their respective plot, including applying for planning permission. This is not a joint sale, and each plot sale is separate from the others, however we suggest that 200+ applications may have a different impact with the Council. There are overage covenants in place and restrictions with regards to materials used for construction (i.e. Can only be built of brick, stone, cement or similar). Although no one can guarantee the outcome of any planning permission application, we hope this site would take precedent in the local area due to the major lack of affordable housing.

Facts:
The land is currently recognised as greenbelt land which allows development of certain projects (STPP - Subject to Planning Permission). This is something you would need to check online or with the local council.

There are already a couple of different things going on at the land. There are some stables etc. Electric and Water is also present at the location. It is the buyer’s responsibility to integrate to the relevant plot number bought.

Worst Case Scenario Planning Permission is not granted… but you may still benefit from Capital Growth.
Land is a finite resource, (no more is being made) and as such can only increase in value to accommodate the demand.
Land does not shrink, does not deteriorate (even if not used), no one can steal it and cannot be destroyed by fire.

Best Case Scenario Planning Permission is granted… and your property has the potential of increasing in price up to 10 times!

Fact: The value of residential land has increased on average, across the UK, by 926% over the past 20 years (source bbc).

Fact: The value of land has increased more than fivefold since 2008, outstripping the increase in the worth of the properties overlying it (source The Guardian).

Fact: The number of new homes being approved on greenbelt land in England has increased five-fold in the last five years, according to figures obtained by the bbc.
title: Land for sale

address: Lionel Road South, Kew Bridge TW8
detailedDescription:
This gorgeous, two-bedroom apartment is situated on the third floor of Ivy House at Verdo - Kew Bridge, TW8. The open plan kitchen has a composite worktop and splash back, with fitted Siemens and Bosch appliances. Engineered timber floor finishes run throughout, the bedroom features both an ensuite and contemporary fitted wardrobe. This apartment benefits from a large North / West facing balcony.

Verdo - Kew Bridge is a collection of contemporary apartments with access to lifestyle residents' amenities. The development is made up of three beautiful buildings - Ivy, Lily and Jasmine House - all surrounded by private landscaped gardens, allowing you to relax in a green oasis just a quick hop from central London.

Each home has easy access to the spacious residents' lounge, which boasts a work zone and private meeting room. A media room is available for watching films or sporting events, and there is a private residents' gym. The lounge spills directly out to the residents' podium gardens. The sunlit terraces and inviting play areas are ready and waiting to be explored and enjoyed.

The development is located at the heart of Brentford, which is being transformed into a vibrant new neighbourhood with shops, cafes, restaurants. A home at Verdo - Kew Bridge also puts you in touching distance of some of London's best loved high streets, including Kew Village and Chiswick.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
We are pleased to offer this 4 bedroom family house located in the desirable residential Bedford Park borders area of Chiswick. This end of terrace period property still has many of it original features. Spread over 3 floors this property offers over 1500 sq ft as well as a front and back garden.

Chiswick boasts many green spaces including Southfield Playing Fields which is just a few minutes' walk from the house. The expansive playfields include tennis courts, basketball courts, children's play area, football fields, outdoor gym equipment and a small woodland.

There are many travel options within easy reach. Turnham Green Station is just 11 minutes' walk away for London Underground services and South Acton station for London Overground services is around 13 minutes away on foot. By car the A4 and M4 are a short drive away for easy journeys into London's West End or out to the West region of England, Heathrow Airport is around a 30 minute drive away from the property.

Several excellent schools are within walking distance including the two local independent preparatory schools - Orchard House and Bedford Park. The nearest state-run primary school is Southfield Primary School which has a new headmaster and a strong community making it one of the more popular local options. The Ark Priory Primary Academy, which was most recently rated Outstanding by Ofsted is just 0.34 miles away from the property.

Offered to the market with no chain.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription: An impressive semi-detached six bedroom Victorian family house located on a popular road in Grove Park, offering grand proportions and beautiful original period features throughout. There is a substantial amount of living space with the house measuring over 3250 square foot. Arranged over three floors, the accommodation on the ground floor provides a spacious front reception, a dining room, kitchen, a conservatory, a further reception at the rear with French doors out to a wonderful 100-foot south facing garden, a cloakroom, utility and cellar. The first floor offers a spacious landing, a family bathroom and three bedrooms, one with a dressing room and Jack and Jill shower room. There are three further bedrooms located on the second floor, one of which provides an en-suite shower room and access to a large terrace with beautiful views over the gardens. Grove Park Gardens is in a fantastic location within a short walk from Chiswick House & Gardens and The River Thames. The property is conveniently located for access to the A4/M4 and Heathrow airport. Chiswick (South Western Railway) station, Chiswick Park (District Line) station and Chiswick High Road are also within walking distance. There are a number of popular schools located nearby including Grove Park Primary School, Strand-on-the-Green Infant and Nursery School and Chiswick Secondary School.

detailedDescription:
The property will only be sold under Auction contract terms, that means if a pre-auction offer is made and acceptable the buyer must exchange the auction contract immediately and pay a 10% non-refundable deposit and the buyers premium. Completion is usually 28 days thereafter.

Once the legal pack is ready this can be supplied via e-mail. Offers will need to be made in writing to avoid any misunderstanding. Buyers need to be aware of any special conditions within the legal pack involving any sellers legal fees, costs and any auctioneers buyers premium.

Guide prices provide an indication of a seller's minimum expectation. Whilst they are not necessarily figures which a property will sell for and could change at any time prior to auction. Almost every property will be offered subject to a Reserve (the figure below which the Auctioneer cannot sell the property during the auction) which we expect will be set within the Guide Range or no more than 10% above a single figure guide price. The guide price may be subject to variation, bidders are therefor advised to check for any variations.

detailedDescription:
An opportunity to purchase this impressive semi-detached home with flexible living space split over four storeys, including three reception rooms and six bedrooms.

The ground floor has plenty of entertaining space. The double reception room has a high ceiling and an attractive fireplace, creating a quiet and cosy lounge. To the rear, the separate galley kitchen leads though to a bright dining area in the conservatory, with double doors out to a secluded rear garden.

The basement rooms have good head height and offer very flexible family usage. There is a reception area which would work as a home gym, kids playroom or home cinema room. To the back of this is a further double bedroom, and both are serviced by a shower room and storage area.

Upstairs, a superb master suite takes up much of the first floor, complete with a dressing room and an en suite. The second floor has three bedrooms, each offering good storage space and share one bathroom.

Blandford Road runs between The Avenue and Woodstock Road, in the popular Bedford Park area just north of Turnham Green Terrace and Underground Station. A fantastic array of independent shops, cafés and restaurants can be found locally.

Mortgage Advice Bureau (mab)
We are pleased to confirm that we offer you and all our clients the opportunity to consult with Mortgage Advice Bureau (mab). They are one of the largest mortgage brokers in the country and provide specialist mortgage advice. They can search thousands of mortgage deals to find the right one for you and due to their size have exclusive rates from many lenders that cannot be found on the high street or anywhere else. Mab have won over 70 national awards for the quality of their advice and service during the last five years. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with mab. Should you decide to use mab, The Frost Partnership will receive a referral fee of £300 inclusive of VAT from mab. You will not have to pay anything with regard to this to The Frost Partnership.

address: Grove Park Road, Grove Park, Chiswick, London W4
detailedDescription:
**virtual tour available online**

A light and spacious three bedroom maisonette arranged over two floors that boasts a large, beautiful landscaped rear garden. At 1781 Sq' - 165 SqM this property is incredibly generously proportioned throughout and also offers considerable storage space. The proportions of this apartment are similar to those that are found in typical Chiswick houses, the square footage in fact exceeds many homes in the W4 area.

The property enjoys its own private entrance and there is a useful storage cupboard by the front door. The open plan living space is incredibly spacious and light from the many windows and French doors which lead onto the balcony The Dining Room and separate Reception Room are open to one another whilst remaining very much separate spaces. Whilst the Kitchen is separated from the dining and living space a pass-through serving window ensures the spaces are conveniently connected and the window also serves as a breakfast bar. The modern kitchen enjoys ample storage and considerable work top space, and there are several high quality built-in appliances including a gas hob and integrated fridge freezer. Two bedrooms are positioned to the front of the first floor, both are good size double bedrooms with built in wardrobes and large windows fill them with light. There is a modern shower room positioned between the larger of the two bedrooms and the kitchen.

Double doors lead from the Reception Room out on to the Balcony and stairs take you down to the stunning Garden. This beautiful mature garden is an oasis of calm with established plants and ponds, as well as a tucked away al fresco dining area.

The staircase to the second floor is positioned between the Kitchen and the Reception Room and has it's own hallway behind a door, there is also under stair storage. On the top floor the apartment there is a large bedroom suite with a separate walk in wardrobe that is also in use as a study and a generous, bright bathroom. The roof is pitched in places and the beams exposed giving the space character and additional storage space can be found in the eaves.

Located in the very heart of Grove Park, the property is just a few minutes' walk away from Chiswick Station for mainline services for direct services into London Waterloo. There is a useful parade of shops moments from the front door which include a newsagent, dry cleaners and pharmacy. By road the property is well connected with easy access to the A4 and M4 motorway and in the other direction towards Richmond and Kew the A316 is within easy reach.

There are several sporting facilities nearby including Roko Gym and Swimming Pool, Dukes Meadows Golf course and from the various pitches and sports ground there are several football, rugby and hockey teams who play and train nearby regularly.

Chiswick is a popular place to families to seek a home and put down roots for a number of reasons. The local schools are excellent, there is an abundance of green spaces and there is a strong sense of community with regular family friendly events and multiple activities and classes run locally for children of all ages. The nearest primary school is Ofsted rated Outstanding Grove Park Primary School which is just 0.2 miles from the house. Strand-on-the-Green Infant and Nursery School which is also Ofsted rated Outstanding is just 0.5 miles from the property.

One of Chiswick's finest attractions, Chiswick House and Gardens is around a 10 minute walk from the house. The Neo-Palladian House is beautiful to walk around and its grounds are incredibly well kept, free for all to enter. There is a café, children's play area and regular markets are held at the weekends.

Offered to the market with Freehold.

address: Grove Park Road, Chiswick, London W4
detailedDescription:
A sensational three bedroom maisonette with a private secluded garden.

Location

Grove Park Road is a charming, wide tree-lined street, one of
Chiswick's premier addresses in close proximity to the wonderful grounds at Chiswick House. Chiswick itself offers easy access to Central London, the A4 and M4, and onto the M25 for the M3 and M40. Chiswick rail station is within a very short walk with a regular fast connection to Clapham Junction, Vauxhall and Waterloo.

Description

A wonderful three bedroom maisonette, over two levels and boasting incredible lateral space.

From the front door stairs lead up to the open plan reception area, divided into two distinct spaces. A dining area at the front leading through to a more cosy reception space at the rear. There is also a well-proportioned kitchen, boasting modern appliances and a viewing hatch through to the main space. There is wood flooring throughout and lovely high ceilings giving great volume and wonderful space for entertaining and everyday living.

From the reception area there is access to two of the three bedrooms and a shower room. Both bedrooms are generous in size with built in wardrobes.

A staircase leading from the reception area leads up to the master suite. The definition of decadence with a good sized bathroom, large bedroom which has a good sized dressing room leading off. This room has wonderful exposed beams and adds a real element of character to the space.

From the rear of the reception area there are stairs down to the secluded garden. A tranquil Oasis consisting of a decking area, mature plants and shrubs, which also gives gated secure access to Kinnaird Avenue.

Square Footage: 1781 sq ft

Brentford Lock West is an award-winning housing development located by Thames Lock, to the west of the Grand Union Canal. Walk one way along the tow path to Gunnersbury Park and the other to the High Street.

Currently the development consists of almost 300 apartments and town houses. Planning has been approved for phase three, a further 452 homes, a new footbridge from the public square across the canal, as well as commercial and retail spaces making it an icon of it's own within the regeneration of Brentford.

The spacious property has unusual feature roof lights along with full heigh windows making it light and airy. The reception room has access onto a large wrap around terrace with canal views from one end. Further accommodation includes a spacious entrance hall, well arranged fitted kitchen, two double bedrooms, and two bathrooms. A secure underground parking space is included.

address: "Kempton Apartments" at Smithy Lane, Hounslow TW3
detailedDescription:
Situated on the 19th floor of Kempton Apartments this spacious dual aspect 3-bedroom apartment offers stunning views to the south over Twickenham and to the east towards central London. The kitchen comes with integrated appliances and the open plan living/dining area is perfect for entertaining and opens out onto a private south-facing balcony. There are three double bedrooms, an en suite to the main bedroom and a family bathroom.
High Street Quarter is an exciting development of one, two and three-bedroom homes built around a new public square with shops, restaurants and a state-of-the-art multiplex cinema creating a new lifestyle district on your doorstep. The development will link the existing high street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new community in the heart of Hounslow. Hounslow East and Hounslow stations are both a few minutes’ walk away, with quick links to central London.

Rooms

G
  • Kitchen (2790mm x 4325mm (9'1'' x 14'2''))
  • Lounge / Dining (6655mm x 3855mm (21'10'' x 12'7''))
  • Bedroom 1 (Double) (5590mm x 3115mm (18'4'' x 10'2''))
  • Ensuite 1 (2400mm x 1900mm (7'10'' x 6'2''))
  • Bedroom 2 (Double) (5295mm x 2855mm (17'4'' x 9'4''))
  • Bedroom 3 (Double) (4440mm x 2753mm (14'6'' x 9'0''))
  • Bathroom (2400mm x 2030mm (7'10'' x 6'7''))
  • Balcony (4670mm x 2548mm (15'3'' x 8'4''))
About High Street Quarter

Be part of an exciting new community in the heart of hounslow

High Street Quarter is a brand new development of one, two and three-bedroom homes in the centre of Hounslow.

Built around a new public square, you'll be at the heart of life with shops, restaurants and leisure facilities on your doorstep. Fast transport links are just a few minutes' walk away, making central London easily accessible.

This new lifestyle district will link the existing High Street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new destination in west London.

Leisure

Hounslow has a thriving and diverse town centre - comprising a mixture of high street stores and independent retailers. For sports fans, Twickenham Stadium is 2 miles away and Wyke Green Golf Club is just a 12-minute drive. There are also numerous gyms and leisure centres to choose from in the immediate area. Hounslow Heath, a local nature reserve and one of the largest parks in the borough, is also a short walk away.

Education

A number of schools in Hounslow have been rated 'outstanding' by Ofsted including nearby Hounslow Heath Junior School and Hounslow Heath Infant and Nursery School.

Transport

Hounslow is located in Zone 4 in the Borough of Hounslow. Hounslow High Street benefits from excellent transport links, with Hounslow East & Hounslow Central Underground Stations both a 5-minute walk away and Hounslow Overground Station just a 10-minute walk. Heathrow Airport is a short drive away or 15 minutes on the tube.

Opening Hours

Monday 12:30 - 17:30, Tuesday-Sunday 10:00 - 17:30

Disclaimer

Please note that all images (where used) are for illustrative purposes only.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

address: Wilton Avenue, Central Chiswick, Chiswick, London W4
detailedDescription:
**virtual tour available online**

A beautifully light two bedroom garden flat located on a quiet no-through road in central Chiswick that enjoys over 830 Sq' - 77 SqM internally and a wonderful 25 ft garden to the rear. To the front of the property is the generous open plan living space, which has two clearly defined areas. The Reception Room benefits from the large bay window that fills the entire space with light, the room also has high ceilings, a fireplace and wooden flooring. The eat in Kitchen has a tiled floor, ample of storage space and several built in appliances. There is also a utility space which is useful for storage.

The kitchen leads onto the hallway which is incredibly well lit from multiple sky lights, the first room on the right is a good size double bedroom with built in wardrobe space. Similarly, the next bedroom is also a good size double.

The hallway features several convenient storage cupboards and the toilet and bathroom are in two separate rooms. The conservatory to the rear of the property opens up onto the fantastic 25 ft garden. The garden enjoys a large lawn area, a small patio and the brick built borders feature mature and established plants.

Just south of Chiswick High Road, Wilton Avenue is an excellent place to live for access to the local amenities. Turnham Green Station for London Underground services is just 10 minutes away on foot and there are several bus routes in operation nearby.

Devonshire Road is just moments away and is lined with several boutique stores and popular restaurants including Michelin starred La Trompette. Chiswick High Road is within a few minutes of the property for a broad selection of shops, cafes, restaurants and bars. Turnham Green Terrace is also nearby for further boutique stores and several popular independent shops including a butcher, deli and two green grocers.

Nearby schools include the popular St Mary's Catholic Primary School and The William Hogarth Primary School.

Whilst the property is centrally located near the high road, it is a wonderfully tucked away street and as a dead end road there is no through traffic.

The property is sold with the Freehold.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A stunning conversion apartment that offers a plethora of period features including high ceilings, decorative cornice and bay windows. The property offers over 900sqft of accommodation and is located in a popular location moments from the river Thames.

Description
A beautifully presented conversion flat located on the raised ground floor of a substantial building moments from the river Thames. The property benefits from an abundance of period features and is arranged to offer a stunning reception/dining room with bay window overlooking the communal gardens, modern fitted kitchen, master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en suite shower room/wc, second double bedroom, bathroom/wc and ample storage.

Grove Park Road is a lovely wide tree lined avenue, that is considered by many to be one of Grove Parks premier roads. The road is located close to the River Thames with its lovely walks and numerous pubs and restaurants including the extremely popular Annies. Local shops are available around the corner although the more comprehensive amenities of Chiswick High Road are a short distance away. Chiswick station, which provides a regular service into Waterloo is a short walk away together with local bus services. Gunnersbury, Chiswick Park and Turnham Green all provide District line services, with Turnham Green providing an early morning/late evening Piccadilly line service.

Please call Barnard Marcus now on for more information or to book a viewing!

detailedDescription:
A delightful, character ground floor conversion apartment occupying the whole of the ground floor of this detached turn of the century home having much charm and period style features together with the exclusive use of the stunning rear garden and off road parking in a community focused quiet cul de sac close to Whitton High street and station.

For Sale:

This delightful ground floor conversion apartment has much inherent charm and character retaining many of its period style features. The bright and airy accommodation features a lovely living room with feature fireplace and doors to the garden, a separate dining room, kitchen, double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, bathroom with white suite, separate WC and utility area. Outside there is off road parking for two cars to the front and side access to an impressive large rear garden which is exclusive to the ground floor flat. The garden features a side patio area with storage shed, a further raised patio with steps down to the lawn with its flower beds and borders. This garden is a wonderful addition to this delightful property, an early viewing to appreciate its many benefits is highly recommended.

Location:

Cedar Avenue is a charming, quiet cul de sac with a wonderful community spirit situated less than half a mile from Whitton High Street with its popular independent shops cafes and railway station. Twickenham town centre with its more comprehensive facilities is also close to hand.

detailedDescription:
A spectacular semi-detached Edwardian family home on the borders of the Bedford Park conservation area in Chiswick. The property, which benefits from an attractive rear garden and residents' parking, is beautifully proportioned and has been recently refurbished throughout.

The property is finished to the highest possible standard and provides an excellent living and entertaining space, complete with high-specification features including "Cat 5" wiring, Lutron lighting, a Heatmiser remote-controlled heating system, surround-sound system and double glazing.

In addition to these modern luxuries are characterful period features, including original fireplaces, a pitched roof above the ground floor bay window, and the white-painted render on the front of the house which ties it in with many other houses in the Bedford Park area. The extension and modernisation of the house has been in keeping with this style - the rear extension uses colour-matched materials and the double glazing follows the same multi-paned patterns popular in the Edwardian period.

The ground floor is centred around a wide entrance hall with a fireplace and parquet flooring. To the front of the property is a large living room with a bay window and a multi-fuel log burner, while to the rear is a huge open-plan kitchen and family room. This versatile room, which includes a fully fitted kitchen complete with a breakfast bar, dining area and living area, has been fitted with smart tiled flooring and features two sets of bi-folding doors leading to the garden. A utility room and cloakroom complete the ground floor.

The first floor hosts a modern family bathroom, three double bedrooms with built-in Leiche wardrobes, and the master bedroom, which in addition to its bay window and Leiche wardrobes also features a four-piece en suite bathroom with underfloor heating. A huge fifth double bedroom, complete with its own spectacular four-piece en suite bathroom with a twin sink, is located on the top level.

Ramillies Road is a quiet residential road set within a highly sought-after neighbourhood in close to Turnham Green in Chiswick, on the borders of both the Bedford Park and Acton Green conservation areas. The house itself is moments away from both Turnham Green Terrace and the Chiswick High Road, enabling residents to take advantage of the excellent selection of independent and high-street shops, restaurants and cafes Chiswick is renowned for. A range of other amenities including banks, post offices, and gyms are also close by, alongside green spaces including Ravenscourt Park and Chiswick Common. Turnham Green and Chiswick Park Underground stations, as well as numerous local bus routes, provide commuters with excellent transport links into and out of the city centre. Several well-regarded schools, including Southfield Primary School, the Arts Educational School, Wendell Park Primary School, Orchard House School, and The Good Shepherd Roman Catholic Primary School, are also nearby.

detailedDescription:
Prime investment land plot 10 mins from london heathrow

Land for Sale within London M25, Plot 138, Snakey Lane, Feltham, TW13 7NB

Planning gain opportunity

Ideal self-build potential (STPP)

Hands free investment prospect

Great location

Just 10 minutes from London Heathrow Airport

specific plot details:

You are buying the freehold with:

Absolute title for plot no: 138

approximate size 0.03 Acres - 122sqm (1307sqft)

more details:

Individual plots of land for investment, currently without planning. - An opportunity to get a building plot + potentially benefit from the planning uplift.

Secure Gated Access and Suitable Planned Roadways.

Ideal opportunity for those looking to build their own home or a great investment prospect. - The plot could be used for a variety of uses, subject to obtaining all necessary consents. - Please make your own enquiries with Land Registry, Hounslow Borough Council and Solicitors.

This plot is part of a larger estate made up of a site totalling approx. 12 acres (4.85 hectares). - The site has been professionally divided into its numbered plots and registered with the Land Registry UK. - Over 200+ plots have already been sold, registered, and mapped in the Land Registry documentation.

Location:

Situated a short drive from the UK's Largest Airport (LHR). Even better yet, it's not in the Heathrow flight path. Please see map images for location details.

Adjacent to Staines Rugby Football Club and opposite Adrian Hall Garden Centres - Feltham

Minutes away from the A316 Transport links

Due to the Government's lifting of planning restrictions, land is ripe for development.

Note:

Please check the corresponding map in the pictures attached to identify this particular plot.

The Land Registry Title Number in the pictures might not be the title number for this particular plot. The pictures are used for illustration and identification purposes.

Upon sale, your plot will have a unique title number issued by the Land Registry. Transaction will be done either at Land Registry via Solicitors.

The purchaser will pay seller's Solicitor fees.

Planning details:

This plot is being sold as an investment, and to date (at least to our knowledge), none of the 200+ owners of plots have applied for planning permission to build. Once all remaining plots have been sold, owners may willingly and collectively apply for planning permission. No owner is compelled to wait for the others, in order to decide what to do with their respective plot, including applying for planning permission. This is not a joint sale, and each plot sale is separate from the others, however we suggest that 200+ applications may have a different impact with the Council. There are overage covenants in place and restrictions with regards to materials used for construction (i.e. Can only be built of brick, stone, cement or similar). Although no one can guarantee the outcome of any planning permission application, we hope this site would take precedent in the local area due to the major lack of affordable housing.

Facts:

The land is currently recognised as greenbelt land which allows development of certain projects (STPP - Subject to Planning Permission). This is something you would need to check online or with the local council.

There are already a couple of different things going on at the land. There are some stables etc. Electric and Water is also present at the location. It is the buyer’s responsibility to integrate to the relevant plot number bought.

Worst Case Scenario Planning Permission is not granted… but you may still benefit from Capital Growth.

Land is a finite resource, (no more is being made) and as such can only increase in value to accommodate the demand.

Land does not shrink, does not deteriorate (even if not used), no one can steal it and cannot be destroyed by fire.

Best Case Scenario Planning Permission is granted… and your property has the potential of increasing in price up to 10 times!

Fact: The value of residential land has increased on average, across the UK, by 926% over the past 20 years (source bbc).

Fact: The value of land has increased more than fivefold since 2008, outstripping the increase in the worth of the properties overlying it (source The Guardian).

Fact: The number of new homes being approved on greenbelt land in England has increased five-fold in the last five years, according to figures obtained by the bbc.

Plot 138.

detailedDescription:
***auction***Rarely available development opportunity offering a wide variety of uses in popular residential area close to Feltham Station and Heathrow Airport. In all about 0.25acres. Advertised in partnership with My Auction Ltd.

Situation & Description

This unique parcel of land extending to c.0.25acres in total lies on the corner of Hounslow Road and Harlington Road East in Feltham, just a short walk from Feltham Station giving direct access to London and the surrounding area.

Currently Comprising Of:

X 3 bedroom semi-detached house spread over 3 floors in need of updating throughout with off-street parking, garage and rear garden

1 x semi-detached former dental surgery with potential to convert into a family home or split into apartments (subject to change of use to residential)

1 x single storey building currently used as storage with potential to convert into residential (stp)

Land to the side and rear with development potential for the erection of apartments (stp)

Due to the size and flexibility of the site, it offers an incoming buyer a variety of options whether it be;

Demolition of the existing buildings to create a substantial block of apartments

Sub-division of the existing to flats and/or bedsits to create 2 x incoming generating HMO properties with the benefit of the adjacent land to develop

Renovation of the existing semis to 2 x family homes to sell to end users and then develop the land to the side and rear to create additional dwellings/flats.

To the best of our knowledge, there have been no formal conservations or communications with the local authority about the above options and it's the responsibility of the buyer to carry out their own due diligence on the suitability and long-term use of the existing properties and adjacent land.

Feltham is a popular West London town in the Borough of Hounslow with excellent transport links to Central London (direct access to London Waterloo in 31 minutes and London Victoria will take 38 minutes via Clapham Junction) with Heathrow Airport a mere 1.5 miles away. There is also easy access to the M4 and M25 motorways.

There is a wide variety of local and High Street retailers and restaurants on Feltham High Street to include Starbucks, Tesco and Barclays with a good selection of primary and secondary schools in the immediate area.

Auction Details

The lot is to be sold by online auction on Thursday 5th August at 4pm (bidding opens on Wednesday 4th August at 12:00pm)

All interested parties who wish to bid, please contact My Auction on Please note that a Buyer’s Premium of 1.2% inc.VAT of the purchase price is to be paid by the successful Buyer subject to a minimum fee of £2,400 (inc of VAT).

detailedDescription:
Fabulous entertaining space with off-street parking and a private secluded garden.

Location

Located on Strand-on-the-Green, which is now one of the most picturesque parts of London's riverside situated between Kew Bridge and Chiswick Bridge. Within a short distance of Strand on the Green is Gunnersbury station, connecting with the London Underground network. In addition, Kew Bridge railway station is very close by with mainline access to London Waterloo. There are excellent road links including the M3, M4 & A4. Heathrow Airport is close by. Waldeck Road is situated within close proximity of the sought after Strand on the Green Junior School.

Description

As you enter the house you are greeted by a beautifully bright large reception room with stylish wooden floors.

Towards the back of the house is a large kitchen / dining room with double doors leading out to the private secluded garden. The newly refurbished kitchen is awash with modern appliances throughout and has plenty of storage. This floor also provides a cloakroom with a shower.

The accommodation on the first floor offers two very good size bedrooms – one of which has fabulous views over the garden.
There is a large modern stylish family bathroom which has been recently renovated up by the current owners.

The second floor provides a further two bedrooms, one of which is being used as a home office. The second bedroom has built is storage plus eave storage.

Overall, this is a fabulous family home offering excellent entertaining space, family accommodation and an added bonus of off-street parking.

Square Footage: 1260 sq ft

Viewings:
We are working within government safety guidelines at all times, hosting tightly controlled open days. This property is vacant which means we should comfortably be able to follow social distancing guidelines.
We allow a maximum of 1 bookings per 15 minute time slot. Attendees are allowed to bring one other person with them to a viewing provided that they are within the same household /support bubble.
Viewers must to stick to their time precisely, and keep to the 2 metre rule if in the property at the same time as another viewer.
The wearing of face masks are required at this current time so viewers are asked to ensure they bring one with them, our host may have a small supply with them for those that have forgot to bring one. We will endeavour to supply hand sanitiser fluid at entrance and exit. Viewers are responsible for keeping up to date with local Government restrictions/guidelines and following them appropriately.

detailedDescription:
Property Description

Two bedroom first floor maisonette with a bathroom and separate toilet, gas central heating and direct access to private rear garden.

Property Details

This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold.

This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).

The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability.

Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.

This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack.

The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.

The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.

Referral Arrangements

The Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted.

Where services are accepted the Auctioneer or Partner Agent may receive payment for the recommendation and you will be informed of any referral arrangement and payment prior to any services being taken by you.

detailedDescription:
This newly refurbished 3215 Sq. Ft. (298.7 Sq. M.) five double bedroom family home has been meticulously renovated and extended. Situated on one of Chiswick's most prestigious roads, the house offers the perfect balance between entertaining and living space with high specification finishes throughout.

The house is arranged over four floors and retains many of the original features. On the ground floor there is an elegant entrance hall with white washed oak herringbone floors throughout, including downstairs in the basement extension. To the right upon entering is a 28x 13'6 double reception room with high ceilings, feature wood-burner fireplace and beautiful cornice work. This leads onto a bright expansive 22'1 x 19' kitchen/breakfast room with Crittal doors onto a private low maintenance south facing garden.

Downstairs is a fabulous 32'3 x 18' cinema/living room, guest bedroom with full en-suite bathroom with separate shower and a spacious laundry room with Megaflo system.

On the 1st floor is a full width 19'3 x 14'5 master bedroom with dressing room and en-suite bathroom with roll top bath and double walk-in shower, a double bedroom to the rear and family bathroom.

The top floor has two further double bedrooms and a shower. There is ample eves storage.

No expense has been spared in the creation of this superior property and viewing is highly recommended.

The Royal Horticultural Society had its experimental gardens in Chiswick from 1822 to 1904. They occupied the land now covered by Alwyn Avenue, Barrowgate Road, Hadley Gardens and Wavendon Avenue.

Chiswick is a thriving area within 25 minutes of Central London with a village-like feel, benefitting from outstanding local schools, open green spaces, picturesque riverside and an abundance of shops, restaurants and cafes. Transport links include Turnham Green Station, local bus routes and the A4/M4 for routes in and out of London.

detailedDescription:
**3D walkthrough & video tour available (see links below)** Five bedroom Victorian Home, retaining period features, superb location, rear outbuilding/Gym ! A five bedroom Victorian terraced house in Osterley Village measuring 1887 sqft / 175 sqm having been thoughtfully extended and offering superb family accommodation that blends traditional features with modern living perfectly.

Our clients have lovingly extended and restored this property to ensure that those sought after period features have not been lost. Examples include corniced ceilings, corbels, wide polished floorboards, timber architraves/dado rails and cast iron radiators.

Entrance to the property is via solid timber door preceded by storm porch and into an L shaped hallway (with laundry area), bay fronted living room with traditional fireplace, open plan kitchen/dining area featuring a designer kitchen with granite tops and providing the hub of the home, rear study/sitting room with sliding doors to garden and rear WC. The upper floors are very well planned indeed, the first floor landing is long with a built in cupboard and plenty of light flooding in from the very large second floor landing ceiling skylight, from there you are lead to 5 bedrooms and 2 stunning bathrooms on 2 floors.

The exterior offers a long 70 foot east facing rear garden with patio long lawn and trees/mature shrubs to both sides. A hidden treat lies to the rear of the garden in the fabulous brick built garden outbuilding with an attached covered entertaining space! The outbuilding is setup with light and power already and quality parquet flooring an can function as either a home gym or work from home space whilst the covered area faces west so you can soak up plenty of warm sun towards the end of a long day! Finally the front has off street parking for 2 cars.

Set in the heart of Osterley Village location here is prime and very convenient you are moments from the shops at Osterley Village as well Osterley National Trust Park nearby. You are also a short walk to Osterley Tube as well as having a number of nearby amenities and local schools.
