detailedDescription:
Summary
sold with no chain! This is a great opportunity for a family to move into a newly renovated home. Churchfields Avenue also benefits from a living / dinning room, utility room and a down stairs showeroom. Up stairs you will find three bedrooms and a family bathroom.

Description
sold with no chain! This is a great opportunity for a family to move into a newly renovated home. On the ground floor entrance you are welcomed by a large hall way, a bright reception/dining room, a large fitted kitchen with access onto a utility room and a large well maintained private garden. Churchfields Avenue also benefits from a down stairs shower room. Leading upstairs there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom. You also have the luxury driveways for off street parking located at the front of the property.

Churchfield Avenue is superbly located being just a stone throw away from the A316/M3. You also have access to shops and 24 hour bus services within a short distance that can get you to terminal 4 and finally the H25 bus which stops directly outside the property taking you to Feltham over ground Station and Hatton Cross Tube station. Viewing highly advised.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This naturally bright house offers an excellent balance of entertaining and living space. The ground floor has been extended and comprises a wide entrance hallway, a spacious formal reception room with hardwood flooring, feature fireplace and large bay window. The rear of the house has been extended and opened up to create a truly amazing 31’ x 24’ entertaining space which consist of a bespoke kitchen, dining area and living room. Large glass panel sliding doors lead out to the properties 109’ x 29’ south-facing landscaped rear garden. There is also a cloakroom and stairs lead down to the properties basement which has been converted into a utility / plant room.

The first floor comprises of the master bedroom with luxury Grohe & Dornbracht ensuite, bespoke hand veneered walnut dressing room with balcony overlooking the rear garden, further double bedroom also with a private balcony and a modern three-piece shower room.

The top floor consists of two double bedrooms one of which is currently uses as a gym and measures 31’ x 12’ so could easily be subdivided into two bedrooms.

Situation
Grosvenor Road is a few minutes walk to Gunnersbury Train Station (District Line and London Overground) Chiswick High Road is 0.3 miles away where numreous bus routes head into and out of Chiswick and the surrounding areas
The A4/ M4 is a short drive away for access into and out of London

detailedDescription:
For sale by modern method of auction starting bid £750,000 plus reservation fee.
Detached Family home which is an investors dream with a yield in excess of 8% with the current annual income of £70,680. The property has been split into 7 self contained units all with own kitchens and bathrooms or shower rooms. (5 of which have long term tenants) The house also benefits from ample off road parking to the front and rear of the property and 2 garages to the rear. EPC Grade D.
Auction property:
This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, I am sold.
This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance.
The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 3.0% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability.
Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with I am sold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.
This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack.
The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by I am sold.
The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.

Situation
The property is located in close proximity to Feltham railway station which serves London Waterloo in approx 29 minutes and the recently re-developed Feltham town centre with has a wide range of shops for you convenience. The property is also located close to Feltham Leisure West which incorporates Feltham Cineworld, Tenpin Bowling and a range of popular chains of eatery's. Local schools include Cardinal Road, St Lawrence rc School and Feltham Community College.

Important note to purchasers:
We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller.

Priced for an immediate sale

vacant possession

We are pleased to offer this well presented one-bedroom flat for sale. The property is located on the 3rd floor within the well established 'Abbey Court' development, situated in the sought after area of Emlyn Gardens, Wendell Park.

Offering a spacious lounge/diner with built in storage, a private balcony with pleasant views, separate fitted kitchen, one double bedroom with built in storage, and a bathroom with white suite, consisting of bath with overhead shower, Basin and W.C.

Additional features of the property include a contemporary decor throughout with white walls and doors, plus grey laminate flooring. Further benefits include double glazing and gas central heating. Also, vacant possession, with no onward chain.

This property is in an ideal location and within proximity of the local shops, supermarkets, parks, schools, and nurseries. Wendell Park is nestled between Chiswick and Shepherds Bush. The nearest tube station is Turnham Green, with close access to the Westfield Shopping Centre.

We have been advised by our client that there are 116 years remaining on the lease, current service charge is £837 per annum and ground rent £10 per annum.

Should you wish to buy the property as an investment, we would anticipate the monthly rental to be approximately £1500 pcm, giving an estimated yearly yield of 6.20%

Off street parking can be obtained by applying to the council for a permit.

A modern apartment in a waterside development with secure underground parking and a communal garden in a premium development in Brentford. Do not be deceived by the exterior, for inside this is a really large property with great accommodation consisting of Three bedrooms to the first floor with two bathrooms, then to the ground floor there is a further bedroom with en-suite as well as a study, living room and a stunning kitchen diner.
The presentation throughout is good and if your looking for value for money and great adaptable accommodation, then this might just be the one for you.
Outside: There is a shared driveway and off street parking to the front. To the rear there is a good size garden of approx 45ft this is on two levels with a good size lawned area then a raised patio area to the rear where there is also a cabin, ideal for storage or possibly work from home. The garden also benefits from a southerly aspect.

Location:

Located on the Hounslow Whitton borders, with both Whitton and Hounslow town centre's are close at hand as are both their railway stations. The area is also well served by local schools and leisure facilities with Maswell Park a short walk away.

detailedDescription:
A fantastic, bright and airy mansion flat positioned on the second floor of this attractive period mansion block located along South Parade and overlooking Chiswick Common/Acton Green.

This two bedroom flat is presented for sale in excellent order throughout, with a lovely kitchen/breakfast room, bright reception room with large sash windows and wooden floor, two double bedrooms and bathroom with separate cloakroom. The property also has share of the freehold.

Esmond Gardens is located along South Parade in between Esmond Road and Ramillies Road, being within a short walk of Turnham Green tube station. The excellent array of cafes, restaurant and shops along Turnham Green Terrace and Chiswick High Road are all within easy walking distance.

detailedDescription:
Quilliam are delighted to present to the market this beautifully hand crafted two cabin houseboat which is ideally positioned at Ham Wharf in the heart of Brentford on a 18 year residential mooring licence.
The spacious accommodation includes a large reception room with Juliet balcony on the upper deck and a kitchen/dining room, two cabins, one of which has a door to the bow, a spacious bathroom and separate shower room on the deck below.
The houseboat also affords the potential to extend the deck.
The enviable location is ideal for both local amenities and beautiful outdoor spaces including Syon Park and access to stunning walks along The Grand Union Canal and The River Thames towards Kew, Strand on the Green and beyond.

detailedDescription:
Summary
We are delighted to offer this opportunity to purchase a seventh floor two bedroom apartment, located in a secure gated development next to Kew Bridge.

Description
We are delighted to offer this opportunity to purchase a seventh floor two bedroom apartment, located in a secure gated development next to Kew Bridge with spectacular South-facing views across the River Thames. This property benefits from wooden flooring throughout, a spacious reception room, a separate fully fitted kitchen, a double master bedroom with en suite bathroom and built-in wardrobes, a second double bedroom and a contemporary three piece family bathroom. Further, this apartment boasts a private parking space, a resident's gym, bike storage, a concierge service and access to guest parking.

Early viewings are highly recommended to avoid disappointment.
Please call Barnard Marcus now on for more information or to book a viewing!

We currently hold lease details as displayed above, should you require further information please contact the branch. Please note additional fees could be incurred for items such as leasehold packs.

detailedDescription:
** Back on the market due to buyers unable to proceed**

A delightful and well presented one bedroom top floor purpose built flat set in a quiet area of this attractive private development with landscaped grounds.

The building is accessed via an entry phone system with carpeted communal area and front door leading to entrance hall with access through to the lounge having views over the landscaped grounds and open access in to a well fitted modern kitchen.

With a double bedroom and bathroom facilities a viewing is highly recommended.

The property also has the advantage of residents' parking and 2 additional permits for visitor parking. There is access to pleasant communal gardens and outdoor space.

Location: Comfortable walking distance to Twickenham town centre, River Thames and the spacious grounds of Old Deer Park. Nearby Twickenham Rail station has fast trains to London Waterloo. Also nearby are Old Isleworth, Syon House and Park, Richmond town centre, Isleworth Library & Leisure Centre, and Virgin Active Health Club. Tesco Superstore is conveniently placed within minutes' walk.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
This ground floor modern maisonette set on the banks of the River Thames with its own front door, designated parking and a private patio area is a must see. There is direct access from this desirable development to the Thames Path for riverside strolls. This lovely apartment is presented in excellent "ready to move into" condition throughout and comprises: A hallway, a spacious and bright open-plan white kitchen/reception room with wood flooring and doors out to the patio area. A double bedroom with bespoke fitted wardrobes and a smart bathroom.

Thames Row is conveniently situated between Kew Bridge and Brentford on the Middlesex side of the river with Kew Bridge br station 0.2 miles away and an array of local buses on the main High Street serving the nearby towns of Chiswick, Kew and Ealing.

The M4 and A4 are also within easy reach (Heathrow in circa 15 mins, Knightsbridge in circa 25 mins, by car).

An extraordinarily large & spectacular plot casing a remarkable extended family home offering further scope for development (subject to planning permission).

Arranged over two floors and boasting over 1,500 sq.ft accommodation comprises of three bedrooms (all with fitted wardrobes), through lounge opening to an extended kitchen/ diner with breakfast bar, family bathroom/ WC and downstairs shower/ WC. A large semi-detached house with a garden and a driveway on a well-connected road in Hounslow. The property features ample fitted storage throughout and benefits from a newly restored roof. The ground floor is centred around a large entrance hall and consists of a double reception room, separate kitchen, double bedroom with a bay window, and a downstairs bathroom. The upper levels feature a family bathroom, utility room and five double bedrooms, two of which benefit from built-in wardrobes.

Hanworth Road is one of Hounslow's best connected roads, moments away from the abundance of shops, cafes and other amenities offered by the Treaty Centre and surrounding roads. Commuters can benefit from proximity to Hounslow Mainline station, Hounslow Central Underground station, local bus routes and multiple road links into and out of the city centre.

detailedDescription:
The property is set back from the road by a front garden and has been informally used as two separate living spaces. The ground floor consists an entrance hall, reception room, second reception room (used as a bedroom), cloak room, utility area and a dining room to the rear. The rear garden is accessed via the kitchen. The second floor comprises a reception room with bay window (traditionally the primary bedroom), a double bedroom, bathroom and kitchen to the rear (previously the third bedroom). The property offers fantastic potential to extend on the ground floor as well as into the loft subject to the usual consents. An early viewing is highly recommended.

Situation
South Acton station (London Overground) is 130 metres away and Chiswick Park station (District line) is 800 metres away. Access to the A4 eastbound into central London and westbound out towards Heathrow airport is a 1.7 Km drive.

Additional Information

address: Solos Apartments, Boston Manor Rd, London TW8
detailedDescription:
Solos London Apartments

For Investment Purposes Only

A contemporary development located in a prime city-centre location designed to the highest of standards.

The development is designed to elevate living. With multi-purpose smart spaces and floor-to-ceiling windows, these apartments are a testament to modern design overlooking nature’s great landscape. Intelligent design is incorporated throughout the development’s architecture, making living within its walls both an easy and beautiful experience. Soft hues complement the perfect botanical canvas framed by floor-to-ceiling windows. With a focus on contemporary minimalism, the rooms are designed to enhance space and promote easy living.

With the growing trend of co-living, these apartments offer exquisitely designed communal areas in open-plan spaces. Plush leather sofas dot the area while long dining tables allow for effortless social gatherings.

Surrounded by lush parks and historical landmarks, Brentford is only a short 30 minutes from the glass-clad skyline of central London. As an oasis of tranquillity, it’s hard to imagine the leafy suburb is just 10km West of London’s Zone 1.

Investment Overview

• Located in London
• High Rental Yields
• Completing Soon
• Ideal Location
• Stunning Views
• Close to Transport Links

Why Invest in Brentford

Nestled among West London’s most scenic regions, Brentford is a burgeoning hub of business
and regeneration. The settlement is steeped in history dating back to the Roman era and was well established before the founding of London. However, in recent years, Brentford has been immersed in transformation with the most notable program being a £500 million investment into The Brentford Project.

Brentford is home to a portion of the Golden Mile, named for its concentration of over 200 multinational corporate offices.

The subsequent influx of young talent drawn by career prospects has been a major plank in the neighbourhood’s future. Bluechip companies with headquarters in Brentford include GlaxoSmithKline, Sky, Sega and Allianz, elevating the value of the postcode significantly. In the coming decade, employment in the borough is set to rise by 8% while gva is expected to grow another 20%.

All Images are Computer Generated – Please Call Us Today for More Information & a Free Information Pack

detailedDescription:
This stunning apartment is located on the ground floor of this modern development on Belmont Terrace. The property has excellent room sizes and is beautifully presented throughout. There is a large open-plan kitchen, that leads onto the spacious reception and dining. There are two double bedrooms, one of which is en suite, and a family bathroom. Both bedrooms include built-in wardrobes and there is further storage throughout the apartment. Auctioneer's Comments
This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).

The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.

The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change.

address: Brunel Building, The Brentford Project, Brentford TW8
detailedDescription:
539 Sq Ft | Riverside | Balcony | High Ceilings |Views of Syon Park | Parking | Completion End of 2022 - early 2023 | All Similar Units Now Sold

An opportunity to invest or live in a superbly located apartment in one of London's most exciting regeneration schemes, The Brentford Project.

This extra special 539 sq ft fifth floor one bedroom is not only on the favoured riverside aspect, but it also overlooks Syon Park.

The property is being sold with the benefit of a parking space.

This brand new property, being constructed by Ballymore Homes is expected to be build complete between Q2/Q3 2022 and Q1/Q2 2023.

The developer is creating a unique mix of residential, leisure and commercial.

"A revitalised high street will incorporate all the amenities desired for modern living, with a selection of market-leading retailers, alongside a major supermarket, boutique cinema and traditional shops including a bakery, greengrocer and butcher. Meanwhile, a series of characterful yards and lanes have been designed to seamlessly reconnect the high street with the waterfront. The passageways of the lanes will be dedicated to supporting emerging local businesses, home to a variety of boutiques, independent retailers, artisans, craftspeople and budding entrepreneurs.

Down by the water, thoughtful public realm and an eclectic range of restaurants, cafés and pubs will line the frontage, creating a dynamic culinary offering. Extensions to the Thames path will open up new walking routes along the water’s edge.

The Brentford Project will also bring a host of community spaces, in particular with the transformation of the Grade II* Listed St Lawrence’s Church – a forgotten masterpiece originally designed by renowned Brentford architect, Thomas Hardwick. A hidden gem which dates back to the 15th Century, the church, with its dramatic vaulted ceiling, wooden arcading and striking rows of arches, is set to become a new focal point for Brentford as a cultural and foodie hub – designed to host a series of pop-ups, events and shows."

More information about the overall scheme can be found here

This unit is an assignment sale and therefore being resold by a private vendor.

For more information, please contact Steven Herd on .<br /><br />

address: Ham Wharf Moorings, The Ham, Brentford TW8
detailedDescription:
Elisabeth is on a fully transferable low cost Residential Mooring in Brentford, which is itself becoming a new focus of redevelopment in West London. She has an open plan Kitchen Saloon in the bow, followed by a fitted bathroom with shower and Elsan toilet. The fixed wheelhouse has windows all round, taking full advantage of the boats position with all day sunlight.

Elisabeth is on a fully residential mooring at Ham Wharf, on a semi tidal stretch of the River Brent just above the Thames Lock in Brentford. The location provides easy access to take Elisabeth out on to the Thames or to travel north up the Grand Union Canal. Residential mooring status means you can live aboard all year and provides a postal address and possibility for a parking permit.

The mooring itself is in a quiet location that is walking distance to Brentford high street for all amenities and travel connections. There are some lovely walking spots such as the Thames path and Syon House gardens within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
The property is a remarkable six bedroom detached Arts & Crafts family house built in the Edwardian era providing excellent lateral space for entertaining, a wealth of original features and offering a real sense of charm throughout. The ground floor offers underfloor heating throughout and the accommodation provides a spacious entrance hallway, a formal dining room with a working fireplace, a double reception, a useful utility room and a modern kitchen with a breakfast bar and bi-fold doors out to a beautiful and secluded 50-foot garden. The first floor provides a principle bedroom with an en-suite bathroom and a fantastic terrace, three double bedrooms and a family bathroom. There are two further bedrooms and a bathroom on the second floor which features a Jacuzzi bath, double sinks and a wet room. The property further benefits from off-street parking and further potential to extend the ground and first floor, subject to the necessary permissions.

Situation
Vanbrugh Road is in an excellent location, situated in Bedford Park within walking distance of the sought-after independent schools Orchard House and Chiswick and Bedford Park Preparatory School. The property is also a short walk from Turnham Green Terrace, Turnham Green (District Line) station and Chiswick High Road.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
New york loft-inspired riverside two bedroom apartment

Location

This exceptionally well-presented two bedroom, two bathroom, waterfront apartment is situated only moments away from Kew Bridge. Neighbourhood amenities include sailing, kayaking and tennis clubs, shops, restaurants, parks and top-rated Ofsted schools and academies.

Kew Bridge railway station is 340 yards away, enabling you to be at Waterloo station in thirty minutes, and Heathrow is only twenty minutes away by car.

Description

Doorsteps are delighted to welcome this New York loft-inspired, south-facing waterfront apartment on the ground floor of this modern development to the market.

The entire apartment was fully refurbished only three years ago and now offers spacious open-plan living with large windows creating an airy reception benefiting from plenty of natural light all day. There is wood flooring throughout, hot and cold full central air-conditioning, and incredible views across the Thames to Kew Royal Botanical Gardens.

The open-plan kitchen with its wide breakfast bar, butler's sink, Fisher and Paykel dishwasher drawers, high spec Samsung double ovens, integrated microwave, washer and dryer and refrigerator, will make any fan of cooking feel at home.

The well-appointed large double bedrooms are fitted with double glazing, large built-in wardrobes, and wood flooring — with the master bedroom benefitting from a high spec ensuite. The main bathroom has Burlington fixtures and fittings throughout, including a claw-foot stand-alone tub.

From a riverside passer-by's perspective, the development would not look out of place on Brooklyn's waterfront. The extensive riverside deck has ample seating for friends with outside lighting and greenery — the perfect place to have a candlelit dinner or drinks overlooking the stunning views of Kew bridge and Waterman's park.

Viewing this stunning flat is recommended at the earliest opportunity.

Tenure: Leasehold

Local Authority: Hounslow

address: Kelvin Court, Woodlands Grove, Isleworth TW7
detailedDescription:
A share of freehold flat offered chain free with free on-street parking and a private garden in a wonderful enclaved community of residential streets that surround a residential playing field, tennis courts and pavillion, which are all part of the W.E.R.F.A. This great value property benefits from being moments from a local river and also has a shared balcony with the neighbouring property and direct access to the ground floor patio. This property consists of a spacious living room, has loft access, fitted kitchen, modernised bathroom and two double bedrooms.

The Woodlands is one of Isleworth's most popular residential areas. This picturesque neighbourhood with the Duke of Northumberland's River running straight through the community. W.E.R.F.A, (Woodland Estate Resident Freeholders’ Association) is a popular, recognised and beneficial association for the maintenance of the community. The property is ideally located moments away from St John's Road and the London Road to take advantage of the best of the shops, restaurants and other local amenities Isleworth has to offer. Families can access a selection of local schools, while commuters benefit from proximity to Isleworth Mainline station, local bus routes, and the A4/M4 and London Road for motorists.

address: Sutton Court, Fauconberg Road, London W4
detailedDescription:
This spacious four bedroom first-floor purpose-built mansion flat has just been fully refurbished throughout. Providing a traditional mansion block atmosphere with high ceilings and vast reception and bedrooms as well as period features such as fireplaces and large sash windows.

On entry, there is a wide entrance hall leading into a reception room that adjoins onto the new bespoke built kitchen. The hallway carries you into a second reception room with dual aspect looking across the communal gardens.

All four bedrooms are accessed off the hallway, the principal bedroom features a sizeable en suite bathroom and built-in wardrobe, the room is currently set up for a working at home lifestyle. The second, third and fourth bedrooms also have plenty of space for double beds and ample storage.

Being on the first floor this property is perfect for someone looking for a large flat with lateral space. Sutton Court benefits from residents parking permits and its communal gardens which brings the local community together.

Sutton Court is located close to Fauconberg Parade which offers an array of local shops and cafes. The flat also falls within the catchment areas for Grove Park Primary and Strand on the Green - two of Chiswick's most desirable schools.

The River Thames is a short walk away and you can catch local buses from Sutton Court Road which provide access into and out of London. Chiswick (Overground) Station is likewise within walking distance whilst the A4 and A316 provide access by car.

detailedDescription:
A modern, well presented purpose-built studio apartment situated on the third floor with wonderful, south facing, far reaching views. The property is located moments from the Hampton, Hanworth and Twickenham borders and has local amenities, bus services and green spaces close by.

A communal entrance hallway with an entry phone system and stairs, leads to the third-floor private entrance. An entrance hallway with a built-in storage cupboard, which houses the hot water tank and provides further storage, has doors to all rooms. The bright and spacious studio room has space for bedroom and sitting reception areas. There are attractive and far-reaching views via large double glazed windows. There is a built in wardrobe, and further built in storage cupboards. Open plan access leads to the kitchen with a range of fitted units with an integrated double oven, hob and extractor. There is space and plumbing for a washing machine, space for a fridge freezer and a double glazed window. The bathroom and W.C has a bath with a wall mounted shower attachment, vanity sink unit, extractor fan and a shaver point.

The property has been recently redecorated and additional features include newly fitted carpets, electric heating, double glazing, and there is a long lease with 165 years unexpired.

Outside there are well maintained lawned communal gardens, and there is an allocated off street parking space and further unallocated off street parking spaces.

Full description:
shared ownership (Advertised price represents 50% share. Full market value £230,000). A well-proportioned and well-presented flat on the first floor. The reception room and kitchen are both south-west-facing, the bathroom naturally lit and the bedroom comfortably sized. There is gas central heating and the windows are double glazed units throughout. The flat comes with use of a parking space and is also within easy walking distance of Feltham Railway Station which provides services between Reading/Weybridge/Windsor & Eton Riverside and London Waterloo.

Tenure: Leasehold (currently 73 years remaining, 26 year extension in progress).
Minimum Share: 50% (£115,000). The housing association will expect that you will purchase the largest share affordable.
Shared Ownership Rent: £189.52 per month (subject to annual review).
Service Charge: £135.38 per month, including sinking fund (subject to annual review).
Guideline Minimum Income: Dual £23,200 Single £28,900 (based on minimum share and 10% deposit).
Council Tax: Band C, London Borough of Hounslow. Priority is given to applicants living and/or working in this local authority.

This property is offered for sale in the condition seen. The housing association does not warrant to carry out any remedial or redecoration work of a cosmetic nature unless specifically advised in writing. As a general rule, fitted domestic appliances are included in the sale; non-fitted appliances are not. If you require confirmation, you must request this in writing from Urban Moves. title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Available to view!..... Chase Buchanan are pleased to offer to the market this magnificent period residence situated in the heart of Isleworth's Spring Grove Conservation area. The property comprises an inviting hallway that leads onto a spacious reception room and a separate dining room with an open plan kitchen and utility room. On the first floor there is a master bedroom with an en-suite shower room, a further two bedrooms and a family bathroom, whilst the second floor has a further three bedrooms. Further benefits include front, side and rear gardens as well as an own driveway to the garage.

Ridgeway Road is ideally located within walking distance of Isleworth br Station (37 mins to London Waterloo), Osterley Piccadilly Line Station as well as the open spaces of Osterley Park and several other amenities which Isleworth Village has to offer.

A stunning ninth floor two double bedroom apartment with far reaching views over the London skyline, located in this quiet road in Old Isleworth close to the River Thames.

The accommodation comprises a bright reception room with doors onto a balcony, a kitchen/breakfast room with doors onto a second balcony, two double bedrooms, bathroom and a separate WC. Further benefits include ample storage, a lift to all floors and residents parking.

Percy Gardens is situated close to the river, the open spaces of Syon Park as well as being close to St Margarets and Richmond.

address: Colonial Drive, Bollo Lane, London W4
detailedDescription:
Summary
A fantastic opportunity to acquire this large modern two bedroom first floor apartment in an attractive contemporary development located just moments from Chiswick Park Station.

Description
A fantastic opportunity to acquire this large modern two bedroom first floor apartment in an attractive contemporary development located just moments from Chiswick Park Station. Benefitting from two double bedrooms – including a master bedroom with an en-suite shower/wc, the apartment also boasts a large open-planned Kitchen/Reception room with direct access to a delightful south-facing balcony, overlooking Gunnersbury Nature Reserve, an ideal spot for peace and quiet.

The apartment is fitted with underfloor heating and the kitchen is fully integrated with modern appliances including a Zanussi Washing machine, AEG dishwasher, AEG cooker, AEG hob unit and an AEG fridge/freezer.

Edmunds House boasts an on-site Concierge (available from 0700-1900) providing convenient and friendly security staff. There is also a secure bicycle lock up area for residents use as well as an in-house Nursery. Chiswick Park Tube station is only a short walk from the property, with the convenience of the District Line available as well as a 40 minute commute to Heathrow Airport. There are convenient bus routes nearby as well as an array of coffee shops, bars, boutiques and shopping stores available on Chiswick High Road – which is only a 10 minute walk. Edmunds House also connects to Chiswick Business Park – via a new footbridge that links the two.

Please call Barnard Marcus now on for more information or to book a viewing.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Exquisite presentation, wonderful proportions, versatile family space.

Location

Marlborough Road is centrally located in Chiswick close to the High Road.
Chiswick Park Underground station (District Line) and Gunnersbury
(Overground & District Line) are within a short walk. There is easy access to
central London via the A4, and to Heathrow Airport and the west of England via
the M4.

Description

A sensational Victorian family house with exceptional proportions throughout providing versatile family accommodation. The house has been extended offering superb entertaining space, and is presented to a beautiful standard throughout with generous ceiling heights throughout.

The layout of the ground floor is fantastic with a generously proportioned reception room at the front of the house with a large bay window, a feature fire place, bespoke cupboards and parquet flooring. There is also a useful cloakroom.

At the heart of the house is the striking kitchen/dining room which is flooded with natural light which further enhances the great attention to detail. There is access out to a beautifully secluded private good sized garden. The garden connects to the lower ground floor via stairs leading down to a patio and the family/cinema/ reception room. Also situated on this floor is a utility room and a cloakroom.

The fabulous principle bedroom situated at the back of the house has a large bay window with views over the garden and air conditioning. It is further complemented by a luxurious en suite bathroom with an impressive walk-in shower and stand-alone bath, and a separate large walk in dressing room. At the front of house is a large bedroom with a stylish en suite bathroom. Adjacent to this is a useful study with an integrated desk and shelving.
On the second floor are two further bedrooms, a family bathroom and an additional study that could easily be a fifth bedroom. Both bedrooms have built in wardrobes and access to additional eaves storage space.

Off-street parking to the front of the house completes the quality attributes of this truly unique home.

Square Footage: 3131 sq ft

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Offered with no chain. Extended & loft converted terraced family home located on a a quiet residential road. In brief offers through lounge, kitchen/breakfast room and office. To the first floor lies 2 double bedrooms and family bathroom w/c. To the second floor lies a further double bedroom with en-suite shower room w/c. Other benefits include an approx 46ft west facing rear garden with large store shed and off street parking. EPC Grade D.

Situation
The property is situated on a quiet residential road in Whitton and offers a wide range of shops for your convenience as well as Whitton/Hounslow mainline Stations which serve London Waterloo. The local Infant and Junior Schools are Chase Bridge, Nelson, Bishop Perrin, St Edmunds. The local secondary School would be Twickenham Academy. Other benefits are local bus routes including H22,281 and 481. Whitton also benefits from several parks and open spaces including Crane Park, Murray Park and Powder Mill Lane recreation park.

detailedDescription:
This chain-free stunning and modern 724 sq ft. Two-bedroom apartment is situated within the sought-after The Blenheim Centre building in Hounslow. The apartment is situated on the second floor and has lift access.

The property has been finished to a high standard comprising a large modern semi-open plan kitchen and living room which has sliding doors leading to a south-facing private balcony offering fantastic views. There are two generous double bedrooms (master bedroom with en-suite shower room) and a further family bathroom.

The property benefits from wooden flooring in the main living area, modern fixtures and fittings and plenty of storage throughout.

Fantastically located for transport links which include Hounslow East and Hounslow Central stations (Piccadilly lines). A short walk will take you to Hounslow High Street, where there are plenty of high street brands, cuisines and bars. A 24-hour asda, B&M home store and a 24-hour Gym are on your doorstep.

Tenure: Leasehold.

detailedDescription:
A stunning three bedroom apartment located on fifth floor with two underground car park spaces, a large balcony and beautiful views over the River Thames.

Situated on 5th floor the apartment offers beautiful south views over the River Thames from the large reception room and balcony. On entry the property offers plenty of storage and utility, the reception room has been redesigned to give it a more brighter look. It also comes with three spacious bedrooms and three bathrooms (Two ensuite) making this a perfect home for a growing family.

Set within the prestigious St George riverside development, the apartment comes with high spec interiors and large windows creating abundance of natural light. Belvedere is also one of the building with 24 hrs concierge situated in it making this a more desirable building within the development.
Others facilities include residents gym, two underground parking spaces, and 24 hrs concierge.

The apartment is also conveniently located with shops and a popular Fullers pub/restaurant within the development. Kew Bridge has become a very desirable location in recent years, an enjoyable stretch of the River Thames, Kew Gardens close by and excellent transport links (Kew Bridge mainline station and the A4/M4 easily accessible)

address: Albion House, St. Peters Square, London W6
detailedDescription:
Situated on one of West London's most favoured squares is this truly wonderful 2 bedroom apartment with private front and rear gardens. Steps down your front garden lead you to your private entrance and onto the central hallway which provides access to all rooms.

To the front of the flat is a generous master bedroom with an abundance of natural light flooding in and views of the garden which has been thoughtfully stepped to maximise the view.

To the rear is the charming substantial reception room with French doors to the private landscaped west facing rear garden. The kitchen is to the side of the reception with a window overlooking the West facing garden. A second bedroom is also to the rear. A stunning bathroom with bath and separate shower sits beside an extremely useful utility room.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

St. Peters Square is a highly regarded location moments from Stamford Brook Underground Station. Local shops are close by as is the picturesque riverside at Chiswick Mall.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Verdo is a collection of studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments built by EcoWorld London and is surrounded by well-kept parks, the tropical gardens of Kew and the River Thames. The beautifully crafted apartments are the start of a multi-million-pound regeneration programme taking place around Kew Bridge Station, TW8 which is set to include a range of retail and leisure facilities. Within the development, residents have use of a private gym, media screening room and the convenience of a 24-hr concierge. Residents will also be able to enjoy a beautiful private lounge that opens out directly onto a podium garden and sunlit terrace.

Verdo is ideally located for a range of world-famous local attractions; the grade II listed Kew Bridge leading to the Royal Botanical Gardens (a unesco world heritage site), Syon House set in Syon Park, and the recently restored Gunnersbury Park and Triangle Nature Reserve. The upmarket highstreets of Chiswick and Richmond have a diverse array of shops and restaurants both with local independent retailers as well as well-known national favourites. The scheme has excellent transport links, being just a minutes’ walk from Kew Bridge Station which provides easy access to central London at Waterloo Station in less than 30 minutes and is under 10 minutes’ walk from Gunnersbury Station which is serviced by the District & Overground lines.

Completing Q4 2021.

Register your interest and find your new home today at Verdo.

CGIs are used for illustrative purposes only

detailedDescription:
An elegant and beautifully presented, ground floor 644 Sq Ft / 59 Sq M, two bedroom apartment located in a desirable Bedford Park development that features a 15'5 reception room with 2.94m ceiling height. The apartment is located to the rear of the building so not directly affected by road or train noise.

The complete accommodation comprises: Entrance hallway with storage cupboard leading to 9'6 modern kitchen, 15'5 reception room with feature fireplace, 13'9 master bedroom, further 10'7 bedroom with built-in wardrobe and luxury shower room.

First occupied in 1903, Esmond Gardens really is a fine example of a purpose-built mansion development, offering a blend of glorious period features, the charm of living within the Bedford Park Conservation area and only being a short walk from Chiswick High Road and Turnham Green Terrace with their numerous boutiques, specialty shops, restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Being so centrally located also offers excellent transport connections into town and out to Heathrow and the west country.

Many residents use the front communal gardens for reading and relaxing in the South facing sunshine.

About chiswick.....

Chiswick is a hugely popular and prosperous large suburb of West London located on the northern side of the River Thames, 6 miles (9.7 km) west of Charing Cross.

Whilst retaining a wonderful village charm, Chiswick is a vibrant area brimming with the activity and opportunity typical of London.

Chiswick boasts a stunning range of property including elegant Georgian architecture, renowned Norman Shaw designed Bedford Park houses to quaint cottages in the Glebe Estate.

Chiswick High Road offers a fantastic range of bars, restaurants, supermarkets, an ever-expanding range of delis and boutiques.

About Harpers of Chiswick….

Bespoke property solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

What is the difference between Harpers of Chiswick and generic estate agents?
Customers expectations have moved on whilst most estate agents haven’t changed in fifty years. Harpers of Chiswick is a property consultancy and not just an estate agents. We deliver a multi-faceted ‘everything is possible’ approach to Chiswick residential property. We offer all the services that you would expect, but many more..”

We manage all the maintenance for your own home, not just the properties we let. We call it ‘Home Assist’.
We can feed your cat, put the bins out and open the curtains when you go on holiday. Your ‘Holiday Guardian’.
We can even hold a set of your house keys, just in case you lock yourself out! Fully licensed ‘Key Holding’.
Property Staging and Interior Design by our in-house team to maximise your investment.
Private Introductions for clients and customers in the public eye who seek ultimate discretion.

Even our fee structures are designed to favour our clients. “Your sense of value is more important to me than my dreams of a new Ducati.” Sales fees are tiered and linked to results, not old fashioned percentages that favour the agents pocket. Our lettings fees are charged monthly, not annually in advance, and you only pay us if your tenant pays the rent. Innovative terms for modern markets.”

We have no desire to be the largest. We consciously keep our portfolios compact so that we can successfully apply the time, high levels of detail and attention you require and deserve. Excellence for the few rather than a sausage factory for many.

Bespoke solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

detailedDescription:
This 4th floor, one-bedroom apartment features an open plan living/dining area with access to a private balcony, and views over the new exciting, main piazza. The kitchen comes with fully integrated appliances and matching worktops. Further benefits include a large storage cupboard and underfloor heating throughout, and dual-aspect views from the main bedroom. High Street Quarter is a brand new development of one, two and three-bedroom homes in the centre of Hounslow.

Built around a new public square, you'll be at the heart of life with shops, restaurants and leisure facilities on your doorstep. Fast transport links are just a few minutes’ walk away, making central London easily accessible.

This new lifestyle district will link the existing High Street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new destination in west London.

About High Street Quarter

Be part of an exciting new community in the heart of hounslow

High Street Quarter is a brand new development of one, two and three-bedroom homes in the centre of Hounslow.

Built around a new public square, you'll be at the heart of life with shops, restaurants and leisure facilities on your doorstep. Fast transport links are just a few minutes' walk away, making central London easily accessible.

This new lifestyle district will link the existing High Street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new destination in west London.

Leisure

Hounslow has a thriving and diverse town centre - comprising a mixture of high street stores and independent retailers. For sports fans, Twickenham Stadium is 2 miles away and Wyke Green Golf Club is just a 12-minute drive. There are also numerous gyms and leisure centres to choose from in the immediate area. Hounslow Heath, a local nature reserve and one of the largest parks in the borough, is also a short walk away.

Education

A number of schools in Hounslow have been rated 'outstanding' by Ofsted including nearby Hounslow Heath Junior School and Hounslow Heath Infant and Nursery School.

Transport

Hounslow is located in Zone 4 in the Borough of Hounslow. Hounslow High Street benefits from excellent transport links, with Hounslow East & Hounslow Central Underground Stations both a 5-minute walk away and Hounslow Overground Station just a 10-minute walk. Heathrow Airport is a short drive away or 15 minutes on the tube.

Opening Hours

Monday 12:30 - 17:30, Tuesday-Sunday 10:00 - 17:30

Further benefits include a beautifully bright 17ft reception room, bespoke newly fitted kitchen with full appliances, a luxury bathroom, two double bedrooms (one of which has an en-suite) and a third single bedroom. Fletcher Road is conveniently located within short walking distance of Chiswick Park & South Acton Stations, as well as Turnham Green Terrace. The area offers a wide selection of amenities including local shopping, award winning bistro bars and & restaurants and brand shopping on Chiswick High Road combined with excellent transport connections into and out of town.

The Assembly, a new housing development in Hounslow that encompasses a beautifully landscaped garden square, forming the heart of the community and offering tranquil greenspace difficult to find so close to the capital and just moments from Hounslow high street.

detailedDescription:
Verdo is a collection of studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments built by EcoWorld London and is surrounded by well-kept parks, the tropical gardens of Kew and the River Thames. The beautifully crafted apartments are the start of a multi-million-pound regeneration programme taking place around Kew Bridge Station, TW8 which is set to include a range of retail and leisure facilities. Within the development, residents have use of a private gym, media screening room and the convenience of a 24-hr concierge. Residents will also be able to enjoy a beautiful private lounge that opens out directly onto a podium garden and sunlit terrace.

Verdo is ideally located for a range of world-famous local attractions; the grade II listed Kew Bridge leading to the Royal Botanical Gardens (a unesco world heritage site), Syon House set in Syon Park, and the recently restored Gunnersbury Park and Triangle Nature Reserve. The upmarket highstreets of Chiswick and Richmond have a diverse array of shops and restaurants both with local independent retailers as well as well-known national favourites. The scheme has excellent transport links, being just a minutes’ walk from Kew Bridge Station which provides easy access to central London at Waterloo Station in less than 30 minutes and is under 10 minutes’ walk from Gunnersbury Station which is serviced by the District & Overground lines.

Completing Q4 2021.

Register your interest and find your new home today at Verdo.

detailedDescription:
A well presented, two bedroom ground floor apartment set within this Art Deco purpose built development conveniently located moments away from Richmond, St Margarets village and Twickenham mainline station.

Cavendish House is located set back on Chertsey Road suitably positioned with good transport links. The property is a good size with its own private terrace and access to communal gardens directly off the kitchen, at the back of the property. It has a tiled walk-in shower bathroom and a separate toilet/basin. Two good size double bedrooms with contemporary wardrobes and the modern kitchen has a built-in dishwasher, and space for a washing machine, a tumble dryer and a fridge-freezer.

Cavendish House is located on Chertsey Road suitably positioned with easy access to St Margarets village and Twickenham mainline station.

detailedDescription:
We are pleased to offer this spacious 2 bedroom luxury flat for sale. The flat contains two double bedrooms (1 bedroom with fitted wardrobes and an ensuite shower & WC), 1 fully fitted family bathroom, a separate fully fitted kitchen, and a large living room, with a Juliet balcony.

The property has double glazing and wood flooring throughout as well as a good amount of storage space.

This light and spacious flat also benefits from an entry phone and secure parking and is situated on a low floor with direct access to the fire escape. Madison Heights has secured entrance to the block, lifts to all floors, and a shared rooftop terrace with views over the local area. There is no cladding on the block.

The flat would suit a professional couple, family, or investment buyer. The flat has been rented recently and has a potential rental yield of just over 6%. Vacant possession. No onward chain.

The flat is conveniently located close to shops, cafes, amenities, and public transport, including Hounslow East Tube station (Piccadilly Line) just a 3 minute walk away and a local school also within a few minutes' walk. Heathrow Airport, Central London, and the motorway network are all within easy access.

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
A well presented three-bedroom semi detached family home situated in the heart of Heston. A large reception room opens from the hallway and features original parquet wood flooring, original fireplaces and a large bay window, creating a relaxing living space. It boasts high ceilings with traditional features throughout. A second reception room sits to the back of the property with patio doors leading onto the garden. The first floor comprises three bedrooms, a bright and airy master bedroom. The bedrooms have original features, with the second of the largest benefitting from built-in wardrobes.
Externally there is a large rear garden complete with a garage providing useful outside storage.

Conveniently located within a short' walk to Osterley Underground Station, it all adds up to a real ''village feel''. By car, one is just a couple of minutes' drive from the A4/M4 and in turn the motorway network is a short drive. The property is within close proximity to a number of sought after schools (see school checker for full list).

No onward chain

Viewings highly recommended!

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from £650,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

An extended family home with a extensive rear garden. This wonderful property offers flexible living space and potential for further loft conversion if required. The ground floor accommodation offers two reception rooms, conservatory, downstairs shower room. Utility room and large kitchen diner. On the first floor are 5 bedrooms and a family bathroom. Externally there is off street parking for 2 cars and a part converted garage for storage.

Local Area

Situated on a popular residential street in Whitton/Twickenham borders amongst other semi detached houses with a community feel. A 10 minute walk to the stunning Crane Park nature reserve, a short drive or 15 min walk to Whitton train station and High Street offering plenty of local shops, restaurants and local pubs.

General Information

General Information:
Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

About High Street Quarter

Be part of an exciting new community in the heart of hounslow

High Street Quarter is a brand new development of one, two and three-bedroom homes in the centre of Hounslow.

Built around a new public square, you'll be at the heart of life with shops, restaurants and leisure facilities on your doorstep. Fast transport links are just a few minutes' walk away, making central London easily accessible.

This new lifestyle district will link the existing High Street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new destination in west London.

Leisure

Hounslow has a thriving and diverse town centre - comprising a mixture of high street stores and independent retailers. For sports fans, Twickenham Stadium is 2 miles away and Wyke Green Golf Club is just a 12-minute drive. There are also numerous gyms and leisure centres to choose from in the immediate area. Hounslow Heath, a local nature reserve and one of the largest parks in the borough, is also a short walk away.

Education

A number of schools in Hounslow have been rated 'outstanding' by Ofsted including nearby Hounslow Heath Junior School and Hounslow Heath Infant and Nursery School.

Transport

Hounslow is located in Zone 4 in the Borough of Hounslow. Hounslow High Street benefits from excellent transport links, with Hounslow East & Hounslow Central Underground Stations both a 5-minute walk away and Hounslow Overground Station just a 10-minute walk. Heathrow Airport is a short drive away or 15 minutes on the tube.

Opening Hours

Monday 12:30 - 17:30, Tuesday-Sunday 10:00 - 17:30

Location

Description

This split level first and second floor flat has been tastefully renovated and extended to create a light and airy atmosphere, evident by the high ceilings and an expanse of large windows. Upstairs on the top floor, following a recent extension houses the magnificent principle bedroom suite with a newly fitted stylish en suite bathroom plus built-in and eaves storage.

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from £390,000.

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

Kitchen

Spacious, modern fitted kitchen with access into the utility room.

Utility Room

Utility room with additional storage.

Lounge/Dining Room

Light and spacious living room with an extended area for dining and direct access onto the garden.

Bedroom Two

Double bedroom.

Outbuildings

Property Description

A fantastic opportunity to purchase this two bedroom semi-detached bungalow with an outhouse/home office, garage and low maintenance garden.

The property is in excellent condition throughout and benefits from no onward chain and the potential to extend into the loft (stpp)

The layout comprises; extended, smart fitted kitchen with a utility room, light and spacious reception room open plan to an extended dining room with direct access onto the garden, a bathroom with a bath and overhead shower, w.c and hand basin and two spacious double bedrooms.

Outside there is a large low maintenance garden and an outhouse/home office with a separate garage.

Very conveniently positioned in this popular residential road, close to Feltham town centre, shops and amenities. Feltham mainline station with a direct line into London Waterloo is less than a 10 minute walk away. The M3/M25/M4 are also easily accessible for the commuter by car.

Book A viewing 24/7 via our unique online service or by telephone.

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

This property boasts excellent natural light, wonderful ceiling height and extensive period features. The accommodation comprises a spacious bedroom with a feature fireplace, a large reception/dining area, a separate kitchen which benefits from ample storage, and a bright shower room.
Harvard Road is located just 0.25 miles from Gunnersbury Tube and Rail Station, and only a short walk from the shops and restaurants of the ever-popular Chiswick High Road, whilst enjoying easy access to the A4/M4 for Heathrow and the City.

To the left is the smaller bedroom, with a front aspect window. Ahead is the lounge, which is bright and airy with wood floors. The master bedroom is rear aspect and has a whole wall of built in storage.

The kitchen is contemporary with fitted units and door that leads out to the sunny private garden. The shower room is modern with white fitted bathroom furniture and a large frosted window. address: Pumping Station Road, Chiswick, London W4
detailedDescription:
**virtual tour available online**

An impressive lateral two bedroom apartment that occupies the entire top floor of a tucked away apartment building positioned on a quiet no through road close to the River Thames. At almost 2,000 square feet (184 SqM) the property is generously proportioned with an incredible open plan living space and two roof terraces. Completely refurbished just several years ago, the property is in immaculate condition throughout.

Upon entering property the sense of light and space is immediately apparent, a beautiful wood flooring with underfloor heating has been laid throughout the hall areas and into the open plan living space which is a stunning room that's flooded with light from multiple windows and the large doors which open onto the terrace. The roof terrace off the living area enjoys sun from the early afternoon through to the sunset, the perfect place to have an alfresco dinner. With functionality in mind during the refurbishment there are power and speaker points in the floor beneath the sofa. Tucked away in the corner near to the roof terrace is an enclosed area that serves as the ideal home office. There is also extensive storage space in eaves to either side of the room.

The kitchen has been beautifully designed with a wraparound breakfast bar and features several high quality built in appliances including the integrated oven, plate warmer, additional microwave oven, gas hob, full height freezer and fridge and dishwasher. Careful attention has been paid to ensure the space is functional with substantial storage and worktop space, and additions such as the Brita water filter tap and built in waste bin. Between the reception area and the kitchen there is ample space for a large dining table and chairs. The apartment is ideal for entertaining guests.

The two well-proportioned bedrooms boast sizeable built in wardrobes, which feature LED lighting upon opening the doors, and are filled with light from the windows and French doors which from both bedrooms open onto the south facing roof terrace which enjoys sun throughout the day. One of the bedrooms has an immaculate, modern en-suite shower room. The walk in shower has a large overhead rain shower head with additional hand shower and the floating vanity unit offers additional storage. The main bathroom has a bath with overhead rain shower, retractable hand shower and a modern towel rail. Both bathrooms have heated mirrors and additional LED lighting around the mirrors and vanity units.

Residents have an allocated parking space within the gated parking area and there are additional visitors parking within the secure area. There is also the ability to obtain an additional permit for the local area cpz.

The property benefits from a long lease with share of freehold and a low annual service charge.

There is a lift to front door from the ground floor and the current owners have explored the possibility to bring the lift directly into the apartment which would be possible subject to the necessary planning and management company approval.

The property is positioned on a quiet and leafy road just moments from the River Thames with immediate access to the towpath from which you can take a pleasant walk along to Chiswick Mall and beyond to several popular riverside pubs, playgrounds and green spaces positioned along the riverside.

For transport connections the property is ideally located for both road and rail travel. Chiswick Mainline station is just a 15 minute walk away for direct services into London Waterloo. For the underground residents can walk to Turnham Green Station in around 20 minutes. Several bus routes run nearby which travel to Richmond to the West and to Hammersmith to the East.

One of Chiswick's finest attractions, Chiswick House and Grounds are located just a short walk from the property. Free for all to enjoy, Chiswick House is beautiful to look at and the well-maintained gardens and grounds are a pleasant space year round. There is also a café within the grounds and a children's play area. Regular markets are held at Chiswick House which include all types of stalls from deli foods and baked goods to handmade homewares and clothing.

New Chiswick Pool is the nearest Pool and Gym to the property, but there is also the prestigious Riverside Health Club nearby and the Roko Health Club both around 5 minutes away by car. Dukes Meadows Golf and Tennis Club is also around 5 minutes away in the car and several rowing clubs are nearby along the river. Rowing fans can readily enjoy the annual Cambridge and Oxford race which passes along the stretch of river nearest the property before the finish line at Chiswick Bridge.

Whilst Chiswick High Road is within walking distance, together with the boutiques and fine restaurants on Devonshire Road, there is a small parade of shops nearby on Edensor Road which includes a convenience store and takeaway options.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Fabulous townhouse with exceptional views over the River Thames, private walled garden, separate garage, plus communal gardens & off-street parking.

Location

Chiswick Wharf is a development situated on the banks of the River Thames in Chiswick, providing easy access to central London via the A4, and via the M4 for Heathrow Airport and the west of England. Turnham Green Underground station (District line) and Chiswick railway station are close by.

Chiswick is a hugely popular and prosperous large suburb of West London located on the northern side of the River Thames, 6 miles (9.7 km) west of Charing Cross. It was historically an ancient parish in the county of Middlesex, with an agrarian and fishing economy. The name "Chiswick" is of Old English origin meaning "Cheese Farm" and originates from the riverside meadows and farms that are thought to have supported an annual cheese fair on Dukes Meadows up until the 18th century.

The style of property in Chiswick is varied offering everything from mansion flats along the High Road and on Sutton Court Road, to pretty Victorian cottages on the Glebe Estate. Large Victorian detached houses are found in Grove Park, and Arts & Crafts houses throughout Bedford Park. The River front, Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green are lined with elegant Georgian houses ensuring that there is a fantastic variety of property throughout the local area.

Chiswick High Road, famous for its boulevard-style pavements, is full of quality independent outlets and an increasingly up-market selection of high street names which run from Hammersmith through to the Chiswick roundabout. Chiswick is a great place to shop and eat. Tesco, Sainsbury's, Waitrose and Marks and Spencer are all represented. Serving meat lovers are Macken Bros, Wyndham House and Ginger Pig butchers. Covent Garden Fishmongers do as their name suggests. Bayley & Sage have an amazing cheese counter and the Grove Park Deli on Fauconberg Road is also very popular. The Old Cinema provides Antique Vintage Retro Collections. Attractive fruit, vegetable and flower stalls add colour to the High Road. High Street banks, chemists, dry cleaners, beauty spas, fashion shops, off licences and general repair shops as well as many other outlets means there is no need to go elsewhere.

Among Chiswick's fine dining choices are Michelin-starred La Trompette on Devonshire Road and Le Vacherin on South Parade. High Road House and its Brasserie are part of the Soho House empire. Numerous high street restaurants such as Honest Burgers, Cote, Byrons and Pizza Express cater for family tastes.

Lord Burlington's Chiswick House is a picturesque, 18th-century Palladian mansion with gardens designed by William Kent. The birthplace of the English Landscape Movement, the gardens, with their statuary hedges and vistas, has had a £12 million makeover which includes a new café by architects Caruso St John. In recent years Chiswick House grounds have played host to Soho House group's House Festival, enticing the great and the good of the media industry with performers who are both nationally renowned and locally resident.

Bedford Park, London's first garden suburb, was built between 1875 and 1886 as part of the Arts & Crafts revival. Victorian property developer Jonathan Carr instructed lead architect Richard Norman Shaw (alongside ej May, W Wilson and ew Godwin) in the building of a collection of houses and studios that now form a conservation area and are for the most part Grade II listed. Many of these houses feature elements of styling from William Morris, to whose legacy is dedicated the William Morris Society at Kelmscott House on Upper Mall.

Description

The ground floor of this house offers a good-sized kitchen/dining room, from which is a utility room. The ground floor also offers a study, with en suite shower room, thereby allowing scope for this to be a further bedroom.

From the kitchen is access to a private walled garden, beyond which are further communal riverside gardens.
The first floor comprises two reception rooms and a cloakroom, and again one of these might be used as bedroom depending on the preferred arrangement.

To the rear of the house the larger of the two reception rooms has a fireplace and superb views out over the river, and the other offers beautiful views towards St. Nicholas Church. Large double doors into the hallway spread light throughout this floor.

On the second floor are two further bedrooms, a family bathroom, and the loft space above has been converted into a bedroom with an en suite shower room. Two double-height Velux windows open out to maximise light and again capture views over the river.

The house also offers a separate garage and communal off-street parking.

Square Footage: 1727 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Aston Rowe are proud to present three bedroom terraced house in one of Acton's most desirable roads. The property is contemporary throughout, and boasts potential to extend in to the loft S.T.P.P.
