detailedDescription:
Huge potential to extend and refurbish (Subject to consent). 1445 Sq Ft / 134 Sq M, three bedroom terraced house located on a popular residential street in central Chiswick.

The accommodation comprises: Entrance hallway, 14'5 reception room, 12'5 rear reception room, ground floor shower room and spacious 30'1 kitchen/dining room.

Stairs to first floor.

16'2 master bedroom with feature bay window, 11'2 double bedroom with double doors to flat roof, further 12'4 double bedroom, family bathroom, undeveloped loft,

Gardens: West facing rear garden with 16'7 shed/workshop.

Kingscote Road is a centrally located residential street with many of the properties already extended 'up & out' whilst enjoying a good selection of amenities including shopping on Chiswick High Road, a great choice of award winging restaurants and bistro bars combined with excellent transport connections into and out of town.

About chiswick.....

Chiswick is a hugely popular and prosperous large suburb of West London located on the northern side of the River Thames, 6 miles (9.7 km) west of Charing Cross.

Whilst retaining a wonderful village charm, Chiswick is a vibrant area brimming with the activity and opportunity typical of London.

Chiswick boasts a stunning range of property including elegant Georgian architecture, renowned Norman Shaw designed Bedford Park houses to quaint cottages in the Glebe Estate.

Chiswick High Road offers a fantastic range of bars, restaurants, supermarkets, an ever-expanding range of delis and boutiques.

About Harpers of Chiswick….

Bespoke property solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

What is the difference between Harpers of Chiswick and generic estate agents?
Customers expectations have moved on whilst most estate agents haven’t changed in fifty years. Harpers of Chiswick is a property consultancy and not just an estate agents. We deliver a multi-faceted ‘everything is possible’ approach to Chiswick residential property. We offer all the services that you would expect, but many more..”

We manage all the maintenance for your own home, not just the properties we let. We call it ‘Home Assist’.
We can feed your cat, put the bins out and open the curtains when you go on holiday. Your ‘Holiday Guardian’.
We can even hold a set of your house keys, just in case you lock yourself out! Fully licensed ‘Key Holding’.
Property Staging and Interior Design by our in-house team to maximise your investment.
Private Introductions for clients and customers in the public eye who seek ultimate discretion.

Even our fee structures are designed to favour our clients. “Your sense of value is more important to me than my dreams of a new Ducati.” Sales fees are tiered and linked to results, not old fashioned percentages that favour the agents pocket. Our lettings fees are charged monthly, not annually in advance, and you only pay us if your tenant pays the rent. Innovative terms for modern markets.”

We have no desire to be the largest. We consciously keep our portfolios compact so that we can successfully apply the time, high levels of detail and attention you require and deserve. Excellence for the few rather than a sausage factory for many.

Bespoke solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

This brand new, one-bedroom apartment is situated on the forth floor of Ivy House at Verdo - Kew Bridge, TW8. The contemporary kitchen comes with fitted Siemens and Bosch appliances, and the bedroom features a fitted wardrobe. With engineered timber floor finishes throughout, the open plan living area provides direct access to a spacious balcony.

Verdo - Kew Bridge is a collection of contemporary apartments with access to lifestyle residents' amenities. The development is made up of three beautiful buildings - Ivy, Lily and Jasmine House - all surrounded by private landscaped gardens, allowing you to relax in a green oasis just a quick hop from central London.

Each home has easy access to the spacious residents' lounge, which boasts a work zone and private meeting room. A media room is available for watching films or sporting events, and there is a private residents' gym. The lounge spills directly out to the residents' podium gardens. The sunlit terraces and inviting play areas are ready and waiting to be explored and enjoyed.

The development is located at the heart of Brentford, which is being transformed into a vibrant new neighbourhood with shops, cafes, restaurants. A home at Verdo - Kew Bridge also puts you in touching distance of some of London's best loved high streets, including Kew Village and Chiswick.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Positioned on one of the Grove Park Conservation Areas premier roads, this attractive six-bedroom family home is one of only six of this particular style and benefits from gated off street parking, a large South West facing garden and a total floor area of 4,477 square feet (416 sqm). Sympathetically refurbished by the existing owners and designed by renowned local architect Pierre Fowell, the Victorian features have been perfectly blended with modern style and conveniences to create versatile, light and attractive accommodation over the ground and raised ground floors and ample bedroom space over the upper floors.

Set back from the road accessed through electric wrought-iron gates on to a paved driveway. Yorkstone steps lead up to the raised ground entrance and give an immediate sense of the property’s original grandeur. Upon entering the house, you are greeted by a wide hallway with Victorian Braemer style tiled flooring and a view directly through to the rear extension and the large glass windows that overlook the garden. To the right you will find the original, bay fronted, raised ground floor drawing room. Complete with feature Chesney’s fire place, hard wood floors and the original cornices, ceiling rose and double-glazed sash windows. Across the hall the tiled floor flows in to a convenient and cleverly designed vestibule with a void featuring a bespoke chandelier overlooking the Gym below.

To the rear of the house you will enter the formal dining area, next to the wine store, opening to a viewing area which leads to the open plan kitchen/breakfast room all benefiting from floor to ceiling windows looking over the wonderfully landscaped south west facing 66 ft rear garden. The family space spans the full 35ft width of the house and is filled with light from the cleverly designed rear bay window. The German bespoke kitchen is fully equipped with Miele appliances.

detailedDescription:

Entering the receiving hallway, the property leads through to a large living room with a charming bay window and period fireplace, two bedrooms, both of which have built-in wardrobes, a kitchen with integrated appliances and a bathroom fully equipped with a bathtub and over head shower. The property further benefits from a long lease, gas central heating and ample storage space.

Glenhurst Road is ideally located for access to Brentford (overground), Northfield (Piccadilly) and Boston Manor (Piccadilly line) stations, as well as the A4/M4 motorways. The town centre, in addition to numerous local shops, cafes, bars and restaurants, and the lovely open green spaces of Boston Manor Park are also only a short walk away.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Sympathetically refurbished by the existing owners and designed by renowned local architect Pierre Fowell, the Victorian features have been perfectly blended with modern style and conveniences to create versatile, light and attractive accommodation over the ground and raised ground floors and ample bedroom space over the upper floors.

Set back from the road accessed through electric wrought-iron gates on to a paved driveway. Yorkstone steps lead up to the raised ground entrance and give an immediate sense of the property's original grandeur. Upon entering the house, you are greeted by a wide hallway with Victorian Braemer style tiled flooring and a view directly through to the rear extension and the large glass windows that overlook the garden.
To the right you will find the original, bay fronted, raised ground floor drawing room. Complete with feature Chesney's fire place, hard wood floors and the original cornices, ceiling rose and double-glazed sash windows.
Across the hall the tiled floor flows in to a convenient and cleverly designed vestibule with a void featuring a bespoke chandelier overlooking the Gym below.

To the rear of the house you will enter the formal dining area, next to the wine store, opening to a viewing area which leads to the open plan kitchen/breakfast room all benefitting from floor to ceiling windows looking over the wonderfully landscaped south west facing 66 ft rear garden. The family space spans the full 35ft width of the house and is filled with light from the cleverly designed rear bay window. The German bespoke kitchen is fully equipped with Miele appliances. The Ground Floor offers flexible and functional living with an open sitting area, home cinema with 100inch projector and a music room overlooking the garden with a double height voided ceiling through to the raised ground family area. On this floor you will also find the Gym room, with double ceiling, front patio access and separate shower room with a Nordic Sauna. The Ground floor further benefits from a generous utility & plant room and a large study, with a bay window and bespoke teak wood built in bookshelves, desk and storage which houses the home's central headend

On the first floor you will find the dual aspect principal suite. The suite is front to back, with the bedroom positioned to the rear of the property overlooking the garden. It has the fully fitted dressing area, with bespoke sapele wardrobes to the front, leading to the en-suite bathroom with twin sinks, a bath and separate shower. The first floor also benefits from another double bedroom to the rear, also with garden views.
On the second floor you will find a further four double bedrooms, one of which is en-suite and a family bathroom. A fully boarded loft, measuring 850sqft is also accessed from the second-floor landing providing ample storage to compliment this superb family home

Spencer Road is a highly regarded tree lined road, the house is set half a mile from the iconic Chiswick House and its beautiful gardens as well as the wide-open spaces of Dukes meadow. Local amenities include the well thought of Fauconberg Village, numerous pubs & restaurants and the highly regarded Riverside Club with its exceptional pools (both in and outdoor) Tennis facilities and Gym. Easy access to top London Public schools including St Paul's, Latymer Upper and Godolphin & Latymer.

Chiswick Overground station is located 160 metres from the property, giving easy and frequent access to London Waterloo & Vauxhall in less than 30 mins. London Heathrow Airport, offering unparalleled international connections, is 10 miles away and can be accessed by car in less than half an hour. The M4 is easily accessed from local roads for an easy start to all national car travel.

address: Strand On The Green, Chiswick W4
detailedDescription: riverhomes are delighted to bring to market this magnificent family home on Strand on the Green with direct river views. Originally built as a Dairy/Farmhouse on the Burlington Estate, the original building dates back to 1697. The current owners have sympathetically and extensively extended the property, using 17th century hand made bricks sourced from the demolition of the Royal Mint building and original Georgian oak panelling. Set back and elevated from the road and with stunning river views it provides over 3000 sq. Ft of lateral living over two floors, it boasts five bedrooms (three with river views) three bathrooms, two reception rooms, dining room, kitchen, family room and a snug on the lower ground floor. Four of the bedrooms are located in the main house and the fifth is in a self contained cottage in the garden with a separate entrance through the garage. In addition it has a large and mature front and rear garden and garage and off-street parking. Strand on the Green is a lively waterside community, with its local restaurants and parade of independent shops. Located close to Kew Bridge and Chiswick overland stations, with convenient access to A4/M4 both into and out of London. EPC rating F.

title: 13 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Hope Cottage, built in 1866, is a wonderfully charming two bedroom semi detached Victorian cottage, situated in the heart of Old Isleworth. Rarely available and offering bright and airy accommodation over two floors, this property offers purchasers a perfect opportunity to add their own stamp.

With two separate reception rooms on the ground floor and separate kitchen leading out to a mature garden, this property is packed full of period features such as original fireplaces. On the first floor there are two double bedrooms and large family bathroom with access to a useable loft storage space.

The property is located in the Old Isleworth Four Roads (oifr) Conservation Area, which can be seen by the trademark award winning flower baskets that are organised by the oifr Resident’s Association.

Conveniently located on Worple Road, the property provides access to excellent schools, St Margaret’s Village, the River Thames and two train stations (Isleworth and St Margarets). Richmond is within easy access on foot or regular bus service, giving access to Richmond Station (District Line, Overground and South West Trains). The motorist also has quick access to the M4, M3 and M25.

Exclusively marketed with johns&co, Brentford.
features: ['Semi detached with side access to garden', 'Period features throughout', 'Mature garden', 'Rarely available', 'Victorian family home', 'Two double bedrooms', 'Large family bathroom', 'Ample storage']
title: 2 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A one double bedroom apartment in the popular Great West Quarter Development. The property has high ceilings, a high spec open plan kitchen/reception room, large utility cupboards, a concierge service, a communal gym and secure underground parking.

The Great West Quarter Development is located just half a mile from Brentford mainline station which has a frequent service to London Waterloo and it is also within a mile from South Ealing tube station and the amenities along Brentford High Street.

detailedDescription:
A lovely spacious two double bedroom waterside apartment situated in this popular development. The property benefits from generous living space with a large open plan reception with fully integrated kitchen/diner and a private balcony overlooking communal gardens with the river Thames and Kew Botanical Gardens beyond. The property benefits from secured underground parking and concierge.

Ferry Quays is an exclusive and well run development on the banks of the river Thames. The Thames path can be picked up directly in front of the development.

Brentford Station is under 10 minutes' walk away and the M4 corridor is within easy reach.

Brentford High Street is about to embark on a significant redevelopment program which will revolutionise the area making Brentford a very exciting area to invest.

detailedDescription:
***virtual viewing available*** A well presented three bedroom end of terrace family home situated within a quiet cul-de-sac location. The property offers a good size kitchen to the front, a large lounge/diner overlooking the rear garden, three good size bedrooms and family bathroom. Further benefits include a garage in a block and on street parking. The property is situated within easy reach of local amenities, schools and Feltham mainline station. Viewings are highly recommended. EPC Rating: C

agent's note
Mortgage Advice Bureau (mab)
We are pleased to confirm that we offer you and all our clients the opportunity to consult with Mortgage Advice Bureau (mab). They are one of the largest mortgage brokers in the country and provide specialist mortgage advice. They can search thousands of mortgage deals to find the right one for you and due to their size have exclusive rates from many lenders that cannot be found on the high street or anywhere else. Mab have won over 70 national awards for the quality of their advice and service during the last five years. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with mab. Should you decide to use mab, The Frost Partnership will receive a referral fee of £300 inclusive of VAT from mab. You will not have to pay anything with regard to this to The Frost Partnership.

Home Legal Services (hls)
We are pleased to confirm that we offer you and all our clients the opportunity to consult with Home Legal Services (hls) for conveyancing services. Hls provide us with a panel of quality conveyancing solicitors who operate on a fixed fee and a no sale, no fee arrangement, with 24/7 online case reports keeping you up to date at all times. It is your decision whether you choose to deal with hls. Should you decide to use hls, The Frost Partnership will receive a referral fee of £250 inclusive of VAT from hls. You will not have to pay anything with regard to this to The Frost Partnership.

detailedDescription:
Freehold building - former take away with self contained flat - planning application submitted.
Brian Cox are pleased to present this mixed use freehold building for sale which is situated close to the River Thames and Kew Bridge and provides easy access to the A4/M4. The property currently has an A3 and A5 license. The current owners are in the process of applying for planning permission to convert the property in to a four bedroom end of terrace house that will be arranged over three floors. Currently the property consists of a disused Chinese Take Away with a two bedroom self contained flat above that comprises of a lounge, kitchen, bathroom and two bedrooms. The owners intention is to sell the property with planning granted. Chain Free.

agency_name: Legal & General Affordable Homes - The Moorings
detailedDescription:
Brunch In Brentford | Saturday 31st July 2021 | 10am - 1pm

Join us for a unique opportunity to explore The Moorings, Brentford and find out how Shared Ownership could help you take that step on to the property ladder sooner than you think.

Oh... And enjoy a selection of high quality handmade pastries, sandwiches, brioches, wraps and more - courtesy of brunch specialists Feather & Heart.

To book a place register your interest and our dedicated Sales Consultant will be delighted in helping you book your appointment.

Please note: In order to maintain social distancing, all visits to The Moorings will be by appointment only.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Live by the water, enjoying the open space and a wealth of nature. This 2 bed Shared Ownership apartment features luxurious interiors, spacious layouts and a private balcony. Move in from this Summer. Book your viewing today!

Plot A01,04, a 2 Bedroom apartment in The Moorings is available via Shared Ownership, the price shown is for a 75% share of the full market value of £525,000

Financial Breakdown:
Full market value: £525,000
75% share value: £393,750
10% deposit of 75%: £39,375
Rent on unowned share: £301 per month
Viewings by appointment only, book yours today!
An outstanding location

The Moorings offers thoughtfully designed apartments in a prime waterfront location within Brentford. Each home benefits from a terrace or a balcony providing private outside space, in addition to communal landscaped roof terraces with views across the River Brent.

This contemporary one-bedroom type 5 apartment features a modern interior that combines form and function, resulting in a beautifully designed home. Fitted with the latest a-rated appliances, impeccable finishes throughout and bright living areas, all constructed to the highest standards.

Plot A01.04 is a 758 sq ft apartment and available with Shared Ownership. Both bedrooms and the South-East facing private terrace, all benefit from full height windows and enjoy views across the River Brent.

Limited parking is available at The Moorings, please speak to the Sales Team for further information. Zip car membership is available to apartments without an undercroft parking space.

Situated in the city's garden
The Moorings is surrounded by some of London's best-loved parks and reserves. With such an abundance of green open spaces to explore, it couldn't be easier to escape the trappings of modern life and enjoy the very best of nature.

Take a stroll or a cycle along Brentford Lock or visit Syon Park and feel like you are in the deep countryside. Go further afield, across the River Thames, and find more green spaces such as Kew Gardens and Richmond Park.

The development is close to local shops, cafes, and restaurants along Brentford High Street and within easy reach is the original Westfield London.

What is shared ownership?

If you can't afford the mortgage on 100% of a home, Shared Ownership offers you the chance to buy a share of your home (between 25% and 75%) and pay rent on the remaining share. Later on, you could buy bigger shares when you can afford to and, if you chose, own the property outright. Monthly costs to purchase via Shared Ownership are generally less than purchasing outright or renting, making it a fantastic option to get onto the housing ladder.

Legal & General Affordable Homes are a Registered Provider offering these apartments for sale on a Shared Ownership basis. We are creating communities to live, grow and flourish and are committed to removing the stress and anxiety associated with moving house, whilst delivering customer satisfaction and quality new homes.

The video tour is representative. It shows the 2 bedroom Type 20 show apartment at The Moorings.

detailedDescription:
Description

Rps Estates are proud to be chosen as the Sole Agents for this spectacular 6/7 bedroom Semi-Detached house on Vicarage Farm Road with no forward chain. This property has just been completely refurbished to a high standard throughout and all aspects internally have been renovated. Internally, the house boasts ample living space spread over 3 floors and externally, offers parking for up to 2 cars and a low maintenance newly landscaped rear garden.

On the ground floor the property benefits from a 27ft open plan reception room with fully fitted modern kitchen, 2 double bedrooms on the ground floor and a spacious family bathroom, the first floor consists of larger than average master bedroom (7th bedroom) but is currently used as a second reception room, an en-suite and another double bedroom. The third floor is a well planned loft conversion which consists of a further 3 bedrooms and a WC.

Location is excellent being a 5 minute walk to Hounslow West Tube Station (Piccadilly Line), local amenities of Hounslow West, plenty of road and bus transport links allowing easy access to neighbouring towns and the Heathrow Airport.

This property is best suited for large families looking to live in a modern family home or is ideal for buy-to-let investors who have an opportunity of using this property as a H.M.O which can generate an gross annual rental income of £51,000 p.a (approx. 6.67% yield).

Viewings are highly recommended! Call us today to book in your appointment!

agency_name: Legal & General Affordable Homes - The Moorings
detailedDescription:
Brunch In Brentford | Saturday 31st July 2021 | 10am - 1pm

Join us for a unique opportunity to explore The Moorings, Brentford and find out how Shared Ownership could help you take that step on to the property ladder sooner than you think.

Oh... And enjoy a selection of high quality handmade pastries, sandwiches, brioches, wraps and more - courtesy of brunch specialists Feather & Heart.

To book a place register your interest and our dedicated Sales Consultant will be delighted in helping you book your appointment.

Please note: In order to maintain social distancing, all visits to The Moorings will be by appointment only.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Live by the water, enjoying the open space and a wealth of nature. This 1 bed Shared Ownership apartment features luxurious interiors, spacious layouts, and private balcony. Move in from this Summer. Book your viewing today!

Plot A01,05, a 1 Bedroom apartment in The Moorings is available via Shared Ownership, the price shown is for a 75% share of the full market value of £390,000.

Financial Breakdown:
Full market value: £390,000
75% share value: £292,500
10% deposit of 75%: £29,250
Rent on unowned share: £223 per month
Viewings by appointment only, book yours today!
An outstanding location

The Moorings offers thoughtfully designed apartments in a prime waterfront location within Brentford. Each home benefits from a terrace or a balcony providing private outside space, in addition to communal landscaped roof terraces with views across the River Brent.

This contemporary one-bedroom type 6 apartment features a modern interior that combines form and function, resulting in a beautifully designed home. Fitted with the latest a-rated appliances, impeccable finishes throughout and bright living areas, all constructed to the highest standards.

Plot A01.05 is a 539 sq ft apartment and available with Shared Ownership. The apartment has a private balcony area with access from both the bedroom and main living area.

Limited parking is available at The Moorings, please speak to the Sales Team for further information. Zip car membership is available to apartments without an undercroft parking space.

Situated in the city's garden
The Moorings is surrounded by some of London's best-loved parks and reserves. With such an abundance of green open spaces to explore, it couldn't be easier to escape the trappings of modern life and enjoy the very best of nature.

Take a stroll or a cycle along Brentford Lock or visit Syon Park and feel like you are in the deep countryside. Go further afield, across the River Thames, and find more green spaces such as Kew Gardens and Richmond Park.

The development is close to local shops, cafes, and restaurants along Brentford High Street and within easy reach is the original Westfield London.

What is shared ownership?
If you can't afford the mortgage on 100% of a home, Shared Ownership offers you the chance to buy a share of your home (between 25% and 75%) and pay rent on the remaining share. Later on, you could buy bigger shares when you can afford to and, if you chose, own the property outright. Monthly costs to purchase via Shared Ownership are generally less than purchasing outright or renting, making it a fantastic option to get onto the housing ladder.

Legal & General Affordable Homes are a Registered Provider offering these apartments for sale on a Shared Ownership basis. We are creating communities to live, grow and flourish and are committed to removing the stress and anxiety associated with moving house, whilst delivering customer satisfaction and quality new homes.

The video tour is representative. It shows the 2 bedroom Type 20 show apartment at The Moorings.

detailedDescription:
This larger than average three-bedroom semi-detached family home is presented to the market for the first time in over 50 years in fair to good condition throughout and is set on a leafy residential road on the Whitton Border. Central Avenue falls into the catchment areas for highly rated Richmond and Hounslow Borough schools with outstanding Ofsted reports so perfect for young families. The road is also located within a short walk to local shops and local bus routes servicing Hounslow, Richmond, Twickenham and Isleworth.

The property comprises a bright and airy entrance hall, a spacious front reception room with wide working bay window and a rear reception room leading onto the conservatory with views and access to a well established landscaped rear garden which is laid to lawn and has a large patio area at the end with working Koi pond. The kitchen area is perfectly placed near to the dining area; ideal for family meal time and is in good condition throughout with fitted cupboards and drawers and plenty of work surfaces.

To the first floor is a family bathroom with separate WC, two really good size double bedrooms and a large single size bedroom.

Further benefits include shared drive to garage, gas central heating, double glazed windows and potential to further extend to the rear and into the loft subject to local planning permission.

Both bedrooms have full height windows and there is a large private balcony, Limited parking is available at The Moorings, please speak to the Sales Team for further information. Zip car membership is available to apartments without an undercroft parking space.

Situated in the city's garden
The Moorings is surrounded by some of London's best-loved parks and reserves. With such an abundance of green open spaces to explore, it couldn't be easier to escape the trappings of modern life and enjoy the very best of nature.

Take a stroll or a cycle along Brentford Lock or visit Syon Park and feel like you are in the deep countryside. Go further afield, across the River Thames, and find more green spaces such as Kew Gardens and Richmond Park.

The development is close to local shops, cafes, and restaurants along Brentford High Street and within easy reach is the original Westfield London..

What is shared ownership?
If you can't afford the mortgage on 100% of a home, Shared Ownership offers you the chance to buy a share of your home (between 25% and 75%) and pay rent on the remaining share. Later on, you could buy bigger shares when you can afford to and, if you chose, own the property outright. Monthly costs to purchase via Shared Ownership are generally less than purchasing outright or renting, making it a fantastic option to get onto the housing ladder.

Legal & General Affordable Homes are a Registered Provider offering these apartments for sale on a Shared Ownership basis. We are creating communities to live, grow and flourish and are committed to removing the stress and anxiety associated with moving house, whilst delivering customer satisfaction and quality new homes.

The video tour is representative. It shows the 2 bedroom Type 20 show apartment at The Moorings

A bright and spacious three bedroom terraced house overlooking Gunnersbury Park.

This property benefits from three bedrooms, wooden flooring finish throughout, galley kitchen with ample storage space and built in appliances. The kitchen leads to a beautifully presented private garden with a purpose built outbuilding. The original reception room has undergone refurbishment and now boasts an extended rear second reception area which contains a separate bathroom. The loft area offers additional storage space and potential to convert for more living space (STPP).

Lionel Road North is situated south of Popes Lane and is well located for A4/M4 access to Heathrow and Central London. The amenities of South Ealing and Brentford High Street including shops, local cafes and restaurants are all within walking distance. Excellent school catchment area including Lionel Road North School and Green Dragon Primary school. This property is close to South Ealing train station (Piccadilly line) and Acton Town train station (Piccadilly and District lines)

Three Bedroom Family Home close to Gunnersbury Park.

This property further benefits from a spacious office / storage facility in the garden with full power.

detailedDescription:
The apartment is finished to a high standard throughout and is situated in one of the most prime positions of the development. Concord Court as it is known is one of the most prominent blocks within Palladian Gardens which makes up part of the Chiswick Gate scheme. This apartment benefits from a private West facing balcony that boasts views over the communal gardens.

Featuring a large open plan kitchen/living room with built-in appliances and a limed oak flooring, leading to a large West facing balcony. The double bedroom has a real sense of space due to the two floor to ceiling windows and built-in wardrobe. Leading off the hallway there is also a sizeable bathroom, storage cupboard and a separate utility cupboard.

The apartment also has the advantage of; direct lift access, a concierge service - 7 days a week (7am-7pm), access to the communal gardens and a secure allocated underground car parking space and bike storage. In addition, there is an onsite gym for residents (under a separate agreement).

Concord Court is on the northern boundary of the Chiswick Gate development located just off Burlington Lane. The development is situated next to Chiswick House and gardens. A short walk away from The Chiswick High Road for shops, restaurants and entertainment as well as The River Thames for riverside strolls.

There are local bus routes that stop directly outside the development and other Public transport is available at Chiswick Overground Station or Turnham Green Station (District Line).

26 minutes - Chiswick Overground to London Waterloo
16 minutes - By car to Heathrow airport

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This gorgeous Victorian cottage features a lovely villa style exterior and charming character interior which has been cleverly altered to provide a larger than average kitchen/breakfast room, in addition to the two delightful
receptions. This is a rarely available style of property and well worth an internal inspection to be fully appreciated.

For Sale:

This property has been well cared for by our clients and occupies A sought after location in one of the area's premier roads and being A victorian cottage, it has A great deal of character and charm, ideal for those buyers seeking something A little different. The accommodation comprises of two good size bedrooms to the first floor with a large master bedroom to the front, featuring exposed wood floor, both bedrooms being served by a family bathroom. To the ground floor, there is a delightful living room with sash windows and feature fireplace and a second reception room adjacent to the lovely kitchen and conservatory area which makes an ideal breakfast area, there are double doors leading out onto the enchanting rear garden. Outside, the garden is well screened and offers a delightful walk along a zig zag course and extends to approximately 100ft. In length and is well enclosed.

Location:

St Stephens Road is a prime residential road close to Hounslow town centre, mainline station and local schools and shopping facilities. Whitton town centre is also close at hand with its mainline station and popular High Street. Heathrow airport is also a short drive away as is the A316 which offers easy access to London and Richmond in one direction and the southwest, M25 and M3 in the other.

detailedDescription:
Bettermove are delighted to welcome to the market this charming two bedroom ground floor maisonette for sale in Whitton, available with no forward chain.

The interior of this beautifully-presented property consists of a spacious reception room, separate fitted kitchen, two bedrooms and a bathroom. The property boasts gardens to the front and rear with an enclosed lawned area to the rear, perfect for enjoying the summer months.

Situated in the sought after area of Whitton, the property is close to a wide range of local amenities, including shops, supermarkets, restaurants, cafes and pubs. Transport connections are available from Whitton and Hounslow rail stations, connecting the property with London Waterloo, as well as the A316, M4 and M25.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A handsome and very substantial detached 4 double bedroom family house built in the early 1900's and offering very flexible accommodation. Lying within easy walking distance of Twickenham's town centre and station with its fast and frequent service into London Waterloo.

The current owner has already extended the property to the side in order to create consulting rooms, but these could easily be adapted to form a self-contained granny or au pair flat. This would still leave excellent extension potential to both the rear and into the loft space (subject to planning).

The property boasts some amazing original features, in particular the magnificent entrance hall with it's panelled walls and a stunning leaded & stained-glass window. There is also a sunny 68' x 43' rear garden with a delightful summer house/studio and brick-built bike store, whilst to the front there is an 'in-and-out' driveway allowing off street parking for several cars.

The property is located close to the A316 offering swift access by car into central London in one direction and the West country via the M3 in the other.

address: Jasmine House, Verdo Kew Bridge TW8
detailedDescription:
A studio apartment with an individual terrace located a short walk away from Kew Bridge railway and 10 miuntes from Gunnersbury tube station.

EcoWorld's Verdo Kew Bridge development is in a new neighborhood within well connected and burgeoning Brentford. Surrounded by well kept parks, the tropical gardens of Kew and the River Thames, Verdo is the start of an exciting regeneration zone. With Kew Bridge railway station a minute's walk away and Gunnersbury tube station a 10 minute walk away, you can be in Central London in no more than 30 minutes.

Verdo is a collection of studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments built by EcoWorld London and is surrounded by well kept parks, the tropical gardens of Kew and the River Thames. The beautifully crafted apartments are the start of a multi million pound regeneration programme taking place around Kew Bridge Station, TW8 which is set to include a range of retail and leisure facilities. Within the development, residents have use of a private gym, media screening room and the convenience of a 24 hr concierge. Residents will also be able to enjoy a beautiful private lounge that opens out directly onto a podium garden and sunlit terrace.

Verdo is ideally located for a range of world famous local attractions; the grade II listed Kew Bridge leading to the Royal Botanical Gardens (a unesco world heritage site), Syon House set in Syon Park, and the recently restored Gunnersbury Park and Triangle Nature Reserve. The upmarket highstreets of Chiswick and Richmond have a diverse array of shops and restaurants both with local independent retailers as well as well known national favourites. The scheme has excellent transport links, being just a minutes’ walk from Kew Bridge Station which provides easy access to central London at Waterloo Station in less than 30 minutes and is under 10 minutes’ walk from Gunnersbury Station which is serviced by the District & Overground lines.

*CGIs are used for illustrative purposes only*

Summary

For Sale By Online Auction. Starting Bid 225,000. Terms and conditions apply.

We welcome to the market this one-bedroom apartment with own front door entrance and patio, which is conveniently located just moments from Isleworth Rail Station and benefitting from secure residents parking. Odeon Parade is situated in the centre of historic Isleworth, within walking distance from the River Thames, Syon and Osterley (National Trust) Parks.

The property comprises high ceilings, a large modern reception open-plan fitted kitchen and large double bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en-suite. This superb development is located on the doorstep of great transport links including Isleworth Mainline Station (serving London Waterloo) Osterley Tub, (Piccadilly Line to Central London and Heathrow) and several main bus routes. The property is being sold with a long lease, perfect for investors or first-time buyers

The vendor advises that although the property does not have an allocated parking space, parking permits are available from Hounslow Council to park on surrounding streets.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

address: Colne House, Manor Place, Feltham TW14
detailedDescription:
Shared ownership

This brand new home is available to buy from as little as 104,000 with a 40% share!

This ground floor apartment benefits from a spacious open plan lounge/kitchen/diner with a private terrace, double bedroom and luxurious bathroom suite.

Whether seeking some tranquil green space or a fast commute to central London, there’s something for everyone in this stunning new development. Situated just opposite Feltham Station, this contemporary apartment complex overlooks Longford River and is in close proximity to several parks including Hayworth Park and Leitrim Park. Each thoughtfully considered apartment comes with its own balcony or terrace to take in the views.

Feltham is a thriving district with big plans. Advantageously situated close to Heathrow and with fast links into Central London, things are set to get even better. Buying at Centrum you’ll be part of one of the capital’s most exciting regeneration projects, and at the centre of a neighbourhood that’s really going places. Investment in the area includes not only stylish new housing developments, and more local jobs, but improved transport links and even better retail and leisure facilities. All set to transform the area over the next 15 years.

Pricing & affordability

Approximate Size: 53.0 m2

Full Market Value: £260,000

40% Share Price: £104,000 (rent £357.50pcm)
50% Share Price: £130,000 (rent £297.92pcm)
75% Share Price: £195,000 (rent £148.96pcm)

Minimum 5% Mortgage Deposit (40% share): £5,200

Approximate Service Charges: £107.01 pcm*
Eligibility


The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you’d expect to pay if you bought a similar property outright.

At Centrum you can buy a minimum 40% share of your home (the maximum you can buy initially is 75%). When you’re ready, you can buy more shares until you staircase to owning 100% of your home.

To be eligible for shared ownership you would need to meet the following criteria:

• Your household income does not exceed £90,000
• You have a deposit of at least 5% of the share value
• You do not own another property or have your name on the deeds or a mortgage for a property worldwide.
• This will be your only residence.
• You are a permanent UK resident or have indefinite right to remain.
• You must have a local area connection and either live and/or work in the London Borough of Hounslow. Only buyers who are members of the armed forces can be considered from areas outside of Hounslow.

Please note the minimum share you can purchase can vary depending on your financial situation and you may be asked to purchase a larger share, should your personal circumstances permit.

*Service charges are estimated and may subject to change.

**These photos are for information purposes only and may not represent a true likeness for the units being sold. They may have been taken from earlier phases or similar developments/house types and digitally furnished to represent how the home could be laid out; the final colours/appearance/specification may differ from the images and are not plot specific. We advise applicants to make their own investigations on future development in the area. We would suggest contacting the local authority for more information.

A semi-detached house with a large driveway for up to four cars and private garden on a well-connected road in Isleworth, close to Osterley Park & House. This freehold property benefits from the ability to extend STPP, ample storage, hard flooring on the ground floor, and a pantry. The house consists of a family room, an open-plan living room with a fitted kitchen, tiled bathroom, and a garden with a fully functioning outbuilding and side entrance. The first floor houses four bedrooms, all of which feature fitted wardrobes and a tiled family bathroom.

This property is situated at the north end of Thornbury Road, which is located within one of Isleworth's most popular neighbourhoods. This central location offers residents access to a range of shops, cafes and other local amenities on Syon Lane and in both Osterley and Isleworth town centres. Syon Lane Mainline and Osterley Underground stations, as well as the A4/M4, provide commuters with excellent transport links towards the city centre and Heathrow. Families benefit from proximity to several schools including Isleworth & Syon School, the Nishkam School West London and The Green Schools for boys / girls.

Pattinson Auction are pleased to welcome to the market this one bedroom 3rd floor apartment situated in Isleworth. The property comprises briefly; an open plan reception room/kitchen, one bedroom, and a bathroom. There is an audio entry phone system and is close to local shops and amenities.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

A large contemporary flat located in the heart of Hounslow with the benefit of a Private Roof Terrace overlooking the Hounslow Skyline, styled with fashionable décor. Upstairs you have two double bedrooms, a large single and the family bathroom. Other benefits include driveway, side access, newly laid flooring throughout, and sold with no chain.

Percival Road is situated in a quiet residential area in the desirable Lower Feltham area, within a short walk away from the fantastic Feltham Hill Infants and Nursery and also Oakhill Academy. A popular children's park and playground is also on your doorstep. The H26 bus, that serves Hatton Cross Underground Station, stops on Bedfont Road which again, is a short walk away and Feltham Mainline Rail Station is also easily accessible.

detailedDescription: This well presented and tranquil apartment has glorious views over the River Thames towards Kew Gardens from the property and the private balcony. Situated on the edge of the prestigious Ferry Quays waterside community, the apartment sits right on the riverbank with sweeping views downstream. Occupying probably one of the prime positions in this riverside development, this unique apartment is flooded with light from floor to ceiling windows. Calm and peaceful, with no passing traffic, the movement of boats and wildfowl can be quietly enjoyed from the magnificent private balcony. A fully fitted kitchen has all modern appliances. The master bedroom is airy with an en suite bathroom, a second double bedroom, a separate bathroom and excellent storage facilities. An allocated underground parking space is conveniently close to the lift lobby. The development has a concierge and restaurants on site. Brentford National Rail Station is an easy walk and the A4/M4 is a few minutes drive away and is offered to the market with no onward chain. EPC rating B.

detailedDescription:
A delightful and well-presented modern duplex apartment offered for sale with lovely uninterrupted views of the River Brent. The layout measuring approximately 1100 sq ft comprises: Three bedrooms (one with a balcony), family bathroom, additional en-suite shower room, w.c. And open-plan spacious reception room/kitchen/dining area with oak wooden flooring and doors out to a private paved terrace overlooking the river.

Bridge House is a small modern development built in 2014, perched on the bank of the river yet moments from Brentford's regenerated town centre and its range of shops, cafes and restaurants. The development boasts a south-facing aspect with tranquil views over the river and of the narrowboats travelling along it. Residents' off-street parking can be offered separately. Commuters are served by Brentford br mainline station; in addition to the numerous bus routes which pass by the property and provide connections towards Heathrow Airport and the neighbouring towns of Chiswick, Ealing and Kew.

detailedDescription:
Offered with no forward chain. We are pleased to bring to the market this period conversion flat set within a impressive detached house and located on the first floor. In brief the property comprises of a communal entrance with entry phone, entrance hallway, living/dining room, fitted kitchen, double bedroom and modern en-suite three piece white bathroom suite. The property also benefits from a loft, an allocated parking space and a communal garden to the rear. EPC Grade D.

Situation
The property is situated in a highly sort after residential road and set within a local conservation area. The property is walking distance to Hounslow High Street with a wide range of shops for your convenience. Hounslow mainline station, Hounslow Central and East Tube Station's which are served by the London Piccadilly Line, the property is also located in close proximity to A4 and M4 road links. There are a number of local Infant and Junior Schools including Grove Road. And Orchard, and the local secondary Schools would be Heathlands and St Marks. Other benefits are numerous local bus routes served from Hounslow bus garage.

detailedDescription:
Summary
** Viewings this weekend** A wonderful example of an extended family property in great decorative order. Situated on the Sunbury-On-Thames boarders and walking distance to local amenities, private rear views of Ludlow Park and a WC on each floor, this property would suit any growing family.

Description
To the front of the property, you will see a porch has been added to create that extra space and a barrier between the front reception room. The hallway wall has been removed to create a more useable space and allows light to flood through. The rear has been extended and has been designed around a stunning traditional style kitchen with some built in appliances and Rangemaster to match. French doors welcome you to the peaceful and secluded rear garden that backs onto Ludlow Park, which has been most useful in lockdown. With rear access to the property you have the possibility of creating a garage, office, summer house etc or just using it as handy way in to your home. This home is larger than a lot of semi-detached properties in the area.

Upstairs the property does not fall short with three bedrooms, all with built in wardrobes and the family bathroom on the first floor. The loft has been extended that comprises of large master bedroom and en-suit shower room with beautiful views of green space.

Harvest Road is in a great location situated off Feltham High Street and on the Sunbury-On-Thames boarders, within walking distance to Ofsted outstanding Feltham Hill Infants School and the fantastic Academy Reach. Situated close to Feltham town centre giving you access to multiple high street brands, bus links including 24 hour services and most importantly Feltham over ground station which with its fast train service can get you into London Waterloo in approx. 25 mins.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful chain free house with a driveway, private landscaped garden and abundance of space inside and out on a quiet residential road in Isleworth. This freehold property benefits from skylights, a garage and hard flooring on the ground floor. On the outskirts of the house itself there is a private garden on either side of the property, a wonderful summer house with an open bar area and a garage.

Inside this charming house you will find a spacious living room with a functional fireplace, open-plan dining room with a modern fitted kitchen, separate WC and a utility area on the ground floor. The upper floors comprise of 5 bedrooms, one of which features a modern en suite, a study, and a modern four-piece bathroom with a double sink.

The property is set on the split of Ridgeway Road and College Road, which is a peaceful residential road set moments from Isleworth town centre and is ideally placed to take advantage of an excellent selection of nearby transport links, including Osterley Underground station, Isleworth Mainline station, and the A4/M4 for motorists. A selection of shops, restaurants and local amenities are available nearby along the London Road in Isleworth town centre.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A deceptively large five-bedroom link terrace family home offered to the market in fair condition throughout though would benefit from some modernisation.
Set on a leafy residential road in Isleworth, Clayton Road falls into the catchment areas of highly rated schools with outstanding Ofsted reports, making it perfect for families, and also located within a short walk to Hounslow High Street, Hounslow Tube Station, Isleworth Train Station, local shops and local bus routes servicing Hounslow, Richmond, Twickenham and Isleworth.
The property comprises an airy entrance hall incorporating a downstairs WC, a spacious through reception room measuring an impressive 26’5 x 11’4 which has been cleverly combined with the rear extension to create an open-plan kitchen area with the added benefit of access to a raised deck and rear garden.
The first floor comprises two double bedrooms, large single bedroom and a family bathroom. To the second floor are two further bedrooms that could be re-configured into one large master or extended further subject to local planning permission.
Benefits include gas central heating, double glazed windows and off-street parking.
Viewings are recommended to appreciate the size.

Situated on the banks of the River Thames with outstanding views down the river from it's large balcony accessed from the reception room and principal bedroom. This is a large and spacious apartment of approximately 76 sq meters. Comprising an open plan fully fitted kitchen and reception room, two double bedrooms, the principal bedroom having an en suite shower room and family bathroom. An allocated car parking space comes with the apartment. This is a modern apartment building constructed just a few years ago. There is easy access along the Thames into St Margarets and Richmond. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Stylish Victorian family house with an exceptional layout.

Location

Fairlawn Grove is a quiet leafy street with very close access to Chiswick Park and across the park from Turnham Green underground stations (District Line). South Acton station (overground) is also close by. Chiswick offers easy access to Central London via the A4, and to the west of England via the M4, which in turns gives easy access to Heathrow and the M25 for the M3 and M40.

Description

This Norman Shaw designed family house has been beautifully maintained by the current owners to create stunning living space and very successful lateral accommodation. The house inspiringly blends contemporary features within the framework of attractive period architecture.

The layout of the ground floor is fabulous with a striking reception room at the front of the property which leads through to the dining room. There are sliding pocket doors to shut off the rooms. The dining room has double doors that lead out to a beautifully secluded garden.

The extended and open-plan kitchen/breakfast room is beautifully bright due to the French doors out to the garden. There is also a cloakroom. The lower ground floor houses a utility room with very practical and well-thought out space.

On the first floor is a sizeable principle bedroom suite with en suite bathroom and extensive built in storage. Additionally on this floor is a further two double bedrooms overlooking the garden and a cloakroom.

The second floor offers two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom with a separate shower; the second of these two bedrooms is unusually large, and especially characterful. There is a good size separate storage room on this floor.

Meticulous attention to detail and style is paramount within this amazing fully extended family house.

Square Footage: 2306 sq ft

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Look no further if you're trying to get onto the ladder in London, but don't want to live in a shoebox: This bright, modern first-floor flat in Hounslow has two good-sized double bedrooms, a big living room with a Juliet balcony, a proper bath in the smart bathroom and even a couple of storage cupboards. Unlike many homes on the fringes of the capital, it's near a Tube station: You can walk to Hounslow West, on the Piccadilly Line, for services to the city centre. And there's plenty to do nearby, with a good Polish restaurant and some cracking curry options.

It's easy to escape the urban grind, too: Kew Gardens, Richmond Park and Hampton Court are within a half-hour drive. For longer escapes, hit the M4 or the M25, both less than 20 minutes from the property.

The flat is ideal for first-timers, but it could also be a shrewd investment, with plenty of rental demand from workers at Heathrow airport, which is two miles away. (Before you ask, there's triple glazing in the bedrooms to keep out unwanted noise.) A two-bedder nearby is on the market for £1,300 pcm.

Location and Transport Links:

Fusiliers Way is perfectly placed for trips to central London and weekend escapes from the capital. The flat is a mile from Hounslow West station, which is on the Piccadilly line: It's a 40-minute ride to Piccadilly Circus via Hammersmith and Earl's Court.

By car, it's 10 minutes to the M4, for the Cotswolds and the West Country, and 20 minutes to the M25, for just about everywhere else. You can drive into town on the Great West Road: It's half an hour to Hammersmith Broadway. And if you're heading to sunnier climes, Heathrow is a five-minute cab ride away.

Nearby amenities:

The property is in a residential area, but there are several pubs and restaurants within walking distance, including the Paleta Polisch kitchen, 0.8 miles away, and Takaa Tak, 1.1 miles away, an Indian restaurant with a strong local following. The nearest green space is Chester Park, 0.4 miles away, and it's 0.6 miles to the Nostos S&C gym.

You can pick up the basics at a small Londis with a post office, 0.2 miles from the property. For the weekly shop, there's a Tesco Superstore 1.5 miles away. Hounslow is famous for its Asian community and you can pick up exotic ingredients at Sadda, 0.9 miles away; stop off at the nearby Cake Box, for a tasty pud.

Fusiliers Way is in the catchment area for several schools rated outstanding by Ofsted. At primary level, there's Beavers Community, 0.1 miles away, and Hounslow Heath, 0.8 miles away. Outstanding local secondaries include St Mark's rc, 1 mile away, and Cranford Community, 1.5 miles away.

The nearest gp surgery is the Meadows Centre for Health, 0.4 miles away. It's a mile to the Berkeley Dental Practice and Cranford Opticians, and the nearest pharmacy is Hobbs, 0.4 miles away.

Key Features:

- Two double bedrooms
- Large living room with Juliet balcony
- Modern kitchen
- Tube station nearby
- Excellent road links
- Generous storage

Central heating:

Gas, with radiators throughout the flat. The property is double and triple-glazed.

Room by room:

The property has two double bedrooms with carpeted floors. They're roughly the same size and one has a fitted wardrobe. There are two storage cupboards in the hallway, which leads to the bathroom and the main living room, which has a carpeted floor. Juliet balcony. The bathroom has a bath, a shower a sink and a toilet. The kitchen has glossy built-in units, a ceramic hob, a single oven, integrated appliances and a sink with a mixer tap and drainer.

- Bedroom 1 13'0" x 8'9", double bedroom with carpet, fitted wardrobe
- Bedroom 2 13'1" x 8'7", double bedroom with carpet
- Bathroom 8'11" x 5'6", Bath and shower, toilet, sink
- Living/Dining room 20'4" x 10'3", carpet, Juliet balcony
- Kitchen 10'5" x 6'9", built-in storage, sink with drainer and mixer tap, ceramic hob and single oven, integrated appliances

Making an offer through us:

We already have the title plan and searches for the property. Request details to see the information. Having these documents upfront will save time and stress when you have had an offer accepted.

detailedDescription:
Rarely available to the market this fantastic extended detached family home. The house is located on the Whitton/Hounslow borders and set within the London Borough of Richmond. In brief offers front reception room, home office, spacious kitchen/dining room, utility room and downstairs w/c. To the first floor lies 2 double bedrooms both with independent dressing rooms, and additional single bedroom. To the second floor lies a lovely bright and airy master bedroom with en-suite shower room w/c. Other benefits include off street parking for 4 cars, 31ft west facing garden and outbuilding. EPC Grade C.

Situation
This property is situated on the Whitton/Hounslow borders and is walking distance to local shops for your convenience. The local Infant and Junior Schools are Orchard and Grove Road. The local secondary school would be Heathland and St Marks. Other benefits are local bus routes including H28,110 and 111, the property is also walking distance to Hounslow mainline station, as well Hounslow Tube stations in the town centre. The Whitton borders also benefit from several parks and open spaces including Crane Park, Hounslow Heath and Powder Mill Lane recreational ground.

About Hounslow

The borough's area is approximately quarter parkland. Large areas of London's open space fall within its boundaries, including Chiswick House and Gardens, Gunnersbury Park, Syon Park, Osterley Park, Hounslow Heath, Avenue Park in Cranford; and Hanworth Park. The borough's predominant land use is mainly residential, with a large, commercial town centre of Hounslow. Other large town centres include Chiswick, Feltham and Brentford. Business is mainly focused on retail; and aviation (due to the proximity of Heathrow airport) especially in the west of the borough (Hounslow and Feltham). Parts of the Borough; including Chiswick, Turnham Green, Osterley and Old Isleworth are some of the most expensive parts of Outer London. With other areas such as Hounslow, Feltham and Heston being more affordable.

With stunning river views and set in a stylish and contemporary development overlooking a beautiful stretch of the River Thames, surrounded by green spaces, this stylish one bedroom first floor flat is ideally located .

The property, designed to benefit from its spectacular surroundings, comprises bright reception room with floor-to-ceiling windows, stunning open-plan kitchen with breakfast bar and integrated appliances, master bedroom, bathroom and secure, gated off-street parking for one car .

The property is only a short distance along the picturesque tow path to Richmond town centre and further benefits from its close proximity to St. Margaret's village and its charming selection of amenities .

Transport links include St. Margarets Station and for the motorist the nearby A316 leads to the M25 and routes in and out of London.

Arranged over 1240 sqft, 113 sqm (Approx) and comprising of 2 double bedrooms, a third good-sized loft-style bedroom, all with ensuite shower rooms, this generous property boasts a double reception room with dining, a guest cloakroom and a separate fully fitted contemporary kitchen leading to a beautiful rear garden.

Ideally located by Chiswick House within close proximity to Chiswick High Street and the River Thames and its surrounding picturesque walks alongside, this bright and spacious property is offered in excellent condition throughout, has been recently renovated up to high standard benefiting from underfloor heating and air conditioning throughout.

Sutherland Road offers excellent transport links by road both A4/M4. Both Chiswick Park and Turnham Green tube stations are within 15 minutes walk approx.

This would definitely make an ideal family home, also, a good buy-to-let investment.

Early viewing is recommended!

detailedDescription:
This charming extended two bedroom house is located on the ever popular Poets Estate within Hampton. This particular property comes with two garages that are accessed at the rear of the garden and could be used for a number of different purposes.

Internally there is a large living/dining room that has been extended and kitchen with direct access onto the garden. Upstairs there are two bedrooms and a family bathroom. The rear garden is private and secluded and is ideal for entertaining during the summer months.

The house is ideal for families and is within walking distance of Hampton Common, Royal Bushy Park and Hampton open air swimming pool. There is also a good variety of local boutique shops, independent cafes and restaurants close to hand, and a Waitrose supermarket.

Hampton station has a regular train service into London Waterloo and there are also good bus links into Richmond and Kingston town centres. There is also easy access onto the M25 and M3 motorways. Schools are popular within Hampton and this property is within walking distance of some of the area’s finest education facilities.

detailedDescription:
Beck House is a Retirement Living development, brought to you by McCarthy & Stone.

Designed exclusively for the over 60s, this apartment compromises of numerous communal facilities such as; a Club Lounge, Guest Suite and beautiful landscaped gardens to enjoy with family and friends.

With fantastic transport links and a sought-after location, homeowners at Beck House can enjoy the convenience of local amenities, the delights of the River Thames within a short walk of the development and the beauty of both Osterly Park and Syon Park located nearby.

All Retirement Living developments are wheelchair friendly and there is a secure mobility scooter room to store and charge your vehicle**.

Beck House has been built with energy efficiency in mind, including features such as double glazed windows, heat recovery ventilation units; insulated cavity walls and photovoltaic panels which help harness the sun’s solar energy. All of which will help to improve the sustainability of Beck House and can help you save on those energy bills.

The stunning Club Lounge is designed for you to relax in beautiful, comfortable surroundings. Enjoy a book or just catch up with family and friends.
We also have Guest Suite accommodation with TV and tea and coffee making facilities available for your friends and family to stay, making it easier for you to host your loved ones.

detailedDescription:
Summary
back on the market! Sold with no onward chain is this larger than average three bedroom end of terrace property. Extended to the side and rear, this property is certainly large for the area. With off street parking, conservatory and mature garden, this home would suit any family.

Description
back on the market! To the front of the property you are greeted by an extended porch large enough for multiple coats and shoes. To the right you will step into the 22ft living room with bay frontage, with space for dining to the rear. The kitchen has been extended to the side with ample storage space and room for appliances. A conservatory has been added to the rear that offers extra room for dining and socialising, this has been most useful during the pandemic for an extra work space. The private rear garden is mostly laid to lawn but has some mature plants that form the boarders too. Upstairs you have two double bedrooms, one single, a study and family bathroom. The property also benefits from no onward chain, a garage and further potential to extend into the loft (STPP).

Fernside Avenue is conveniently positioned for access to the High Street where you will find a number of restaurants, cafes, bars and high street brand shops in the shopping centre. Feltham Mainline Station serves London Waterloo in under 30 minutes. There is also easy access to the 316 via Popular Way where you can pick up the H25 bus that serves Hanworth and Hatton Cross Underground Station (Piccadilly Line).

detailedDescription:
A fantastic opportunity to purchase this spacious house (c.1,988 sq ft) with unique width and off-street parking. The ground floor offers superb entertaining space with three reception areas leading through to a spacious private garden.

The house has previously been extended to create a lovely wide reception area, which is very unique for this part of Chiswick. This leads through to a large family kitchen complete with an island and a bright dining area. There is even space for a separate utility room, and a ground floor WC. To the rear, a conservatory leads out to a spacious garden.

The first floor has four bedrooms. The smaller of the rooms works very well as a home office, and the front room is a master with an en suite. There is also a good sized family bathroom. Upstairs the loft has been converted into another double bedroom, which has an en suite and a Juliet balcony.

The house has been well looked after by the current family, and further benefits from two off-street parking spots directly in front.

Berrymede Road is a quiet, residential cul-de-sac, perfect for family living. Chiswick Park and South Acton stations are both walking distance as well as Chiswick High Road which has a fantastic array of shops and restaurants.

detailedDescription:
A wonderful three bedroom, two bathroom split level apartment. This beautiful conversion is set in an imposing Edwardian building, ideally located on St Johns road, moments from the shops, cafes, bars and Isleworth mainline train station.

The accommodation comprises a stunning full width reception room, with stripped wood floors, the original coving, dining and seating areas, and new double glazed windows. There is a lovely large master bedroom, an immaculate bathroom and the eat-in kitchen is perfectly arranged.

Upstairs there are two further bedrooms and a bathroom, perfectly presented. There is also an incredible, as of yet, undeveloped loft space, and to the rear of the property there is a large private garden.

This amazing apartment has the added attraction of having a share of the freehold of this stunning building, it has also been rewired and new plumbing installed very recently.

EPC Rating E

detailedDescription:
Hunters are delighted to present to market this four-bedroom family home located just a few minutes’ walk from Heathlands School.
The property is well presented arranged over three floors and comprises a generous through lounge with a well-proportioned kitchen, ground floor shower room and large rear garden. The first floor is arranged as three good sized bedrooms and a family bathroom, the fourth bedroom on the third floor completes the internal accommodation . An all important private driveway to the front provides off road parking for at least two cars.
Hounslow Rail Station is located within easy reach of the property and Tube stations in the area include Hounslow Central, Hounslow West and Hounslow East provide piccadilly line connections into London and Heathrow. With Nelson Primary School, Heathlands and St Marks Secondary Schools all within easy reach, the property makes for an ideal family home. We urge you to take the tour or call us today for an internal inspection at Hunters on .

detailedDescription:
Property description Four bedroom family home, side garage, scope to extend (stpp), wonderful road! A four bedroom 1930's semi detached house on a quiet road in Osterley off Jersey Road measuring some 1422 sqft/ 132 sqm with off street parking, long south facing garden and space to side with scope to make considerably larger (stpp). Brought to market with no onward chain and set on a quiet residential street you are within walking distance of Osterley Tube Station.

Entrance to the property is via aluminium door into storm porch and then to main door into hallway. The ground floor presents access to a ground floor shower with utility space, bay fronted lounge, rear reception with double sliding doors to garden and kitchen leading to bedroom 4 with en-suite. The first floor has two double bedrooms (one bay fronted), third bedroom family bathroom and access to loft space. The exterior has a long and wide south facing rear garden and off street parking or 2 cars.

Set on a peaceful street off Jersey Road, Lulworth Avenue is a short walk to from Osterley Tube whilst being having Osterley National Trust Park nearby as well as the nearby amenities at Osterley Village Jersey Parade within walking distance. There are also a number of schools nearby.
