Property Description

Being Sold by goto Online Auction

Starting Bids from £320,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Online Auction. The Online Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

A well presented terraced house with residents parking and a private south-facing garden on a quiet residential road in Brentford. This property benefits from fitted storage, wooden flooring, and consists of a large double living room with bay window, fitted kitchen with French doors leading to the private garden which has a shed with lighting and electricity, modern bathroom and two double bedrooms, both of which feature fitted storage.

detailedDescription:

The bedroom is a comfortable double with a south facing window. The bathroom has a white suite.

address: Isleworth House, Fitzroy Gate, Isleworth TW7
detailedDescription:
A stunning apartment with off street parking in the desirable Fitzroy Gate development in Isleworth. The property benefits from period features alongside modern amenities including lift access and an entryphone system, and has been finished to the highest standard. The apartment itself consists of a designer fully fitted kitchen with a breakfast bar and integrated Siemens and Miele appliances, a huge separate reception room, additional study room, luxurious modern bathroom, and two double bedrooms with built-in wardrobes, one of which features an en suite bathroom with a walk-in shower.

The property is set within Isleworth House, a majestic Georgian building and part of the new Fitzroy Gate development. The development backs onto the river and benefits from communal gardens, and is situated moments from the heart of Old Isleworth. This picturesque neighbourhood hosts a variety of shops and restaurants, as well as amenities including a pharmacy, library and leisure centre. Numerous local schools, including The Blue School, Worple Primary School, St Mary's Catholic Primary School and Gumley House Convent School, are also within easy reach. Isleworth Mainline station and local bus routes provide commuters with transport connections into and out of Central London.

detailedDescription:
This amazing architecturally designed two double bedroom duplex apartments encompasses the second and third floors covering an area in excess of 1000Sq – 94SqM of this beautiful Edwardian house located in the heart of central Chiswick. You enter into the open lobby open the full height of the flat with exposed brick. There is sole access to a communal flat roof from the Lobby. Also on this floor are the 2 king sized bedrooms, one with ensuite, both with original feature fireplaces and the other stylish shower room. It is however the top floor open plan kitchen reception room that is the real prize of this flat. Flooded with natural light and with a wall of glass boasting unrivalled far-reaching views towards London’s skyline it is the perfect place for entertaining, while still maintaining a uniquely private aspect for the location. There is a sleek and modern kitchen with oak floors which all make for an exceptional living space.

Ennismore Avenue is a quiet residential cul-de-sac, conveniently located moments away from Chiswick High Road, with easy access to excellent shops, restaurants and cafes as well as both Turnham Green and Stamford Brook underground stations. Central London, Heathrow and the west of England are easily accessible via the A4 and M4

This property is offered to the market with Share of Freehold and no chain.

Chiswick itself offers easy access to Central London, the A4 and M4, and onto the M25 for the M3 and M40. The reception room leads through to a well equipped kitchen.

address: Bexhill Close, Feltham, Greater London TW13
detailedDescription:
We are delighted to offer this fairly large semi-detached house for sale in a quiet residential location in Feltham which provides great links to and from London.
This property spreads over three floors and boasts three four-size double bedrooms and a spacious single room.
On the entrance, it has a porch to the main corridor, on the right side of the corridor, it has a large reception room which leads to a large bedroom built on the extension with a way into the garden via a patio door.
Through the main entrance to the left, it has an extra WC, with washbasin, good size square shaped fully fitted kitchen with ample wall and base units, there is also a door from the kitchen opens to the side alleyway which goes to the rear garden.
On the first floor, there are two well-presented double bedrooms with built-in wardrobes, a single bedroom, and a good size fully fitted modern bathroom.
In the loft it has a very good size bedroom with dormer windows which has created more headroom, it has just on the entrance of the room a good size bathroom.
The rear of the house has a well-maintained garden with a small patio area and a wooden shed.
On the front of the property, it has no maintenance cemented parking area enough for 2 cars via a sloped curb.
Viewings are highly recommended.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Set back from the road, the property has generous off-street parking, a mature front garden and side access to the rear garden.

The ground floor briefly comprises a double reception room with feature fireplace, a separate study overlooking the rear garden and a guest cloakroom.

The lower ground floor comprises of a cosy family room with extensive fitted storage and a separate guest cloakroom. To the rear is a substantial open plan kitchen/dining room with an array of modern integrated appliances. This room has been cleverly designed to allow for the lower ground floor to be flooded with an abundance of natural light. French doors lead out onto the large south facing rear garden with secluded patio space.

On the first floor is the principal bedroom with en-suite bathroom and fitted wardrobes, two further double bedroom and a shower room.

The second floor offers two generous double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, access to a private balcony and a separate shower room. There is also access to a loft which is large and currently offers good storage space.

Situation
Grove Park Terrace is located in the ever popular Grove Park area of Chiswick and is 0.4 miles to Chiswick Main Line (access to Waterloo). The A316 for access into and out of London is 0.7 miles away and the A4/M4 for access towards Heathrow is 0.5 miles away. The River Thames and Strand on the Green are a very short walk away from the house offering a selection of fine pubs and restaurants.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautiful, rare to market, five/six-bedroom family home is situated within this sought after location, moments from the River Thames. The house is arranged over four floors and is in immaculate condition throughout. The lower ground floor is made up of a family reception room, a large eat-in kitchen which has direct access to the garden, a utility room and a guest cloakroom. The raised ground floor comprises a magnificent front to back double reception room which spans nearly 40 feet in length, incorporating a study area which also has access to the garden. There is also a separate study/sixth bedroom and a further guest cloakroom. The first floor contains the master suite, two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom. On the top floor, there are two additional double bedrooms and the third bathroom. The house also benefits from off-street parking for multiple cars and a plethora of storage throughout.
Grove Park Terrace is located on a tree lined street between the local shops, wine bars and restaurants of Fauconberg Village and the River Thames. Chiswick House and Gardens is also very accessible. Transport links include Gunnersbury tube (zone 3), District line, Chiswick mainline (to Waterloo) and M4 (A4) by car to Heathrow and central London.

Built around a new public square, you'll be at the heart of life with shops, restaurants and leisure facilities on your doorstep. Fast transport links are just a few minutes’ walk away, making central London easily accessible.

This new lifestyle district will link the existing High Street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new destination in west London.

About High Street Quarter

Be part of an exciting new community in the heart of hounslow

High Street Quarter is a brand new development of one, two and three-bedroom homes in the centre of Hounslow.

Built around a new public square, you'll be at the heart of life with shops, restaurants and leisure facilities on your doorstep. Fast transport links are just a few minutes' walk away, making central London easily accessible.

This new lifestyle district will link the existing High Street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new destination in west London.

Leisure

Hounslow has a thriving and diverse town centre - comprising a mixture of high street stores and independent retailers. For sports fans, Twickenham Stadium is 2 miles away and Wyke Green Golf Club is just a 12-minute drive. There are also numerous gyms and leisure centres to choose from in the immediate area. Hounslow Heath, a local nature reserve and one of the largest parks in the borough, is also a short walk away.

Education

A number of schools in Hounslow have been rated 'outstanding' by Ofsted including nearby Hounslow Heath Junior School and Hounslow Heath Infant and Nursery School.

Transport

Hounslow is located in Zone 4 in the Borough of Hounslow. Hounslow High Street benefits from excellent transport links, with Hounslow East & Hounslow Central Underground Stations both a 5-minute walk away and Hounslow Overground Station just a 10-minute walk. Heathrow Airport is a short drive away or 15 minutes on the tube.

Opening Hours

Monday 12:30 - 17:30, Tuesday-Sunday 10:00 - 17:30

detailedDescription:
A spacious and recently decorated detached bungalow with potential for extension. Located in A quiet residential road and within the catchment area for several highly sought after schools in the local area. Offered to the market with no onward chain, an early viewing is highly recommended.

Entrance Hall

Entered through a part glazed PVC door to an open tiled porchway and through to the hallway. Tiled flooring throughout and double glazed side door leading to rear garden, mains smoke alarm and recently installed wall mounted radiator. The hallway has been freshly painted.

Lounge (15' 5'' x 11' 5'' (4.70m x 3.48m))

Front aspect double glazed windows, laminate flooring, two recently installed wall mounted radiators, service window to kitchen. The room has been freshly painted.

Kitchen (10' 0'' x 6' 4'' (3.04m x 1.93m))

Front aspect double glazed windows, a modern range of eye and base level units consisting of newly integrated gas hob, oven and kitchen extractor fan. Space is also available for standard sized washing machine and fridge freezer. The kitchen has also been freshly painted and has tiled flooring and splashbacks.

Master Bedroom (12' 5'' x 11' 5'' (3.79m x 3.48m))

Rear aspect double glazed window, laminate flooring, a recently installed wall mounted radiator and freshly painted throughout. Ample space for a king size bed and wardrobes.

Bedroom Two (8' 8'' x 10' 5'' (2.65m x 3.17m))

Rear aspect double glazed window, laminate flooring, recently installed wall mounted radiator, freshly painted.

Bathroom (5' 7'' x 7' 3'' (1.71m x 2.21m))

Side aspect double glazed frosted window, a newly installed three piece suite with bath, ceramic sink and low level WC. Tiled walls and flooring, wall mounted heated towel rail and extractor fan.

Loft

Spanning over the entire property housing the condensing boiler which was installed in 2021. The loft is fully insulated, 75% boarded and has the potential for conversion.

Garage

A large brick garage with up and over door housing smart meters. Potential for side extension subject to the correct planning permission.

Additional Features

The property has recently had up to date Gas and electrical safety certificates completed which have passed and all remedial work complete. Warranty included for kitchen hob, extractor, oven, boiler and double glazing. All radiators have been installed in 2021.

detailedDescription:
Francis-James Residential are delighted to bring to the market this large, modern two bedroom apartment in an attractive contemporary development located just moments from Chiswick Part Station.

Benefitting from two double bedrooms – including a master bedroom with an en-suite shower/wc, the apartment also boasts a large open-planned Kitchen/Reception room with direct access to a delightful south-facing balcony, overlooking Gunnersbury Nature Reserve.

The apartment is fitted with underfloor heating and the kitchen is fully integrated with modern appliances including a Zanussi Washing machine, AEG dishwasher, AEG cooker, AEG hob unit and an AEG fridge/freezer.

Edmunds House boasts an on-site Concierge (available from 0700-1900) providing convenient and friendly security staff. There is also a secure bicycle lock up area for residents use as well as an in-house Nursery.

Chiswick Park Tube station is only a short walk from the property, with the convenience of the District Line available as well as a 40 minute commute to Heathrow Airport.

There are convenient bus routes nearby as well as an array of coffee shops, bars, boutiques and shopping stores available on Chiswick High Road – which is only a 10 minute walk.

Edmunds House also connects to Chiswick Business Park – via a new footbridge that links the two.

Internal inspection is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
A Detached House which will steal your heart away. This delightful home is in Isleworth’s most desirable road.

Presenting to you three exceptionally sized bedrooms, with a generous bay fronted reception room, modernised kitchen, bathroom and a wonderful rear garden.

What really makes this property stand out amongst others is that it offers a unique one bedroom ground floor flat with a spacious reception room, bright kitchen, bathroom and its own private entrance.

This delightful plot of land can be further extended subject to planning.

Easy access to local transportation links, outstanding schools, coffee shops and fine dining restaurants within a close proximity.

A dream property suited for all types of buyers. Early viewings are highly recommended.

address: Autumn Rise, 14A Sutton Court Road, London W4
detailedDescription:
Immaculately presented two bedroom apartment with secure parking.

Location

Sutton Court Road is situated in the western part of Grove Park close to the Fauconberg Road shops. Grove Park is situated with easy access to Central London via the A4, and also to the West via the M4 motorway. Chiswick rail station is a short distance away with regular connections to Clapham Junction and Waterloo.

Gunnersbury underground station is within easy reach as well providing access to the London Underground network (District line) and also London Overground service.

Description

Upon entry, the hallway is wide and spacious and has a storage cupboard for coats.

The bright kitchen/reception room has wooden flooring throughout and is awash with modern appliances. The room is naturally light and spacious due to the wonderfully high ceilings, and big double doors leading to a balcony.

The two bedrooms are bright due to the large windows allowing an abundance of natural light. There is an en suite shower room and a modern bathroom equipped with both a bath and a shower.

In summary this is a wonderful modern apartment in a popular location with the benefit of secure underground parking.

The apartment would be ideal for a first time buyer or investor.

Square Footage: 632 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Summary
A wonderful two double bedroom, two bathroom first floor apartment situated in a sought after gated development. Located within a 10-15 minute walk to Isleworth, Twickenham or St Margaret's Mainline Station.

Description
Situated in the prestigious, gated development of Holme Court, this modern flat comprises a spacious receiving hallway, a large reception room with dual windows, a modern integrated kitchen, two large double bedrooms, master with en-suite and a further tiled family bathroom. All windows are '4 glazed' (2 double glazings) which makes it energy efficient and at the same time blocks most of the noises from any outside road and air traffic. The apartment also has underground parking and a long lease.

Well-presented throughout, this bright and beautiful property is ideally located close to the Georgian riverside at Old Isleworth, the amenities of South Street and is a 10-15 minute walk from Isleworth, Twickenham and St Margaret's Mainline Train Stations that all server London Waterloo. The world famous Kew Gardens is just on the other side of the River Thames where you can also enjoy beautiful walks along the bank.

address: Belvedere House, Kew Bridge Road, Brentford TW8
detailedDescription:
A stunning modern apartment with a balcony and underground parking in one of Brentford's most prestigious waterside developments. The property has access to a concierge service, residents' gym and landscaped communal gardens within the development, and benefits from lift access and a video entryphone system.

The apartment itself consists of a fully fitted kitchen with an additional utility room, spacious open-plan reception room with wooden flooring and a Juliet balcony, modern family bathroom, and two double bedrooms, one of which features an en suite bathroom and French windows leading out onto the balcony.

Belvedere House forms part of the luxurious 8 Kew Bridge Road development, overlooking the river and moments from Kew Bridge. In addition to the concierge, fitness suite and well-tended communal grounds, the development offers residents an abundance of on-site amenities including a supermarket, cafe, restaurant and pub. A selection of other shops, restaurants and cafes are also nearby on both sides of the bridge, in addition to an array of transport links including Kew Bridge Mainline station, local bus routes and the A4/M4.

detailedDescription:
A beautiful detached house which hasn’t been on the market for 36 years, with a large driveway on a quiet cul-de-sac in Isleworth. This freehold property benefits from high ceilings, wooden flooring throughout and an integral garage. The ground floor of the house consists of a large double living room with dining area, fitted kitchen, WC, and a stunning private garden with decking that is not overlooked, something you would not expect to see Isleworth. On the first floor, the house comprises of four double bedrooms, two of which feature fitted wardrobes, a separate toilet, and a modern bathroom, with the second-floor as a modern loft room, currently set up as an office with air conditioning, skylights and a private balcony with views over the breath taking greenery.

Oaklands Avenue is a peaceful cul-de-sac close to Syon Lane, and located within easy reach of Osterley Underground and Syon Lane Mainline stations. The A4/M4 and local bus routes offer additional excellent transport links into and out of the city centre. The property is well-suited for those working locally, with gsk House and BSkyB's Osterley campus located within easy walking distance. A range of shops, restaurants and other local amenities are also nearby in Isleworth and Brentford town centres.

detailedDescription:
*With Parking Included* A luxury and well-presented two-bedroom apartment located on the first floor of a modern development in Rothschild House, Kew Bridge. Spanning an approximate 1315 square feet, this apartment comprises of a large living/dining area, access to a private balcony offering beautiful courtyard views, a sleek finish fitted kitchen with integrated appliances such as fridge/freezer, hob, oven, dishwasher and microwave. A large modern breakfast bar is also included.

This apartment also offers a larger than average master-bedroom with floor to ceiling wardrobes, carpet finish and a tiled finish en-suite shower room. The second bedroom also has a carpet finish and has ample space for storage. This property also includes two storage/utility cupboards, built-in Sonos sound system, video-phone entry system and is neutrally decorated throughout and will be offered on a fully furnished basis.

Rothschild House resident’s benefit from a 24-hour concierge and residents' gym. Sainsbury's, Costa Coffee, Ait Riverside Bar is only a short walk away. The area of Kew is nearby and has a good selection of open spaces, charming restaurants, boutique shops and popular cafes. Residents also benefit from close access to the A4/M4, which has good transport links in and out of London and is just a 20-minute drive to Heathrow airport. The property is less than a minute walk from Kew Bridge (South West Trains) mainline station which has direct services to Waterloo in just 30 minutes. Gunnersbury (District Line) underground station is less than a mile away.

detailedDescription:
An opportunity to purchase this large four bedroom semi-detached family home offered to the market in good condition throughout.
The property comprises a wide bright and airy entrance hall with downstairs shower room and WC, a large front reception room measuring 13’6 x 12’6, the second reception room is also a good size measuring an impressive 19 x 11’8 and has been cleverly combined with the kitchen to create an open plan kitchen living space giving you the feeling this area is the heart of the home, perfect for family meal times and entertaining with direct access out on to the landscaped sunny rear garden.
To the first floor are three good size bedrooms, a family bathroom and separate WC. Bedroom one measures 12’x 11’, bedroom two measures 11’6x 10’3 and bedroom three measures 8’7 x 8’3.
To the second floor is the master bedroom measuring a substantial 11’4 x 12’ 2.
The property is located in a resident road close to Whitton High Street, Whitton Train Station, Hounslow High street, Hounslow Train Station, local bus routes and falls within the catchment areas for highly rated Richmond Schools and Hounslow Borough Schools.
Further benefits include gas central heating, double glazed windows, separate utility area and potential to extend further to rear subject to local planning permission.
Viewings are highly recommended to appreciate the natural size.

title: 1 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A vastly spacious family home, occupying a fabulous plot with scope to extend further and off road parking for several cars.

We charge sellers less than traditional agents- the smart buyer buys with Purplebricks.

You can enquire or book viewings for this property at any time. If viewing the advert on Rightmove, Zoopla or Prime Location click the brochure link below.

An ideal home for family living and entertaining alike- deceptively spacious and with incredibly flexible accomodation this wonderful home can be configured to suit a variety of needs. The reception space downstairs is vast and could be used as additional living space if needed. The entrance hall runs the entire length of the house and leading to a small bedroom and bathroom, this part of the house could easily be converted into a self contained studio. Thanks to the large boarded loft and generous plot, there is scope to extend further should more space be required.

Upon entering, you'll be impressed by the spacious, entrance hall which has practical built in storage for shoes and coats. This leads through into the main reception room. The ground floor accommodation is vast and offers a second, separate reception room, study, spacious kitchen/diner, fourth bedroom and shower room. There is a large garden room, fully tiled with marble flooring, to the rear which is wonderful for outside entertaining. The property is positioned on a generous corner plot allowing the large 80 foot plus rear garden to fan out and provide superb outdoor space. The garden is completely secured with block walls all the way round with CCTV front and back for added security. Also double glazing windows and guard doors have been installed in the last 2 years, with a new combination boiler installed last year. With a separate summer house which could provide a useful home offer of a children's play room.
The front offers a newly laid block paved drive way with off street parking for three cars.

Outside

Newly paved driveway to the front with parking for several cars.

Vastly spacious rear garden. Sunny and secluded and an ideal place for the whole family to enjoy and entertain in.

Solid summerhouse with power.

Patio and lawn areas.

The garden is accessed from the superb conservatory area- an ideal space for storage and entertaining. This area could be converted into a more solid extension to the existing accomodation.

Location

Superb location on the borders of Ealing.

Easy access to the area's vast array of excellent local schools, amenities and superb transport links.

General Information

You can book a viewing or enquire about this property 24/7 using the Purplebricks website- if viewing the advert on Rightmove or Zoopla simply click the brochure link below.

If you book a viewing please try your best to attend- if you arrange a viewing and do not show up you will be letting the owner of the property down who will likely have gone to trouble to prepare the property for the viewing. If you cannot make a viewing please let us know as soon as possible

Following your viewing you will receive a request for feedback- the feedback can be left at your convenience and will be very useful information for our seller- we kindly ask you take the time to leave feedback.

You can make offers at anytime via our website. Once an offer has been placed, one of the local team will be in touch to discuss it with you.

Purplebricks offer a revolutionary online service combined with teams of local, experienced estate agents so please feel free to get in touch to ask us anything about the property, the local area or the market- we are always happy to help.

It is worth keeping in mind that whilst most agents will be charging between 1 and 2.5% of the sale price + VAT, we only charge £999 + VAT (less outside London). This means other agents will often over inflate prices simply to cover their unfair fees. This is not the case with us making us an excellent option to not only sell with, but also to buy through.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Further benefits include an on-site estate manager, an entryphone security system, mature communal gardens and private, off-street residents' parking. The superb position offers the very best of Chiswick on your doorstep. A five minute stroll brings you to several artisan coffee shops as well as the many shops, cafes, restaurants and amenities of Chiswick High Road. A host of local gems like The Italians deli, café and bakery sit alongside key amenities like Waitrose and Sainsbury's - all are just minutes from your door.

For commuters, the apartment is 6 minutes on foot from Chiswick Park tube station while Gunnersbury tube and overground station is a 12 minute walk, as well as Heathrow a short twenty minute drive away. A variety of bus links into central London available from Chiswick High Road are just a 5 minute walk. Watchfield Court recently completed a full programme of refurbishment works both internally and externally so everything - from the pointing to the lifts and carpets - is brand new including hot water, heating and off-street residents' parking.

address: Wedgwood Villas, Horticultural Place, London W4.
detailedDescription:
An impressive gated terrace of six new build houses with secure underground parking. A clever mix of traditional styling and a contempory finish has been accomplished in an exceptional central Chiswick location.

The ground floor offers a grand entrance hall with cloakroom to the front. The remainder of the floor is devoted to the kitchen family room with doors onto the southerly garden. The kitchens feature Miele appliances integrated in designer kitchens with stone work surfaces. The separate utility room has Siemens laundry appliances. The first floor offers a sumptuous master suite to the front with ensuite bathroom and a formal reception room to the rear. Both the first and second floors feature air conditioning. The second floor offers three further double bedrooms served by two bathrooms, one ensuite. Above, an opening roof light gains access to amazing roof terrace affording rooftop views over Chiswick. The underground parking has a lift to bring you to the ground floor. The 6 houses in this development come with a 10 year blp New Build Warranty.

The gated Wedgwood Villas development is located in Horticultural Place just south of Turnham Green and Chiswick High Road. Both Turnham Green and Chiswick Park underground stations are moments away. Easy access to the A4/M4 allows direct access to central London and Heathrow Airport.

detailedDescription:
Summary
Brought to the market is this one of its kind Edwardian four bedroom semi-detached property. The sellers have upgraded this home to a high specification but kept with it some amazing original features. Added benefit of an annex that nearly spans 1000 sqr ft.

Description
From the outside, the property boasts mockTudor cladding and an extended porch. Walking through the front door you will be greeted by a large entrance hall that welcomes family and friends with style. Downstairs has been redesigned with modern living in mind that creates a perfect setting to entertain but also relax and unwind, with a separate reception room for those lazy days. The large 460 sq ft rear extension has been completed with a modern fitted kitchen with granite worktops, built-in appliances and breakfast island. Downstairs also comprises a bedroom, bathroom and utility room.

If you are looking for extra storage, a gymnasium, office, play room or what ever you decide, the 873 sq ft outbuilding to the rear will suit your needs. With running water and electricity already installed, this would make a great annex for guests.

Walking upstairs you will find three double bedrooms with built in storage to match which makes this home suitable for a growing family. Also the family bathroom is accessible from the split landing.

Potential buyers who are looking to spend that little extra for your dream forever home then look no further, viewings highly advised!

address: Watchfield Court, Sutton Court Road, London W4
detailedDescription:
Cash buyers only - short lease - no onward chain.
An opportunity to acquire an Art Deco apartment that requires full refurbishment in the very popular Watchfield Court, just a moments’ walk from Chiswick High Road and Turnham Green.
Watchfield Court benefits from having an on-site management office and is very well looked after. The communal areas offer a peaceful place to sit and relax.

The property comprises a galley-style kitchen, family bathroom, light and bright reception room and double bedroom with access to the balcony that has direct views over the beautifully kept communal gardens. detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to purchase this beautifully presented, six bedroom family home, located within a private gated development offering stunning views over the River Thames.

The property has been finished to a high standard and is arranged over four floors. The accommodation provides five double bedrooms, two of which are arranged as walk in wardrobes and a principle bedroom suite. There are three bathrooms (two en-suite) a main reception room on the first floor with French doors leading to a balcony with views of the River Thames, and a kitchen/dining room which leads on to a conservatory with direct access to a private garden through bi-folding doors.

There is playroom on the ground floor, ample storage throughout, a gym in the loft space, downstairs W/C and an off-street parking space. Furthermore there is additional guest gated off-street parking within the development.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Thames Crescent is a private road which is owned and maintained by the residents and is adjacent to the River Thames which is accessed through a secured gate. The house is also moments from the popular open spaces of Chiswick House and Gardens. Transport links include the E3 bus on Edensor Road for access to Chiswick High Road and Turnham Green station (District line). The property also provides easy access to the A4/M4 and Heathrow airport.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A recently refurbished, 772 Sq Ft / 71 Sq M, charming two bedroom garden apartment in Central Chiswick that enjoys a 19'8 reception room, private 55' garden and shares three parking spaces.

The accommodation comprises: Entrance hallway, 19'8 reception room divided into dining room and reception room overlooking the garden, new fitted galley kitchen with side access, tranquil 13'3 master bedroom overlooking the garden, 13'3 guest bedroom with built-in wardrobes and well appointed bathroom.

The apartment features a stunning and beautifully maintained 55' garden incorporating a 12'5 timber garden studio/office.

Included within the sale is access to three parking spaces on the front driveway (first come - first served basis) and a share of the freehold.

Barrowgate Road is located within walking distance of the amenities available on Chiswick High Road which include over sixty bars & restaurants, shopping, good public transport and road links into town and out to Heathrow and the West country.

About chiswick.....

Chiswick is a hugely popular and prosperous large suburb of West London located on the northern side of the River Thames, 6 miles (9.7 km) west of Charing Cross.

Whilst retaining a wonderful village charm, Chiswick is a vibrant area brimming with the activity and opportunity typical of London.

Chiswick boasts a stunning range of property including elegant Georgian architecture, renowned Norman Shaw designed Bedford Park houses to quaint cottages in the Glebe Estate.

Chiswick High Road offers a fantastic range of bars, restaurants, supermarkets, an ever-expanding range of delis and boutiques.

About Harpers of Chiswick….

Bespoke property solutions, tailored to Chiswick clients seeking a different experience than that typically offered by generic high street estate and lettings agents.

Property Staging, Estate Agency, Lettings Agency, Interior Design, Property Management, Home Management, Holiday Management and even professional Key Holding.

Unlike some agents who seem to believe that having more available property will mean they are more attractive to clients, we consciously keep our active portfolio compact, so that we can successfully apply the time, high levels of detail, attention and management you require and deserve whilst achieving our joint objective, success.

Over half of our business is brokered on a ‘black book’ basis without the need for public marketing. This is possible by building relationships for over thirty years directly within the Chiswick community. Ultimate discretion and straight-forward transactions without the need to exposure your personal business and the interior of your home to the world.

Why work with Harpers of Chiswick?…

We offer sensible and fair fixed fees that are completely linked to results.

Sales fees are operated on a three tier system directly linked to the price you achieve.

The tier levels and amounts are individually negotiated and agreed with you before we begin marketing. You may want to set us a high target with a higher reward or a lower target for a more time efficient sale. It is entirely up to you. Fees are always agreed in £pounds (inc. VAT) and not old-fashioned percentages so you don't pay fees on every penny you achieve for the sale.

Lettings fees are revolutionary and fair for everyone.

Monthly Fee. We take our fees monthly throughout the tenancy and not annually in advance.
No Rent = No Fee. If for any reason you don't receive your rent, we don't receive our fee.
No Hidden Charges. We don't levy any hidden additional charges for standard tenancy paperwork or procedural administration.

Welcome to High Street Quarter

High Street Quarter is an exciting development of one, two, and three-bedroom homes built around a new public square with shops, restaurants, and a state-of-the-art multiplex cinema creating a new lifestyle district on your doorstep.

The development will link the existing high street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new community in the heart of Hounslow. Hounslow East and Hounslow stations are both a few minutes' walk away, with quick links to central London.

Shared Ownership with L&Q at High Street Quarter

These homes are well-positioned for those looking for a step on the property ladder, with 1,2, and 3 bedroom homes available through Shared Ownership, you can buy your first home with as little as a 25% share.

Built around a new public square, High Street Quarter offers everything you need at your doorstep – making life just that little bit easier. Offering a stepping stone to homeownership in Hounslow the first collection of 1,2 and 3 bedroom Shared Ownership apartments at High Street Hounslow are launching soon.

L&Q at High Street Hounslow

Welcome to High Street Quarter

High Street Quarter is an exciting development of one, two, and three-bedroom homes built around a new public square with shops, restaurants, and a state-of-the-art multiplex cinema creating a new lifestyle district on your doorstep.

The development will link the existing high street to the Blenheim Centre to create a vibrant new community in the heart of Hounslow. Hounslow East and Hounslow stations are both a few minutes' walk away, with quick links to central London.

Shared Ownership with L&Q at High Street Quarter

These homes are well-positioned for those looking for a step on the property ladder, with 1,2, and 3 bedroom homes available through Shared Ownership, you can buy your first home with as little as a 25% share.

Built around a new public square, High Street Quarter offers everything you need at your doorstep – making life just that little bit easier. Offering a stepping stone to homeownership in Hounslow the first collection of 1,2 and 3 bedroom Shared Ownership apartments at High Street Hounslow are launching soon.

Key features:

Part of the emerging West London regeneration corridor

5-min walk to Hounslow Central & 10 minutes to Hounslow East tube stations

Heathrow Airport 10 minutes by tube

State-of-the-art multiplex cinema with planned shops and restaurants

Underground parking and cycle storage available

Easy to use car club available to all residents

Exclusively available through Shared Ownership

Register your interest today to have a member of our sales team contact you!

detailedDescription:
A one bedroom retirement apartment located on the fourth floor Golden Court was developed by Pegasus Retirement Homes plc. The facilities at Golden Court include an Estate Manager who sees to the day-to-day running of the development and can also be contacted in the event of an emergency. For periods when the Estate Manager is off-duty each property is linked to a 24 hour Appello emergency call system. Each property benefits from accommodation that includes an Entrance Hall, Lounge, Kitchen, one or two bedrooms and bathroom. It is a condition of purchase that residents be over the age of 60 years. Please speak to our Property Consultant if you require information regarding Event Fees that may apply to this property.

Accommodation

Front door with spy hole, front door bell and letterbox leads to the .....

Entrance Hall

Light point, double power point. Creda convector thermostatically controlled panel heater giving instant heat at standard rate electricity. Door to airing cupboard, which houses 'Pulsacoil' hot water unit, with reserve tank and Horsmann water heater controller box. Electric meter. Smoke alarm. Coat rack and storage space. Pullcord unit to Estate Manager or Careline Control Centre.

Living Room With Double Aspect And Dining Area

Electric fire and fire surround. Two Creda electric night storage heaters. Light points for ceiling and two wall light points. Four double power sockets. Two BT sockets. TV aerial point with possible connection to Sky TV. Emergency pullcord.
Glass door through to kitchen.

Kitchen

Tiled and fitted with wall units. Work tops. Stainless steel unit with single drainer. Fitted 'Hotpoint' electric hob with 'Indesit' extractor fan with overhead light. Electric built in oven. Refrigerator and freezer. Power sockets and microwave socket.

Bedroom

Built in wardrobe, hanging rail and shelf. Creda storage heater. Three double power sockets. BT socket and one TV aerial point. Light points for ceiling and bedside lights. Pullcord.

Bathroom

Tiled and fitted with suite walk in shower, hand grab rail. Pedestal wash hand basin. WC with low level flush. 'Xpelair' extractor fan. Creda dimplex electric heated towel rail. Vanity unit with halogen lights. Shaver point. Enclosed ceiling light. Pullcord. Creda wall mounted fan heater.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful 5 bedroom townhouse with stunning river views and off-street parking in the heart of Kew

Location

Enviably positioned between picturesque Kew Green and a beautiful stretch of the River Thames, the house is within just a few hundred metres of the main entrance of the unesco world heritage site, Kew Gardens. Kew Village is also nearby and has a charming atmosphere with a good selection of independent shops and cafes, a monthly market and the Michelin starred 'Glasshouse' restaurant. There are also numerous and excellent pubs and restaurants along this stretch of the river and also facing Kew Green Kew Gardens train station is located in the village and is on the District Line tube as well as the overland train to Stratford, via north London. A direct train service to London Waterloo runs from Kew Bridge Station, a few hundred metres away on the other side of Kew Bridge. The M4 motorway can also be accessed just over the bridge. Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

Set within an exclusive gated riverside development of just a handful of properties this four storey five bedroom modern townhouse was built around 1980 and provides over 2300 square feet internally. The house is tastefully presented and has an excellent flow of accommodation, providing superbly well for both family life and more formal entertaining. The stunning river views can be enjoyed internally from the two main bedrooms and the first floor living room, as well as externally from the two full width river facing balconies.

Other features of particular note include a communal tennis court and gymnasium for the exclusive use of the residents, a resident caretaker and off street parking. As well as the private garden there are beautifully tended communal gardens, that are well established and mainly laid to lawn.

Square Footage: 2312 sq ft

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
The house features fantastic entertaining space on the ground floor with an open plan reception and kitchen/dining room.

The reception has wood flooring, a fireplace, and a feature open tread staircase. This flows through to the kitchen/dining room which has a bespoke joiner built kitchen with part wood and tiled flooring. Bi-folding doors open onto a part decked garden. There is also a cloakroom/WC on the ground floor.

The first floor comprises three double bedrooms. The master bedroom is large with a pair of windows and a contemporary fireplace. The bathroom is beautifully designed with slate tiling and a brand new walk-in shower.

The property has Full Planning Permission for a loft conversion comprising of an extra bedroom and en-suite bathroom as well as a side return extension to the kitchen on the ground floor. Basement: Planning Permission has also been given (June 2021) for the addition of a full footprint basement which would add 50% more living space for additional bedrooms, home working office, gym, home cinema, or additional reception space.

Architect plans for the property are available on request.

Owing to our commitment to keeping both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Oxford Gardens is a quiet residential cul-de-sac close to the river and benefits from close proximity to outstanding schools such as Strand on the Green and Grove Park Primary. Conveniently located just off the M4 there is fast access out of London to Heathrow and the West.

Public transport is available from Kew Bridge overland railway station and Gunnersbury Tube Station. Local bus services are 5 mins walk from the property.

detailedDescription:
Summary

For Sale by Online Auction. Starting bid of 140,000. Terms and Conditions Apply.

We welcome to the market this one bedroom studio apartment is ideal for an investor. This property has ample storage space and natural lighting throughout. The Gables is located in Heston and has excellent transport links via public transport or car to and from Central London. Osterley Park and Norwood Green Park are a short walking distance from the property.

Externally this property also benefits a Garage and also has an external store in the corridor for further storage use.

Please note this is a tenanted property.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks- West London are proud to present to the market this superbly modern designed family Riverside townhouse.

Ideally located on the private street, Chiswick Quay. Four floors with direct views looking both onto the river and Marina. The property features four large bedrooms.

This riverside house boasts the vast open plan sitting room that looks directly out onto the manicured gardens that flow directly down to the banks of Old Man River Thames. The first floor opens up into three aspects, the vast sitting room, split level dining area and recently updated modern kitchen with a three component floor to ceiling refrigerator, freezer and wine cooler. With the open kitchen, the chef is never left out of the conversation or river view. One large bathroom with underfloor heating. A three shower head wet room including a washer dryer closet on the top floor. A further ground floor cloak room also with washer/dryer. Indoor 3 car garage with electric door opener and 2 out side private driveway spaces & still plenty of free, on street parking for guests on the private street.

The property also displays a series of tasteful modern design features including Italian leather walls, imported stone, antique wood, under floor heating, zone selective Lutron lighting system, built in surround sound speaker system for the HD TV and Sonas System accessed through your mobile devices, a 4 person Hydropool hot tub in the roof top garden-enjoy the warm water over looking the river, wireless electric blinds. There is air conditioning in the south facing rooms of the house.

Situated for the A4 & waking distance to transport connections including rail, bus & tube. This home offers much beauty and tranquillity whilst being close to the High Road & all of it's bars, shops and restaurants. Close by also Chiswick house, Strand on the Green, Kew Gardens, Richmond Park & Syon House . Heathrow is 10.3 miles just down the A4 from this modern property.

Reception Room

The large reception area with floor-to-ceiling window and double door opening onto the terrace and communal gardens to the river - vast open living area with dual aspect light intake, Nordic pine panelling and many bespoke features such as brass fitted reclaimed lights and Cotswold oak solid steps.

Dining Area

The dining area-arranged as a mezzanine level to the reception area also on looking at the river and the terraced area offers a large dining space which is currently set with grand pieces of furniture, seating over 10 people.

Kitchen

A tastefully designed kitchen for those that love to cook and cater. Much thought has gone into the design of this well presented kitchen featuring bespoke & luxury imported appliances such as American dual door commercial fridge and full height glass drinks chiller. Another interesting feature of the kitchen is it's antiquities - a large pagan stone has been set as the fire back to the large Britannia oven - a charming and historic feature that compliments the bespoke brass sink beautifully.

Master Bedroom

Set on the top floor occupying the south west facing aspect. A large and bright master bedroom with built-in sliding door wardrobes. A concealed entrance to a large dressing room which could be made nursery/5th bedroom opening onto a large ensuite. The master bedroom posts the best views of the property yet

Master Dressing Room

The master dressing area could be presented as a fifth bedroom or nursery, the room offers large sliding fitted wardrobes and access to the pitched loft space. Direct access to Large ensuite bathroom with views over the Marina

Master Bathroom

A large beautifully presented master ensuite. Featuring his and hers sinks and showers, natural stone inset and feature sinks. This large bathroom also benefits from a airing and utility cupboard.

Roof Top Terrace

A large private sun. Terrace accessed via a full floor-to-ceiling glass doors. The Terrace offers ample space and a four man hydro pool.

Bedroom Two

A charming third floor aspect large double bedroom with fully fitted wardrobe area. Sea grass wall fabrics and a large floor-to-ceiling bay window with direct views over the gardens and river. The room also features a Bose smart music system with fitted speakers.

Bedroom Three

Yet another sizeable bedroom, front aspect with floor-to-ceiling windows. Large built-in cupboards and ample floor space

Bedroom Four

A rear addition river view room. Currently presented as a study with Nordic pine wood panelling and Hidden cupboards.

Sun Terrace

Set on the ground level in line with the gardens, This large terrace accessed via the glass doors from the reception room is directly south facing. A sizeable private terrace and dining area. The suntrap terrace benefits from a 4x3m counter lever designed umbrella system and tendered plant beds.

Communal Gardens

The development offers much green space and well tendered gardens. The Private terrace on looks the sweeping gardens down to the rivers edge.

Entrance Hall

An impressive entry - The reclaimed Scottish castle front door opens on to a large hallway and Boot area with access onto the garage, guest clock room and storage rooms.

Downstairs Cloakroom

Large guest toilet with storage currently used as a utilities area.

Storage Room

Set off of the garage a large and cool storage room

Integral Garage

A larger than average garage which could fit up to three cars. Some properties within the development have change this to residential use.

Off Road Parking

In addition to the integral parking the property offers a drive way for yet another vehicle.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A two bedroom apartment located on the fourth floor of this retirement development Felbridge Court was constructed by McCarthy & Stone (Developments) Ltd and comprises of one and two bedroom apartments. The development has a Development manager backed up by an Appello 24hour emergency calls service. In addition there is a security door entry system at the main entrance allowing residents to view visitors at the entrance by changing channels on their own TV. As well as the residents lounge there is also a laundry room, a lift to all floors, parking facilities and a guest suite. It is a condition of purchase that residents be over the age of 60 years, or in the event of a couple, one must be over the age of 60 years and the other over 55 years.
Please speak to our Property Consultant if you require information regarding Event Fees that may apply to this property.

detailedDescription:
"Share Of Freehold" Offered to the market is this stunning two bedroom ground floor flat located on Beaumont Road and offering a lease of over 900 years. Purplebricks recommend a prompt viewing.

Property walk-through:
Walking into a wide, welcoming entrance hallway with ample storage cupboards (including a small loft), leading into an open plan kitchen/reception room, with fitted eye and base level units and integral appliances. Bedroom one is a double room complete with fitted wardrobes, bedroom two is a good size nursery/office room. There is also shared off street parking behind the property.

Location:
The flat is within easy walking distance of Chiswick High Road's shops, cafes and restaurants. Transport links include Chiswick Park & Turnham Green Tube (District & Picadilly Lines) and South Acton (Overground) Stations, local bus routes and the A4/M4 for routes in and out of London.

Property Description

Being Sold by goto Online Auction

Starting Bids from £435,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Online Auction. The Online Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks
There are no other fees or charges payable to the Auctioneer however, there are other costs to consider such as:
• who are all selected for their expertise in Auction Transactions. Please call the number below for more information.
• Stamp Duty Land Tax (sdlt) is applicable if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England, Wales or Northern Ireland.

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

If the Buyer Information Pack has been produced and provided by goto Group any successful purchaser will be required to pay £354.00 (including VAT) towards the cost of the preparation of the pack. These can then be used by your solicitor to progress the sale

detailedDescription:
A modern, well presented two bedroom house offering well proportioned accommodation, with a spacious reception room opening onto the rear garden, and open plan with the dining room and kitchen. On the first floor there are two double bedrooms and family bathroom. The area is well served by excellent local schools, as well as bus routes and Chiswick Mainline station to Waterloo.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Verdo is a collection of studio, 1,2 and 3 bedroom apartments built by EcoWorld London and is surrounded by well-kept parks, the tropical gardens of Kew and the River Thames. The beautifully crafted apartments are the start of a multi-million-pound regeneration programme taking place around Kew Bridge Station, TW8 which is set to include a range of retail and leisure facilities.

The development is made up of three beautiful buildings - Ivy, Lily and Jasmine House - all surrounded by private landscaped gardens, allowing you to relax in a green oasis just a quick hop from central London.

This reassignment of a stunning one-bedroom apartment is set on the fourth floor of Jasmine House.

The modern kitchen comes with fitted Siemens and Bosch appliances, and the bedroom features an ensuite and contemporary fitted wardrobe. With engineered timber floor finishes throughout, this apartment benefits from a spacious balcony with access from the living and areas.

Each home has easy access to the spacious residents' lounge, which boasts a work zone and private meeting room. A media room is available for watching films or sporting events, and there is a private residents' gym. The lounge spills directly out to the residents' podium gardens. The sunlit terraces and inviting play areas are ready and waiting to be explored and enjoyed.

The development is located at the heart of Brentford, which is being transformed into a vibrant new neighbourhood with shops, cafes, restaurants.
A home at Verdo is ideally located for a range of world-famous local attractions; the grade II listed Kew Bridge leading to the Royal Botanical Gardens (a unesco world heritage site), Son House set in Syon Park, and the recently restored Gunnersbury Park and Triangle Nature Reserve. The upmarket high streets of Chiswick and Richmond have a diverse array of shops and restaurants both with local independent retailers as well as well-known national favourites. The scheme has excellent transport links, being just a minutes’ walk from Kew Bridge Station which provides easy access to central London at Waterloo Station in less than 30 minutes and is under 10 minutes’ walk from Gunnersbury Station which is serviced by the District & Overground lines.

Gunnersbury Underground Station (0.50m)
Chiswick Park (0.86m)
Acton Town (0.90m)
Kew Bridge (0.08m)
Gunnersbury (0.50m)
Kew Gardens (0.94m)

EcoWorld London
At EcoWorld London, we’re creating outstanding and sustainable developments that will stand the test of time.
EcoWorld London is part of Eco World International Berhad (EcoWorld International), a real estate developer listed on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia Securities Berhad. EcoWorld London is also partly owned by The Willmott Dixon Group.

detailedDescription:
Freehold and Residential Investment

Key Features:

Situated on the northern bank of the River Thames, just along from Kew Bridge in Chiswick's desirable Strand on the Green, you will find 'Loretta Wharf'.

Six Residential Apartments
Arranged over three floors
Four two bedroom, two bathroom apartments
Two one bedroom, one bathroom apartments

An Enviable river side location with views across to Kew.
Large off street parking to the front of the property.

All the apartments are rented on AST agreements with an annual income of approx. GBP109,800 per annum.

Please contact Northfield Land & New Homes on for viewing information, floorplans, title plans, sample AST, EPCs and additional photography.

Local Information:

Loretta Wharf is located on Strand on the Green in Chiswick, West London. It is located to the east of Kew Bridge, along the north bank of the river Thames.
Neighboured by Historical riverside pubs
Kew Bridge Rail Station is located approximately1km from the property for direct connections to London Waterloo Rail Station where you will find some of London's finest tourist spots within easy reach and London's Cultural Southbank.
Nearby areas of interest include Chiswick High Road with its variety of independant traders, recognised brands, restaurants and bars within approximately 1.5km.
The Botantical Gardens at Kew on the south side of the River Thames draws people looking to enjoy its vast array of flora and beautiful open spaces as well as the numerous events it runs throughout the year. From ice skating at Christmas to open air concerts in the summer months. Its situtated within approximately 1.5km of Loretta Wharf. The centres of Ealing, Kew and Richmond are easily accessible by foot, car and public transport.
The A4 / M4 and A406 are easily accessible offering exceptional links for those travelling by car to all parts of London as well as great connections for those demanding access to the rest of the country.

Energy Performance
All EPC's are available upon request.

detailedDescription:
A characterful Edwardian semi-detached freehold house on a no-through-road by Chiswick High Road.

The house features two grand living rooms. These two rooms have wooden flooring and while connected by an arch to enjoy open plan living they can easily be separated with doors to create an intimate setting. The front living room has a period fireplace and a bay window, while the back living room has French windows to the garden. The fully fitted modern kitchen has room for dining and has a door to the garden. A cellar, accessed from the kitchen, provides additional storage.

To the first floor are two double bedrooms, one of which has fitted wardrobes and an en suite shower room. Also on this floor is a modern bathroom and a smaller bedroom which could be used as a nursery or study. On the second floor is a large bedroom with en suite shower room.

The front garden has an established hedge and other trees which provide privacy, while the paved rear garden benefits from side access and well-stocked raised beds.

Local Area

Cleveland Avenue is a tree-lined no-through-road popular with its residents for its calm setting close to many handy Chiswick amenities, such as the Underground station, Macken Brothers’ butcher, Chiswick Common and a whole host of cafes, restaurants and independent shops.

The A4, A40 and A406 are nearby for driving in, out and around the city, while several bus routes pass close to the property. Stamford Brook Underground station is nearby and connects with the Piccadilly Line at Hammersmith.

Chiswick has a range of independent preparatory schools such as Orchard House, Ravenscourt Park, Heathfield House and Chiswick & Bedford Park Preparatory School, as well as several well-regarded state primaries.

For older children, Chiswick School is rated Good by Ofsted and independent options include Latymer Upper, Godolphin & Latymer, St Paul’s, St Paul’s Girls and Kew House.

Open spaces nearby include Chiswick and Acton Green Commons, Homefield Recreation Ground and Chiswick House & Gardens, as well as the Thames Path.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Undoubtedly one of a kind, this exclusive and characteristic detached property dating back to c.1800 is discreetly set on a large plot, with expansive space all around this unique property which is further boosted by a south facing garden!

The entrance to the property is served by two secure vehicular gates and walled gardens with an abundance of parking space to the front as well as ample land to the side of the property which currently hosts a detached garage, ideal for workshop/study or lends itself for potential for front, side and rear extensions, subject to planning.

The ground floor consists of two well proportioned reception rooms including attractive wooden ceiling beams, parquet flooring and large windows allowing plenty of natural light in to the property. The original garage has been converted to a spacious study with large built in wardrobes, which can also be used as a fourth bedroom. The kitchen has been refurbished to create a sleek and modern design with the added benefit of a breakfast bar.

The first floor includes three good sized bedrooms and a family bathroom which has been refurbished to include both a modern bath and shower.

The garden creates a sense of being in the countryside with it's large open space and a perfect blend of patio and lawn areas.

The property has an elapsed permission of planning to extend the property double storey to the front.

Church Road has an idyllic setting on the borders of Isleworth and Osterley, providing easy access to both Osterley and Isleworth stations. For those with families, there are excellent schools nearby and National Trust's beautiful Osterley Park.

Summary
Offered to the market with no onward chain, over 700 sq ft and a share in the freehold (which is owned by the residents), this ground floor apartment is a stone's throw away from Feltham Mainline Station, and within 15 minutes' drive of Heathrow, making it an ideal investment property.

Description
A rare opportunity to acquire a two bedroom ground floor apartment in this small, modern, well-maintained redbrick block of six units. Situated to the rear of the building, overlooking the garden, this bright spacious apartment includes a large living room, separate kitchen, two double bedrooms, bathroom, secure garage, secure entrance.

Bison Court is situated on the corner of Park Way, Hounslow Road, offering a fantastic central location within 0.1 miles of Feltham High Street and Feltham mainline station (with direct connections to Waterloo), and approximately 15 minutes' drive from Heathrow. You will also find an array of bus routes on Hounslow Road such as H26 to Hatton Cross, 285 to Kingston and 490 to Richmond and more.

detailedDescription:
The flat is beautifully finished and features a large open plan reception with limed oak flooring and a modern white kitchen. A large south-facing balcony is accessed via sliding glazed doors.

The bedroom is a comfortable double with a south-facing window. There is likewise a sizeable bathroom which is finished in a brilliant white colour scheme.

On the ground floor is the porter's desk which is manned from 7am to 7pm. The apartment has access to the elegant communal gardens and has off street parking. There is also a bike store and a gym (under a separate agreement).

Chiswick Gate is located close to Chiswick House and its delightful gardens. The River Thames is also very close by for river walks. Public transport is available at Chiswick Overground Station, Turnham Green Station (District Line) and there are a number of buses which stop directly outside the developments main entrance.

"Chain Free". This well presented two bedroom apartment is situated on the 5th and top floor (with lift) of a 1930s, central Chiswick, well-maintained mansion block. detailedDescription:
Seeing is believing! Book A viewing asap for this modern contemporary family home that will make for an enviable purchase! This marvellous new build 3 double bedroom, 3 bathroom house arranged over 3 floors is without doubt something quite special!

This excellent property has its own private balcony on one of the bedrooms, and has 2 en suite bathrooms

At approximately 1500 sq ft, this property has well proportioned accommodation throughout. To the ground floor it further comprises a Study/Home Office, A Utility Room/Guest Cloakroom, Superb Comprehensive Fitted Kitchen With Integrated Appliances, which itself is Open Plan to a Very Large Reception/Family Room with bi-folding doors leading to a very nice Landscaped Garden with Patio.

There are excellent transport links close by. South Ealing Underground Station provides easy access into Central London and also Heathrow Airport via the Picadilly Line. Brentford Overground is also within walking distance providing easy access to the South Western Railway Service. Furthermore, easily accessible arterial routes are the A4. M4 and North Circular Road.

This property is local to the famous Gunnersbury Park which was previously owned by the Rothschild family. This park is a high quality public space that serves the local community and beyond. This park consists of a woodland area, ornamental lake, crazy golf and recently won a £22million rejuvenation investment. detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to purchase a fabulous three-bedroom town house in this quiet cul-de-sac within easy reach of Central Hounslow.

Spacious, offering versatile accommodation and with scope to extend and adapt, this bright and well-presented home is perfect for a family wanting plenty of space along with a great location.

The accommodation comprises on the ground floor, an integral garage (with scope to convert into another room), fitted kitchen with space to dine and a W.C. Upstairs is a bright and spacious reception room and double bedroom with fitted wardrobes. The third-floor plays host to two further bedrooms, one with a modern en-suite and an additional family bathroom. There is ample storage throughout the property and a feeling of light and space across all three floors thanks to a superb design.

There is scope to extend subject to the usual consents.

Externally there is a large amount of space to the front, off road parking for several cars, side access and a well-maintained rear garden.

Marryat Close is an enviable spot to call home, being a a cul-de-sac, the location is perfect for families and is within easy reach of central Hounslow, tube/mainline station, the Heathland school, Hounslow central Mosque and the local Sikh temple. Twickenham, Richmond and Heathrow are all within easy reach via nearby road and bus links.

The property occupies arguably the best spot in the close, being next to the open green spaces of the Orchard Primary school providing a wonderful outlook and plenty of privacy.

No onward chain.

You can book a viewing or enquire about this property at your convenience 24/7 using the Purplebricks website or by calling us
