address: Concord Court, Palladian Gardens, London W4
detailedDescription:
A stylish one bedroom apartment, set within the prestigious Chiswick Gate Development.

Location

Palladian Gardens is situated in the stunning Chiswick Gate Development, completed in 2017 by the renowned Berkeley Homes. It is located just 0.7 miles from Chiswick rail station for links to London Waterloo and 0.9 miles from Turnham Green tube station (District line). Regular buses also run from Chiswick Lane towards Chiswick High Road. Chiswick Gate is within close proximity of the beautiful Chiswick House and Gardens, and the River Thames. Chiswick offers easy access to central London via the A4, as well as access to Heathrow and the west of England via the M4.

Description

Situated on the top floor of this landmark development, this one bedroom apartment is immaculately presented with a fabulous South facing balcony, landscaped communal gardens and an onsite Concierge (7am-7pm, 7 days a week).

Upon entry, the hallway is wide and spacious with integrated storage for coats and utilities. There is a modern bathroom equipped with both a bath and a shower. The bedroom is South-facing and very light with substantial built-in wardrobes.

The bright kitchen/reception room has wooden flooring throughout and is awash with modern appliances. The room is naturally light and spacious with the added bonus of a gable window due to the apartment being located on the corner of the building. There are sliding doors out to private balcony with views over the well-maintained communal gardens, ideal for entertaining.

The apartment has direct lift access to the car park, cycle store and bin stores. The development is very secure with CCTV throughout, a porter on site and 24 hour security provided by Marksman Security.

In summary this is a wonderful modern apartment in a popular, development, with the benefit of many excellent amenities.

Square Footage: 556 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 121 years remaining

address: Appleton House, 3 New Road, Feltham TW14
detailedDescription:
Shared ownership

This brand new home is available to buy from as little as £142,000 with a 40% share!

This first floor apartment benefits from a spacious open plan lounge/kitchen/diner with a private balcony, two double bedrooms, a luxurious bathroom suite and parking.

Whether seeking some tranquil green space or a fast commute to central London, there’s something for everyone in this stunning new development. Situated just opposite Feltham Station, this contemporary apartment complex overlooks Longford River and is in close proximity to several parks including Hayworth Park and Leitrim Park. Each thoughtfully considered apartment comes with its own balcony or terrace to take in the views.

Feltham is a thriving district with big plans. Advantageously situated close to Heathrow and with fast links into Central London, things are set to get even better. Buying at Centrum you’ll be part of one of the capital’s most exciting regeneration projects, and at the centre of a neighbourhood that’s really going places. Investment in the area includes not only stylish new housing developments, and more local jobs, but improved transport links and even better retail and leisure facilities. All set to transform the area over the next 15 years.

Pricing & affordability

Approximate Size: 72.3 m2

Full Market Value: £355,000

40% Share Price: £142,000 (rent £488.13pcm)
50% Share Price: £177,500 (rent £406.77pcm)
75% Share Price: £266,250 (rent £203.39pcm)

Minimum 5% Mortgage Deposit (40% share): £7,100

Approximate Service Charges: £113.82 pcm*
Eligibility


The Shared Ownership scheme is a Part Buy, Part Rent way of owning your own home for a smaller up front payment. With Shared Ownership, you buy a share of your home using a mortgage from a bank or building society and pay a subsidised rent on the share you did not purchase. The combined mortgage and rent is usually less than you’d expect to pay if you bought a similar property outright.

At Centrum you can buy a minimum 40% share of your home (the maximum you can buy initially is 75%). When you’re ready, you can buy more shares until you staircase to owning 100% of your home.

To be eligible for shared ownership you would need to meet the following criteria:

• Your household income does not exceed £90,000
• You have a deposit of at least 5% of the share value
• You do not own another property or have your name on the deeds or a mortgage for a property worldwide.
• This will be your only residence.
• You are a permanent UK resident or have indefinite right to remain.
• You must have a local area connection and either live and/or work in the London Borough of Hounslow. Only buyers who are members of the armed forces can be considered from areas outside of Hounslow.

Please note the minimum share you can purchase can vary depending on your financial situation and you may be asked to purchase a larger share, should your personal circumstances permit.

*Service charges are estimated and may subject to change.

**These photos are for information purposes only and may not represent a true likeness for the units being sold. They may have been taken from earlier phases or similar developments/house types and digitally furnished to represent how the home could be laid out; the final colours/appearance/specification may differ from the images and are not plot specific. We advise applicants to make their own investigations on future development in the area. We would suggest contacting the local authority for more information.

detailedDescription:
If you're looking for a home to move straight into, then look no further. This stunning three bedroom end of terrace family home is presented in immaculate condition benefitting from original floorboards and cosy conservatory overlooking the garden. It boasts high ceilings, a combination of contemporary design with traditional features. The property is bright, spacious and benefits from a modern kitchen with plenty of space for dining.

The property comprises a bright and airy front living room with a feature fireplace. Upstairs comprises a large master bedroom with double apex windows, two further bedrooms one of which has an original fireplace feature and a large recently updated family bathroom.

Externally there is a beautifully maintained garden. Other benefits include a driveway for three cars, an outside shed useful for storage and a downstairs WC.

The property is conveniently located within a few minutes' walk of South Ealing's High street and a short walk from Gunnersbury park, It all adds up to a real ''village feel''. A short walk from Piccadilly tube line.

By car, one is just a few minutes' drive from the A4/M4 and in turn the motorway network is a short drive.

Scope to extend further.

The property is within close proximity to a number of sought after schools (see school checker for full list)

Viewings highly recommended!

detailedDescription:
This wonderful period house is positioned on one of Chiswick's favoured road just south of Chiswick High Road in the Glebe Estate. The entrance hall opens onto a double reception room with a pretty bay window to the front and doors to the garden to the back.

To the back of the house is the kitchen which is fitted with an array of appliances and ample storage. Beyond is the dining area which has double doors onto the mature garden. The first floor offers two double bedrooms with a third in the loft. These are served by a family bathroom. The house has the scope, subject to the usual planning consents, to be extended further.

Glebe Street is at the favoured High Road end of the Glebe Estate and is a pretty tree lined road of Victorian houses. Whilst protected from the sounds of the high road the array of shops, bars and restaurants are all on your doorstep. Turnham Green underground station is just a few moments further and is served by the District Line.

detailedDescription:
A superb opportunity to purchase this well dressed extended family home situated in what is arguably the finest location of the premier Jersey Road. The property sprawls an immense 2,218 sq.ft and offers further potential for development, subject to usual planning consents.

Upon entering via the bright and airy entrance hall stems a front reception room in addition to a grand through lounge which opens to an additional sitting room/ bar area. Flowing through the ground floor you will arrive to the heart of the house where you are greeted with the generously sized and chic kitchen finished to an impeccable standard with a large breakfast island and dining area. Further attributes to this floor include a stylish cloakroom and utility room.

The upper floor of the residence comprises of four well-proportioned bedrooms, one en suite shower room, as well as a modern and tasteful four-piece family bathroom suite.

To the outside there is a secure electric gated driveway accessed via an intercom system providing off-street parking for several cars and a rear garden perfect for outdoor entertaining and al fresco dining.

Positioned on this well-regarded location the property backs on to Osterley Park offering a feel of the countryside in this suburban commuter town as well as being ideally situated 0.4 miles from Osterley Underground Station and surrounded by an ample array of local amenities and reputable schools such as Nishkam School West London, The Green School for Girls and Isleworth and Syon School for Boys . The A4/M4 can be found just a stone throw away in addition to direct bus links into neighbouring towns.

detailedDescription:
A stunning two bedroom apartment with secure underground parking and concierge, set within a private gated island development in Brentford. This property benefits from being on the ground floor and has been upgraded by the current owners and consists of an open-plan living room, fully fitted kitchen, modern bathroom, additional en suite, two double bedrooms and fitted storage. The apartments further benefits from a private terrace which opens up from the reception room, perfect for those long summer nights.

The Island at Brentford Lock is a premium private development completed in 2003, with a friendly concierge team, a wildlife conservation area and a warm community of residents. Residents are able to take advantage of nearby shops, cafes and restaurants in Brentford, while both Syon Park and Boston Manor Park are also easily accessible. Brentford Mainline station provides commuters with convenient transport links into and out of the city centre, supplemented by local bus routes and the A4/M4 which are all within reach of the property.

Several highly-regarded schools are also close to the property, including Gunnersbury Catholic School, The Green Schools for Boys and Girls, Brentford School for Girls, St Paul’s C of E Primary School and Our Lady and St John’s Catholic Primary School.

detailedDescription:
This stunning one-bedroom apartment is set on the fourth floor of Ivy House.

The modern kitchen comes with fitted Siemens and Bosch appliances, and the bedroom features an ensuite and contemporary fitted wardrobe. With engineered timber floor finishes throughout, this apartment benefits from two spacious balconies with access from both the living and bedroom areas.

Verdo - Kew Bridge is a collection of contemporary apartments with access to lifestyle residents' amenities. The development is made up of three beautiful buildings - Ivy, Lily and Jasmine House - all surrounded by private landscaped gardens, allowing you to relax in a green oasis just a quick hop from central London.

Each home has easy access to the spacious residents' lounge, which boasts a work zone and private meeting room. A media room is available for watching films or sporting events, and there is a private residents' gym. The lounge spills directly out to the residents' podium gardens. The sunlit terraces and inviting play areas are ready and waiting to be explored and enjoyed.

The development is located at the heart of Brentford, which is being transformed into a vibrant new neighbourhood with shops, cafes, restaurants. A home at Verdo - Kew Bridge also puts you in touching distance of some of London's best loved high streets, including Kew Village and Chiswick.

detailedDescription:
An imposing semi-detached Victorian freehold house in a rare cul-de-sac setting near Chiswick High Road. Sensitively restored, upgraded and extended by the current owners, the substantial property also has several characterful original features from the Arts and Crafts movement, including multi-pane windows, hung tiles and fitted cupboards.

The grand formal living room has high ceilings, dado and picture rails, and a cast-iron fireplace with marble surround. Lit by tall sash windows, this well-proportioned room has wooden floors and fitted storage. The dining room is a similar size, also with a smart fireplace and wooden flooring, and has multi-paned wooden doors leading to the informal family room at the rear of the house, complete with glazed roof and French windows to the garden. Accessed from the main hallway and also from the family room, the modern kitchen with breakfast area is fully fitted with integrated appliances and a peninsula. The breakfast area features display shelving and additional fitted storage. A guest cloakroom completes the ground floor, whilst a cellar with access from the main hallway provides useful space for storage or potential future conversion, subject to the usual permissions.

The first floor is home to two large double bedrooms, both with fitted wardrobes. The main bedroom has an en suite bathroom with two sinks, a double shower and a freestanding bath, while the other bedroom is served by a separate shower room. On the mezzanine between the first and second floors is a third bedroom, ideal for use as a home office, and on the second floor are two further double bedrooms, both with original storage cupboards, and a bathroom.

The front garden features a period-style tiled path, a charming tree and a gravelled area with room for bike storage. At the rear, a raised terrace leads from the family room into the paved garden area which is bordered by raised beds and benefits from an open outlook with no properties overlooking it.

Local Area

Grange Road is located in the Gunnersbury area of Chiswick, close to Chiswick High Road. The open spaces of Acton Green Common, Gunnersbury Triangle Nature Reserve, Turnham Green and Gunnersbury Park are close by, with Chiswick Common and Chiswick House & Gardens a little further afield. The Underground and Overground services at Gunnersbury station as well as several major bus routes provide great public transport links, while the nearby A4, M4 and A306 give drivers access into, out of and around the capital. In the immediate vicinity of Grange Road is the popular Ozwald Copperpot coffee shop, a Co-op convenience store and a Virgin Active health club. A Sainsbury's supermarket and many shops, restaurants and cafes offer more choice nearby on Chiswick High Road. The nearest three primary schools, Belmont, Grove Park and Strand on the Green, have all been rated Outstanding by Ofsted. For secondary education, Chiswick School is rated Good by Ofsted and the independent International School London is close by and Latymer Upper School, Godolphin & Latymer School, St Paul's School for Girls and St Paul's School are a short bus or tube ride away (St Paul's Boys and Junior schools are currently providing a shuttle bus from the Hammersmith Apollo while the bridge is closed).

detailedDescription:
An end of terrace property boasting of larger than average accommodation and recently refurbished throughout. **Planning Permission Approved** for a double storey side extension to convert this property into a five bedroom house and comes with no onward chain!

Finished with a contemporary and tasteful décor the property comprises of three double bedrooms, a through lounge, large and stylish kitchen/ diner, family bathroom suite and loft room for storage. To the outside is rear garden with two store rooms, side access and a front garden with additional off street parking.

A parade of shops on the adjacent Edensor Road provides residents with access to convenient local amenities, and residents can access an outstanding selection of independent and high street shops, cafes, and restaurants close by on the Chiswick High Road. Chiswick Mainline station, Turnham Green Underground station, and the A4/M4 provide commuters with nearby transport links into and out of the city centre.

Description
This lovely one bedroom end of terrace house is located in Feltham on a Cul De Sac is now available. Perfect for a first time buyer or a investment. This property consists of an open plan kitchen living room. Upstairs you will find a modern shower room as well as a double bedroom. Outside you will find a private garden located to the side of the property as well as a single garage in a separate block.

Appleby Gardens is located at the end of Feltham high street, being just a short commute away from the town centre giving you access to unlimited shops, buses and most importantly Feltham train station getting you into Waterloo in approx. 25 mins. You have the additional benefit of being on the H26 bus route giving you a direct route to Hatton cross underground station. Bedfont Lakes, which is a nature reserve with long walks and beautiful scenery, are only a short drive away.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks are excited to introduce this immaculately presented, two double bedroom and two bathroom apartment on the second floor, with views from the living room and balcony over South Acton Park.
This light-filled apartment comprises of an entrance hallway and built in storage cupboards, two large double bedrooms with one en-suite shower off the main bedroom, a modern family bathroom and a spacious open plan living/kitchen with floor-to-ceiling windows with the aforementioned views over the park.
The property is sold with no onward chain and boasts a long lease of over 242 years.
Viewings are by appointment only and are still currently accepted under Government guidance.

Location

Acton Gardens is a contemporary development in Acton, located on the borders of Chiswick with many local amenities a short walking distance from the property, including supermarkets, cafés, bars, restaurants and delivery at Acton High Street. The property is also directly overlooking South Acton Park.

The property is ideally suited for the work commute with South Acton Rail and Acton Town in close proximity, offering Piccadilly, District or Overground services in and out of London - both approx 0.1 and 0.3 miles away respectively.

Additionally, the area is primed for education with a good choice of local schools, including; Berrymede Junior School, Berrymede Infant School, Ark Acton Academy and Primary (outstanding ofsted) and Twyford Church of England High School (outstanding ofsted) to name just a few.

detailedDescription:
Summary
A first floor maisonette in a popular residential area close to Feltham Mainline Train station. Offered with no chain, good condition, this property would suit any first time buyer or investor. The property also benefits from a private rear garden and on street parking, walking distance to shops.

Description
The property comprises welcoming entrance hall with all rooms spanning off it. The sellers have transformed the loft space into a workable office space, this could also be used as a bedroom. The original flooring throughout has been refurbished recently creating a homely feeling. The reception room is of a good size with bay window to the front and built in TV unit. The kitchen has many cupboards for storage and an area for a large fridge, along with gas hob, sink and draining board. There is also additional space for the dishwasher. The bathroom is comprised of a three-piece white suite. There are two bedrooms, one at the front of the property and one to the rear.

Amesbury Road is set off Uxbridge Road where you will find the 285 and 490 bus routes to Heathrow Airport, Kingston, and Richmond. Other bus routes which are walking distance from the property include the 111 and H25 on Hounslow Road and 235 to Brentford from Feltham High Street. Feltham Mainline Train Station is only a 1 mile walk away which serves London Waterloo (with connection to Bank) in under 30 minutes. Property is located in a quiet residential area with plenty of green spaces to walk around but also in close proximity to Airparcs Leisure Centre, Entertainment Park with cinemas and bowling hall and outstanding schools (including catchment area for Reach Academy Feltham and Tiffin Grammar School for Boys/Girls Kingston). This property is an ideal investment or home for first time buyer.

detailedDescription:
Move Inn Estates brings to the market this bright and spacious ground floor one bedroom flat with a private garden, in a the heart of Heston. An ideal first time purchase or buy to let investment, this bright and spacious one bedroom apartment offers plenty of living and entertaining space and boasts luxury kitchen and bathroom, along with a private garden, long lease, mechanical ventilation system with heat recovery (contributing to very low running costs) and secure phone entry.

Built approximately three years ago and presented in show home like condition the new buyer will benefit from the remaining NHBC guarantee (ten years from new).

The property benefits from an allocated parking space with plenty of additional parking for visitors.

There are well maintained communal gardens and the communal areas of the block are bright and well maintained. The apartment benefits from secure video phone entry, along with a secure communal bike shed/storage area.

The modern kitchen, open plan to the reception room has an integrated washer/dryer, fridge/freezer, Bosch gas hob and Bosch electric oven, granite effect worktops, double sink and a range of base and eye level units. The bedroom is a generously sized double room; benefiting ample room and storage as well as having the simplicity of its very own patio door leading onto the private garden ideal for the summer. The bathroom comprises a bath with shower above, wash hand basin with mixer tap, W.C, spotlights, electric shaver point and extractor fan.

Lease: 119 years
Service charge: £1,320/pa
Ground Rent: £250/pa

Built approximately three years ago and presented in show home like condition the new buyer will benefit from the remaining NHBC guarantee (ten years from new).

The property benefits from an allocated parking space with plenty of additional parking for visitors.

There are well maintained communal gardens and the communal areas of the block are bright and well maintained. The apartment benefits from secure video phone entry, along with a secure communal bike shed/storage area.
Location

A hugely convenient location with easy access to Hounslow, Heston, Hayes and Southall. Easy access to Heathrow and close to A4 and M4 road routes for access into and away from London. Hounslow West tube is within easy reach and there are a number of bus routes within walking distance.
The property is also within easy reach of both Hayes & Harlington and Southall stations, both of which will benefit from the addition of the Crossrail route (Elizabeth Line), due to open later in the year.
The apartment

Set on the ground floor, the apartment is bright and spacious with a wide and welcoming entrance hall providing access to all rooms. The open plan living room and kitchen, running the full length of the property is an ideal spot to entertain and provides access onto your very own private garden.

The modern kitchen, open plan to the reception room has an integrated washer/dryer, fridge/freezer, Bosch gas hob and Bosch electric oven, granite effect worktops, double sink and a range of base and eye level units. The bedroom is a generously sized double room; benefiting ample room and storage as well as having the simplicity of its very own patio door leading onto the private garden ideal for the summer. The bathroom comprises a bath with shower above, wash hand basin with mixer tap, W.C, spotlights, electric shaver point and extractor fan.

Lease: 121 years
Service charge: £1,320/pa
Ground Rent: £250/pa

Contact us today to book a viewing and to find out more.

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from £82,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

Property Description

50% Share of Ownership or 100% at £210,000. A modern one-bedroom apartment situated in a sought-after development in the heart of Feltham town centre, located just over the road from Feltham mainline station with frequent trains into Richmond, Waterloo and Windsor. It is positioned next to Asda and The Centre retail park and is also just a few minutes’ walk from the Leisure West development including the Cineworld complex, ten pin bowling and many restaurants. The property comprises of a spacious hallway with large storage cupboards, a modern open plan kitchen/ living room with built in appliances and opening onto a ‘Juliette’ balcony, a double bedroom and a three-piece bathroom. The property also benefits from lift services and is accessed via a security video entry system. Viewings highly recommended! Viewings can be booked 24/7 via

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
This lovely 1930s' family home offers great potential and is located in a quiet residential road on the Whitton borders. In brief offers 3 bedrooms, through lounge, fitted kitchen and modern bathroom w/c with additional separate w/c. Other benefits include off street parking and an approx 43ft long rear garden with outbuilding. EPC Grade D.

Situation
The property is situated in a residential road on the Whitton borders and is walking distance to Hounslow and Whitton High Streets with a wide range of shops for your convenience and Whitton and Hounslow mainline Stations which serve London Waterloo. The property is also located in close proximity to Murray Park. The local Infant and Junior School are Hounslow Town and Chatsworth. The local secondary Schools would be St Mark's Catholic School and Heathland. Another benefit is the local 24 hour bus route the 281.

This two bedroom ground floor garden flat is perfect for anyone looking to refurbish a flat to make it their own. The flat has a short lease.

Moving down the hall to the next right you have the current master bedroom. Which could be turned into a generous second bedroom.

There is storage located under the stairs, and directly opposite is the current second bedroom and parrallel to this is the bathroom.

Heading down to the second reception that leads straight through to the kitchen, you get to the garden. This is perfect for a possible side return, subject to planning, and the legnthy east facing garden, which would get the morning sun.

Emlyn Road is a popular residential street located close to the green spaces of Wendell Park, Stamford Brook Common and Ravenscourt Park. Families benefit from a selection of great local schools which include Wendell Park Primary, The Good Shepherd Primary, Southfield Primary and Orchard House School. When it comes to transport, the district line at Stamford Brook station and Turnham Green station are both a short walk away, and by car, the A40 is a short drive away, providing easy access in and out of Central London. Chiswick High Road and Westfield are both close by for shopping and restaurants. Viewings are highly recommended!
